롬 15:13 I pray that God, the source of hope, will fill you completely with joy and peace because you trust in him. Then you will overflow with confident hope through the power of the Holy Spirit.
롬 15:14 I am fully convinced, my dear brothers and sisters①, that you are full of goodness. You know these things so well you can teach each other all about them. / ①Greek brothers; also in 15.30
롬 15:15 Even so, I have been bold enough to write about some of these points, knowing that all you need is this reminder. For by God's grace,
롬 15:16 I am a special messenger from Christ Jesus to you Gentiles. I bring you the Good News so that I might present you as an acceptable offering to God, made holy by the Holy Spirit.
롬 15:17 So I have reason to be enthusiastic about all Christ Jesus has done through me in my service to God.
롬 15:18 Yet I dare not boast about anything except what Christ has done through me, bringing the Gentiles to God by my message and by the way I worked among them.
롬 15:19 They were convinced by the power of miraculous signs and wonders and by the power of God's Spirit①. In this way, I have fully presented the Good News of Christ from Jerusalem all the way to Illyricum②. / ①Other manuscripts read the Spirit; still others read the Holy Spirit ②Illyricum was a region northeast of Italy
롬 15:20 My ambition has always been to preach the Good News where the name of Christ has never been heard, rather than where a church has already been started by someone else.
롬 15:21 I have been following the plan spoken of in the Scriptures, where it says, "Those who have never been told about him will see, and those who have never heard of him will understand."① / ①Isa 52.15 (Greek version)
롬 15:22 In fact, my visit to you has been delayed so long because I have been preaching in these places.
롬 15:23 But now I have finished my work in these regions, and after all these long years of waiting, I am eager to visit you.
롬 15:24 I am planning to go to Spain, and when I do, I will stop off in Rome. And after I have enjoyed your fellowship for a little while, you can provide for my journey.
롬 15:25 But before I come, I must go to Jerusalem to take a gift to the believers① there. / ①Greek God's holy people; also in 15.26, 31
롬 15:26 For you see, the believers in Macedonia and Achaia① have eagerly taken up an offering for the poor among the believers in Jerusalem. / ①Macedonia and Achaia were the northern and southern regions of Greece.
롬 15:27 They were glad to do this because they feel they owe a real debt to them. Since the Gentiles received the spiritual blessings of the Good News from the believers in Jerusalem, they feel the least they can do in return is to help them financially.
롬 15:28 As soon as I have delivered this money and completed this good deed of theirs, I will come to see you on my way to Spain.
롬 15:29 And I am sure that when I come, Christ will richly bless our time together.
롬 15:30 Dear brothers and sisters, I urge you in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to join in my struggle by praying to God for me. Do this because of your love for me, given to you by the Holy Spirit.
롬 15:31 Pray that I will be rescued from those in Judea who refuse to obey God. Pray also that the believers there will be willing to accept the donation① I am taking to Jerusalem.
롬 15:32 Then, by the will of God, I will be able to come to you with a joyful heart, and we will be an encouragement to each other.
롬 15:33 And now may God, who gives us his peace, be with you all. Amen.① / ①Some manuscripts omit Amen. One very early manuscript places 16.25-27 here
롬 16:1 I commend to you our sister Phoebe, who is a deacon in the church in Cenchrea.
롬 16:2 Welcome her in the Lord as one who is worthy of honor among God's people. Help her in whatever she needs, for she has been helpful to many, and especially to me.
롬 16:3 Give my greetings to Priscilla and Aquila, my co-workers in the ministry of Christ Jesus.
롬 16:4 In fact, they once risked their lives for me. I am thankful to them, and so are all the Gentile churches.
롬 16:5 Also give my greetings to the church that meets in their home. Greet my dear friend Epenetus. He was the first person from the province of Asia to become a follower of Christ.
롬 16:6 Give my greetings to Mary, who has worked so hard for your benefit.
롬 16:7 Greet Andronicus and Junia①, my fellow Jews②, who were in prison with me. They are highly respected among the apostles and became followers of Christ before I did. / ①Junia is a feminine name. Some late manuscripts accent the word so it reads Junias, a masculine name; still others read Julia (feminine) ②Or compatriots; also in 16.21
롬 16:8 Greet Ampliatus, my dear friend in the Lord.
롬 16:9 Greet Urbanus, our co-worker in Christ, and my dear friend Stachys.
롬 16:10 Greet Apelles, a good man whom Christ approves. And give my greetings to the believers from the household of Aristobulus.
롬 16:11 Greet Herodion, my fellow Jew①. Greet the Lord's people from the household of Narcissus. / ①Or compatriot
롬 16:12 Give my greetings to Tryphena and Tryphosa, the Lord's workers, and to dear Persis, who has worked so hard for the Lord.
롬 16:13 Greet Rufus, whom the Lord picked out to be his very own; and also his dear mother, who has been a mother to me.
롬 16:14 Give my greetings to Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brothers and sisters① who meet with them. / ①Greek brothers
롬 16:15 Give my greetings to Philologus, Julia, Nereus and his sister, and to Olympas and all the believers① who meet with them. / ①Greek all of God's holy people
롬 16:16 Greet each other in Christian love①. All the churches of Christ send you their greetings. / ①Greek with a sacred kiss
롬 16:17 And now I make one more appeal, my dear brothers and sisters①. Watch out for people who cause divisions and upset people's faith by teaching things contrary to what you have been taught. Stay away from them. / ①Greek brothers
롬 16:18 Such people are not serving Christ our Lord; they are serving their own personal interests. By smooth talk and glowing words they deceive innocent people.
롬 16:19 But everyone knows that you are obedient to the Lord. This makes me very happy. I want you to be wise in doing right and to stay innocent of any wrong.
롬 16:20 The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet. May the grace of our Lord Jesus① be with you. / ①Some manuscripts read Lord Jesus Christ
롬 16:21 Timothy, my fellow worker, sends you his greetings, as do Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my fellow Jews.
롬 16:22 I, Tertius, the one writing this letter for Paul, send my greetings, too, as one of the Lord's followers.
롬 16:23 Gaius says hello to you. He is my host and also serves as host to the whole church. Erastus, the city treasurer, sends you his greetings, and so does our brother Quartus.①
롬 16:24 ① / ①Some manuscripts add verse 24, May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen. Still others add this sentence after verse 27.
롬 16:25 Now all glory to God, who is able to make you strong, just as my Good News says. This message about Jesus Christ has revealed his plan for you Gentiles, a plan kept secret from the beginning of time.
롬 16:26 But now as the prophets① foretold and as the eternal God has commanded, this message is made known to all Gentiles everywhere, so that they too might believe and obey him. / ①Greek the prophetic writings
롬 16:27 All glory to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ, forever. Amen.
1Corinthians
고전 1:1 This letter is from Paul, chosen by the will of God to be an apostle of Christ Jesus, and from our brother Sosthenes.
고전 1:2 I am writing to God's church in Corinth①, to you who have been called by God to be his own holy people. He made you holy by means of Christ Jesus②, just as he did for all people everywhere who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, their Lord and ours. / ①Corinth was the capital city of Achaia, the southern region of the Greek peninsula ②Or because you belong to Christ Jesus
고전 1:3 May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace.
고전 1:4 I always thank my God for you and for the gracious gifts he has given you, now that you belong to Christ Jesus.
고전 1:5 Through him, God has enriched your church in every way - with all of your eloquent words and all of your knowledge.
고전 1:6 This confirms that what I told you about Christ is true.
고전 1:7 Now you have every spiritual gift you need as you eagerly wait for the return of our Lord Jesus Christ.
고전 1:8 He will keep you strong to the end so that you will be free from all blame on the day when our Lord Jesus Christ returns.
고전 1:9 God will do this, for he is faithful to do what he says, and he has invited you into partnership with his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.
고전 1:10 I appeal to you, dear brothers and sisters①, by the authority of our Lord Jesus Christ, to live in harmony with each other. Let there be no divisions in the church. Rather, be of one mind, united in thought and purpose. / ①Greek brothers; also in 1.11, 26
고전 1:11 For some members of Chloe's household have told me about your quarrels, my dear brothers and sisters.
고전 1:12 Some of you are saying, "I am a follower of Paul." Others are saying, "I follow Apollos," or "I follow Peter①," or "I follow only Christ." / ①Greek Cephas
고전 1:13 Has Christ been divided into factions? Was I, Paul, crucified for you? Were any of you baptized in the name of Paul? Of course not!
고전 1:14 I thank God that I did not baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius,
고전 1:15 for now no one can say they were baptized in my name.
고전 1:16 (Oh yes, I also baptized the household of Stephanas, but I don't remember baptizing anyone else.)
고전 1:17 For Christ didn't send me to baptize, but to preach the Good News?and not with clever speech, for fear that the cross of Christ would lose its power.
고전 1:18 The message of the cross is foolish to those who are headed for destruction! But we who are being saved know it is the very power of God.
고전 1:19 As the Scriptures say, "I will destroy the wisdom of the wise and discard the intelligence of the intelligent."① / ①Isa 29.14
고전 1:20 So where does this leave the philosophers, the scholars, and the world's brilliant debaters? God has made the wisdom of this world look foolish.
고전 1:21 Since God in his wisdom saw to it that the world would never know him through human wisdom, he has used our foolish preaching to save those who believe.
고전 1:22 It is foolish to the Jews, who ask for signs from heaven. And it is foolish to the Greeks, who seek human wisdom.
고전 1:23 So when we preach that Christ was crucified, the Jews are offended and the Gentiles say it's all nonsense.
고전 1:24 But to those called by God to salvation, both Jews and Gentiles①, Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God. / ①Greek and Greeks
고전 1:25 This foolish plan of God is wiser than the wisest of human plans, and God's weakness is stronger than the greatest of human strength.
고전 1:26 Remember, dear brothers and sisters, that few of you were wise in the world's eyes or powerful or wealthy① when God called you. / ①Or high born
고전 1:27 Instead, God chose things the world considers foolish in order to shame those who think they are wise. And he chose things that are powerless to shame those who are powerful.
고전 1:28 God chose things despised by the world①, things counted as nothing at all, and used them to bring to nothing what the world considers important. / ①Or God chose those who are low born
고전 1:29 As a result, no one can ever boast in the presence of God.
고전 1:30 God has united you with Christ Jesus. For our benefit God made him to be wisdom itself. Christ made us right with God; he made us pure and holy, and he freed us from sin.
고전 1:31 Therefore, as the Scriptures say, "If you want to boast, boast only about the LORD."① / ①Jer 9.24
고전 2:1 When I first came to you, dear brothers and sisters①, I didn't use lofty words and impressive wisdom to tell you God's secret plan②. / ①Greek brothers ②Greek God's mystery; other manuscripts read God's testimony
고전 2:2 For I decided that while I was with you I would forget everything except Jesus Christ, the one who was crucified.
고전 2:3 I came to you in weakness?timid and trembling.
고전 2:4 And my message and my preaching were very plain. Rather than using clever and persuasive speeches, I relied only on the power of the Holy Spirit.
고전 2:5 I did this so you would trust not in human wisdom but in the power of God.
고전 2:6 Yet when I am among mature believers, I do speak with words of wisdom, but not the kind of wisdom that belongs to this world or to the rulers of this world, who are soon forgotten.
고전 2:7 No, the wisdom we speak of is the mystery of God① - his plan that was previously hidden, even though he made it for our ultimate glory before the world began. / ①Greek But we speak God's wisdom in a mystery
고전 2:8 But the rulers of this world have not understood it; if they had, they would not have crucified our glorious Lord.
고전 2:9 That is what the Scriptures mean when they say, "No eye has seen, no ear has heard, and no mind has imagined what God has prepared for those who love him."① / ①Isa 64.4
고전 2:10 But① it was to us that God revealed these things by his Spirit. For his Spirit searches out everything and shows us God's deep secrets. / ①Some manuscripts read For
고전 2:11 No one can know a person's thoughts except that person's own spirit, and no one can know God's thoughts except God's own Spirit.
고전 2:12 And we have received God's Spirit (not the world's spirit), so we can know the wonderful things God has freely given us.
고전 2:13 When we tell you these things, we do not use words that come from human wisdom. Instead, we speak words given to us by the Spirit, using the Spirit's words to explain spiritual truths①. / ①Or explaining spiritual truths in spiritual language, or explaining spiritual truths to spiritual people
고전 2:14 But people who aren't spiritual① can't receive these truths from God's Spirit. It all sounds foolish to them and they can't understand it, for only those who are spiritual can understand what the Spirit means. / ①Or who don't have the Spirit; or who have only physical life
고전 2:15 Those who are spiritual can evaluate all things, but they themselves cannot be evaluated by others.
고전 2:16 For, "Who can know the LORD's thoughts? Who knows enough to teach him?"① But we understand these things, for we have the mind of Christ. / ①Isa 40.13 (Greek version)
고전 3:1 Dear brothers and sisters①, when I was with you I couldn't talk to you as I would to spiritual people②. I had to talk as though you belonged to this world or as though you were infants in the Christian life③. / ①Greek Brothers ②Or to people who have the Spirit ③Greek in Christ
고전 3:2 I had to feed you with milk, not with solid food, because you weren't ready for anything stronger. And you still aren't ready,
고전 3:3 for you are still controlled by your sinful nature. You are jealous of one another and quarrel with each other. Doesn't that prove you are controlled by your sinful nature? Aren't you living like people of the world?
고전 3:4 When one of you says, "I am a follower of Paul," and another says, "I follow Apollos," aren't you acting just like people of the world?
고전 3:5 After all, who is Apollos? Who is Paul? We are only God's servants through whom you believed the Good News. Each of us did the work the Lord gave us.
고전 3:6 I planted the seed in your hearts, and Apollos watered it, but it was God who made it grow.
고전 3:7 It's not important who does the planting, or who does the watering. What's important is that God makes the seed grow.
고전 3:8 The one who plants and the one who waters work together with the same purpose. And both will be rewarded for their own hard work.
고전 3:9 For we are both God's workers. And you are God's field. You are God's building.
고전 3:10 Because of God's grace to me, I have laid the foundation like an expert builder. Now others are building on it. But whoever is building on this foundation must be very careful.
고전 3:11 For no one can lay any foundation other than the one we already have?Jesus Christ.
고전 3:12 Anyone who builds on that foundation may use a variety of materials?gold, silver, jewels, wood, hay, or straw.
고전 3:13 But on the judgment day, fire will reveal what kind of work each builder has done. The fire will show if a person's work has any value.
고전 3:14 If the work survives, that builder will receive a reward.
고전 3:15 But if the work is burned up, the builder will suffer great loss. The builder will be saved, but like someone barely escaping through a wall of flames.
고전 3:16 Don't you realize that all of you together are the temple of God and that the Spirit of God lives in① you? / ①Or among
고전 3:17 God will destroy anyone who destroys this temple. For God's temple is holy, and you are that temple.
고전 3:18 Stop deceiving yourselves. If you think you are wise by this world's standards, you need to become a fool to be truly wise.
고전 3:19 For the wisdom of this world is foolishness to God. As the Scriptures say, "He traps the wise in the snare of their own cleverness."① / ①Job 5.13
고전 3:20 And again, "The LORD knows the thoughts of the wise; he knows they are worthless."① / ①Ps 94.11
고전 3:21 So don't boast about following a particular human leader. For everything belongs to you?
고전 3:22 whether Paul or Apollos or Peter①, or the world, or life and death, or the present and the future. Everything belongs to you, / ①Greek Cephas
고전 3:23 and you belong to Christ, and Christ belongs to God.
고전 4:1 So look at Apollos and me as mere servants of Christ who have been put in charge of explaining God's mysteries.
고전 4:2 Now, a person who is put in charge as a manager must be faithful.
고전 4:3 As for me, it matters very little how I might be evaluated by you or by any human authority. I don't even trust my own judgment on this point.
고전 4:4 My conscience is clear, but that doesn't prove I'm right. It is the Lord himself who will examine me and decide.
고전 4:5 So don't make judgments about anyone ahead of time?before the Lord returns. For he will bring our darkest secrets to light and will reveal our private motives. Then God will give to each one whatever praise is due.
고전 4:6 Dear brothers and sisters①, I have used Apollos and myself to illustrate what I've been saying. If you pay attention to what I have quoted from the Scriptures②, you won't be proud of one of your leaders at the expense of another. / ①Greek Brothers ②Or If you learn not to go beyond "what is written"
고전 4:7 For what gives you the right to make such a judgment? What do you have that God hasn't given you? And if everything you have is from God, why boast as though it were not a gift?
고전 4:8 You think you already have everything you need. You think you are already rich. You have begun to reign in God's kingdom without us! I wish you really were reigning already, for then we would be reigning with you.
고전 4:9 Instead, I sometimes think God has put us apostles on display, like prisoners of war at the end of a victor's parade, condemned to die. We have become a spectacle to the entire world?to people and angels alike.
고전 4:10 Our dedication to Christ makes us look like fools, but you claim to be so wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are so powerful! You are honored, but we are ridiculed.
고전 4:11 Even now we go hungry and thirsty, and we don't have enough clothes to keep warm. We are often beaten and have no home.
고전 4:12 We work wearily with our own hands to earn our living. We bless those who curse us. We are patient with those who abuse us.
고전 4:13 We appeal gently when evil things are said about us. Yet we are treated like the world's garbage, like everybody's trash?right up to the present moment.
고전 4:14 I am not writing these things to shame you, but to warn you as my beloved children.
고전 4:15 For even if you had ten thousand others to teach you about Christ, you have only one spiritual father. For I became your father in Christ Jesus when I preached the Good News to you.
고전 4:16 So I urge you to imitate me.
고전 4:17 That's why I have sent Timothy, my beloved and faithful child in the Lord. He will remind you of how I follow Christ Jesus, just as I teach in all the churches wherever I go.
고전 4:18 Some of you have become arrogant, thinking I will not visit you again.
고전 4:19 But I will come?and soon?if the Lord lets me, and then I'll find out whether these arrogant people just give pretentious speeches or whether they really have God's power.
고전 4:20 For the Kingdom of God is not just a lot of talk; it is living by God's power.
고전 4:21 Which do you choose? Should I come with a rod to punish you, or should I come with love and a gentle spirit?
고전 5:1 I can hardly believe the report about the sexual immorality going on among you?something that even pagans don't do. I am told that a man in your church is living in sin with his stepmother①. / ①Greek his father's wife
고전 5:2 You are so proud of yourselves, but you should be mourning in sorrow and shame. And you should remove this man from your fellowship.
고전 5:3 Even though I am not with you in person, I am with you in the Spirit①. And as though I were there, I have already passed judgment on this man / ①Or in spirit
고전 5:4 in the name of the Lord Jesus. You must call a meeting of the church①. I will be present with you in spirit, and so will the power of our Lord Jesus. / ①Or In the name of the Lord Jesus, you must call a meeting of the church
고전 5:5 Then you must throw this man out and hand him over to Satan so that his sinful nature will be destroyed① and he himself② will be saved on the day the Lord③ returns. / ①Or so that his body will be destroyed; Greek reads for the destruction of the flesh ②Greek and the spirit ③Other manuscripts read the Lord Jesus; still others read our Lord Jesus Christ
고전 5:6 Your boasting about this is terrible. Don't you realize that this sin is like a little yeast that spreads through the whole batch of dough?
고전 5:7 Get rid of the old "yeast" by removing this wicked person from among you. Then you will be like a fresh batch of dough made without yeast, which is what you really are. Christ, our Passover Lamb, has been sacrificed for us①. / ①Greek has been sacrificed
고전 5:8 So let us celebrate the festival, not with the old bread① of wickedness and evil, but with the new bread② of sincerity and truth. / ①Greek not with old leaven ②Greek but with unleavened [bread]
고전 5:9 When I wrote to you before, I told you not to associate with people who indulge in sexual sin.
고전 5:10 But I wasn't talking about unbelievers who indulge in sexual sin, or are greedy, or cheat people, or worship idols. You would have to leave this world to avoid people like that.
고전 5:11 I meant that you are not to associate with anyone who claims to be a believer① yet indulges in sexual sin, or is greedy, or worships idols, or is abusive, or is a drunkard, or cheats people. Don't even eat with such people. / ①Greek a brother
고전 5:12 It isn't my responsibility to judge outsiders, but it certainly is your responsibility to judge those inside the church who are sinning.
고전 5:13 God will judge those on the outside; but as the Scriptures say, "You must remove the evil person from among you."① / ①Deut 17.7
고전 6:1 When one of you has a dispute with another believer, how dare you file a lawsuit and ask a secular court to decide the matter instead of taking it to other believers①! / ①Greek God's holy people; also in 6.2
고전 6:2 Don't you realize that someday we believers will judge the world? And since you are going to judge the world, can't you decide even these little things among yourselves?
고전 6:3 Don't you realize that we will judge angels? So you should surely be able to resolve ordinary disputes in this life.
고전 6:4 If you have legal disputes about such matters, why go to outside judges who are not respected by the church?
고전 6:5 I am saying this to shame you. Isn't there anyone in all the church who is wise enough to decide these issues?
고전 6:6 But instead, one believer① sues another - right in front of unbelievers! / ①Greek one brother
고전 6:7 Even to have such lawsuits with one another is a defeat for you. Why not just accept the injustice and leave it at that? Why not let yourselves be cheated?
고전 6:8 Instead, you yourselves are the ones who do wrong and cheat even your fellow believers①. / ①Greek even the brothers
고전 6:9 Don't you realize that those who do wrong will not inherit the Kingdom of God? Don't fool yourselves. Those who indulge in sexual sin, or who worship idols, or commit adultery, or are male prostitutes, or practice homosexuality,
고전 6:10 or are thieves, or greedy people, or drunkards, or are abusive, or cheat people?none of these will inherit the Kingdom of God.
고전 6:11 Some of you were once like that. But you were cleansed; you were made holy; you were made right with God by calling on the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God.
고전 6:12 You say, "I am allowed to do anything"?but not everything is good for you. And even though "I am allowed to do anything," I must not become a slave to anything.
고전 6:13 You say, "Food was made for the stomach, and the stomach for food." (This is true, though someday God will do away with both of them.) But you can't say that our bodies were made for sexual immorality. They were made for the Lord, and the Lord cares about our bodies.
고전 6:14 And God will raise us from the dead by his power, just as he raised our Lord from the dead.
고전 6:15 Don't you realize that your bodies are actually parts of Christ? Should a man take his body, which is part of Christ, and join it to a prostitute? Never!
고전 6:16 And don't you realize that if a man joins himself to a prostitute, he becomes one body with her? For the Scriptures say, "The two are united into one."① / ①Gen 2.24
고전 6:17 But the person who is joined to the Lord is one spirit with him.
고전 6:18 Run from sexual sin! No other sin so clearly affects the body as this one does. For sexual immorality is a sin against your own body.
고전 6:19 Don't you realize that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit, who lives in you and was given to you by God? You do not belong to yourself,
고전 6:20 for God bought you with a high price. So you must honor God with your body.
고전 7:1 Now regarding the questions you asked in your letter. Yes, it is good to live a celibate life①. / ①Greek It is good for a man not to touch a woman
고전 7:2 But because there is so much sexual immorality, each man should have his own wife, and each woman should have her own husband.
고전 7:3 The husband should fulfill his wife's sexual needs, and the wife should fulfill her husband's needs.
고전 7:4 The wife gives authority over her body to her husband, and the husband gives authority over his body to his wife.
고전 7:5 Do not deprive each other of sexual relations, unless you both agree to refrain from sexual intimacy for a limited time so you can give yourselves more completely to prayer. Afterward, you should come together again so that Satan won't be able to tempt you because of your lack of self-control.
고전 7:6 I say this as a concession, not as a command.
고전 7:7 But I wish everyone were single, just as I am. But God gives to some the gift of marriage, and to others the gift of singleness.
고전 7:8 So I say to those who aren't married and to widows?it's better to stay unmarried, just as I am.
고전 7:9 But if they can't control themselves, they should go ahead and marry. It's better to marry than to burn with lust.
고전 7:10 But for those who are married, I have a command that comes not from me, but from the Lord①. A wife must not leave her husband. / ①See Matt 5.32; 19.9; Mark 10.11-12; Luke 16.18
고전 7:11 But if she does leave him, let her remain single or else be reconciled to him. And the husband must not leave his wife.
고전 7:12 Now, I will speak to the rest of you, though I do not have a direct command from the Lord. If a Christian man① has a wife who is not a believer and she is willing to continue living with him, he must not leave her. / ①Greek a brother
고전 7:13 And if a Christian woman has a husband who is not a believer and he is willing to continue living with her, she must not leave him.
고전 7:14 For the Christian wife brings holiness to her marriage, and the Christian husband① brings holiness to his marriage. Otherwise, your children would not be holy, but now they are holy. / ①Greek the brother
고전 7:15 [But if the husband or wife who isn't a believer insists on leaving, let them go. In such cases the Christian husband or wife① is no longer bound to the other, for God has called you② to live in peace.] / ①Greek the brother or sister ②Some manuscripts read us
고전 7:16 Don't you wives realize that your husbands might be saved because of you? And don't you husbands realize that your wives might be saved because of you?
고전 7:17 Each of you should continue to live in whatever situation the Lord has placed you, and remain as you were when God first called you. This is my rule for all the churches.
고전 7:18 For instance, a man who was circumcised before he became a believer should not try to reverse it. And the man who was uncircumcised when he became a believer should not be circumcised now.
고전 7:19 For it makes no difference whether or not a man has been circumcised. The important thing is to keep God's commandments.
고전 7:20 Yes, each of you should remain as you were when God called you.
고전 7:21 Are you a slave? Don't let that worry you?but if you get a chance to be free, take it.
고전 7:22 And remember, if you were a slave when the Lord called you, you are now free in the Lord. And if you were free when the Lord called you, you are now a slave of Christ.
고전 7:23 God paid a high price for you, so don't be enslaved by the world①. / ①Greek don't become slaves of people
고전 7:24 Each of you, dear brothers and sisters①, should remain as you were when God first called you. / ①Greek brothers; also in 7.29
고전 7:25 Now regarding your question about the young women who are not yet married. I do not have a command from the Lord for them. But the Lord in his mercy has given me wisdom that can be trusted, and I will share it with you.
고전 7:26 Because of the present crisis①, I think it is best to remain as you are. / ①Or the pressures of life
고전 7:27 If you have a wife, do not seek to end the marriage. If you do not have a wife, do not seek to get married.
고전 7:28 But if you do get married, it is not a sin. And if a young woman gets married, it is not a sin. However, those who get married at this time will have troubles, and I am trying to spare you those problems.
고전 7:29 But let me say this, dear brothers and sisters： The time that remains is very short. So from now on, those with wives should not focus only on their marriage.
고전 7:30 Those who weep or who rejoice or who buy things should not be absorbed by their weeping or their joy or their possessions.
고전 7:31 Those who use the things of the world should not become attached to them. For this world as we know it will soon pass away.
고전 7:32 I want you to be free from the concerns of this life. An unmarried man can spend his time doing the Lord's work and thinking how to please him.
고전 7:33 But a married man has to think about his earthly responsibilities and how to please his wife.
고전 7:34 His interests are divided. In the same way, a woman who is no longer married or has never been married can be devoted to the Lord and holy in body and in spirit. But a married woman has to think about her earthly responsibilities and how to please her husband.
고전 7:35 I am saying this for your benefit, not to place restrictions on you. I want you to do whatever will help you serve the Lord best, with as few distractions as possible.
고전 7:36 But if a man thinks that he's treating his fiancee improperly and will inevitably give in to his passion, let him marry her as he wishes. It is not a sin.
고전 7:37 But if he has decided firmly not to marry and there is no urgency and he can control his passion, he does well not to marry.
고전 7:38 So the person who marries his fiancee does well, and the person who doesn't marry does even better.
고전 7:39 A wife is bound to her husband as long as he lives. If her husband dies, she is free to marry anyone she wishes, but only if he loves the Lord①. / ①Greek but only in the Lord
고전 7:40 But in my opinion it would be better for her to stay single, and I think I am giving you counsel from God's Spirit when I say this.
고전 8:1 Now regarding your question about food that has been offered to idols. Yes, we know that "we all have knowledge" about this issue. But while knowledge makes us feel important, it is love that strengthens the church.
고전 8:2 Anyone who claims to know all the answers doesn't really know very much.
고전 8:3 But the person who loves God is the one whom God recognizes①. / ①Some manuscripts read the person who loves has full knowledge
고전 8:4 So, what about eating meat that has been offered to idols? Well, we all know that an idol is not really a god and that there is only one God.
고전 8:5 There may be so-called gods both in heaven and on earth, and some people actually worship many gods and many lords.
고전 8:6 But we know that there is only one God, the Father, who created everything, and we live for him. And there is only one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom God made everything and through whom we have been given life.
고전 8:7 However, not all believers know this. Some are accustomed to thinking of idols as being real, so when they eat food that has been offered to idols, they think of it as the worship of real gods, and their weak consciences are violated.
고전 8:8 It's true that we can't win God's approval by what we eat. We don't lose anything if we don't eat it, and we don't gain anything if we do.
고전 8:9 But you must be careful so that your freedom does not cause others with a weaker conscience to stumble.
고전 8:10 For if others see you?with your "superior knowledge"?eating in the temple of an idol, won't they be encouraged to violate their conscience by eating food that has been offered to an idol?
고전 8:11 So because of your superior knowledge, a weak believer① for whom Christ died will be destroyed. / ①Greek brother; also in 8.13
고전 8:12 And when you sin against other believers① by encouraging them to do something they believe is wrong, you are sinning against Christ. / ①Greek brothers
고전 8:13 So if what I eat causes another believer to sin, I will never eat meat again as long as I live?for I don't want to cause another believer to stumble.
고전 9:1 Am I not as free as anyone else? Am I not an apostle? Haven't I seen Jesus our Lord with my own eyes? Isn't it because of my work that you belong to the Lord?
고전 9:2 Even if others think I am not an apostle, I certainly am to you. You yourselves are proof that I am the Lord's apostle.
고전 9:3 This is my answer to those who question my authority①. / ①Greek those who examine me
고전 9:4 Don't we have the right to live in your homes and share your meals?
고전 9:5 Don't we have the right to bring a Christian wife with us as the other apostles and the Lord's brothers do, and as Peter① does? / ①Greek Cephas
고전 9:6 Or is it only Barnabas and I who have to work to support ourselves?
고전 9:7 What soldier has to pay his own expenses? What farmer plants a vineyard and doesn't have the right to eat some of its fruit? What shepherd cares for a flock of sheep and isn't allowed to drink some of the milk?
고전 9:8 Am I expressing merely a human opinion, or does the law say the same thing?
고전 9:9 For the law of Moses says, "You must not muzzle an ox to keep it from eating as it treads out the grain."① Was God thinking only about oxen when he said this? / ①Deut 25.4
고전 9:10 Wasn't he actually speaking to us? Yes, it was written for us, so that the one who plows and the one who threshes the grain might both expect a share of the harvest.
고전 9:11 Since we have planted spiritual seed among you, aren't we entitled to a harvest of physical food and drink?
고전 9:12 If you support others who preach to you, shouldn't we have an even greater right to be supported? But we have never used this right. We would rather put up with anything than be an obstacle to the Good News about Christ.
고전 9:13 Don't you realize that those who work in the temple get their meals from the offerings brought to the temple? And those who serve at the altar get a share of the sacrificial offerings.
고전 9:14 In the same way, the Lord ordered that those who preach the Good News should be supported by those who benefit from it.
고전 9:15 Yet I have never used any of these rights. And I am not writing this to suggest that I want to start now. In fact, I would rather die than lose my right to boast about preaching without charge.
고전 9:16 Yet preaching the Good News is not something I can boast about. I am compelled by God to do it. How terrible for me if I didn't preach the Good News!
고전 9:17 If I were doing this on my own initiative, I would deserve payment. But I have no choice, for God has given me this sacred trust.
고전 9:18 What then is my pay? It is the opportunity to preach the Good News without charging anyone. That's why I never demand my rights when I preach the Good News.
고전 9:19 Even though I am a free man with no master, I have become a slave to all people to bring many to Christ.
고전 9:20 When I was with the Jews, I lived like a Jew to bring the Jews to Christ. When I was with those who follow the Jewish law, I too lived under that law. Even though I am not subject to the law, I did this so I could bring to Christ those who are under the law.
고전 9:21 When I am with the Gentiles who do not follow the Jewish law①, I too live apart from that law so I can bring them to Christ. But I do not ignore the law of God; I obey the law of Christ. / ①Greek those without the law
고전 9:22 When I am with those who are weak, I share their weakness, for I want to bring the weak to Christ. Yes, I try to find common ground with everyone, doing everything I can to save some.
고전 9:23 I do everything to spread the Good News and share in its blessings.
고전 9:24 Don't you realize that in a race everyone runs, but only one person gets the prize? So run to win!
고전 9:25 All athletes are disciplined in their training. They do it to win a prize that will fade away, but we do it for an eternal prize.
고전 9:26 So I run with purpose in every step. I am not just shadowboxing.
고전 9:27 I discipline my body like an athlete, training it to do what it should. Otherwise, I fear that after preaching to others I myself might be disqualified.
고전 10:1 I don't want you to forget, dear brothers and sisters①, about our ancestors in the wilderness long ago. All of them were guided by a cloud that moved ahead of them, and all of them walked through the sea on dry ground. / ①Greek brothers
고전 10:2 In the cloud and in the sea, all of them were baptized as followers of Moses.
고전 10:3 All of them ate the same spiritual food,
고전 10:4 and all of them drank the same spiritual water. For they drank from the spiritual rock that traveled with them, and that rock was Christ.
고전 10:5 Yet God was not pleased with most of them, and their bodies were scattered in the wilderness.
고전 10:6 These things happened as a warning to us, so that we would not crave evil things as they did,
고전 10:7 or worship idols as some of them did. As the Scriptures say, "The people celebrated with feasting and drinking, and they indulged in pagan revelry."① / ①Exod 32.6
고전 10:8 And we must not engage in sexual immorality as some of them did, causing 23,000 of them to die in one day.
고전 10:9 Nor should we put Christ① to the test, as some of them did and then died from snakebites. / ①Some manuscripts read the Lord
고전 10:10 And don't grumble as some of them did, and then were destroyed by the angel of death.
고전 10:11 These things happened to them as examples for us. They were written down to warn us who live at the end of the age.
고전 10:12 If you think you are standing strong, be careful not to fall.
고전 10:13 The temptations in your life are no different from what others experience. And God is faithful. He will not allow the temptation to be more than you can stand. When you are tempted, he will show you a way out so that you can endure.
고전 10:14 So, my dear friends, flee from the worship of idols.
고전 10:15 You are reasonable people. Decide for yourselves if what I am saying is true.
고전 10:16 When we bless the cup at the Lord's Table, aren't we sharing in the blood of Christ? And when we break the bread, aren't we sharing in the body of Christ?
고전 10:17 And though we are many, we all eat from one loaf of bread, showing that we are one body.
고전 10:18 Think about the people of Israel. Weren't they united by eating the sacrifices at the altar?
고전 10:19 What am I trying to say? Am I saying that food offered to idols has some significance, or that idols are real gods?
고전 10:20 No, not at all. I am saying that these sacrifices are offered to demons, not to God. And I don't want you to participate with demons.
고전 10:21 You cannot drink from the cup of the Lord and from the cup of demons, too. You cannot eat at the Lord's Table and at the table of demons, too.
고전 10:22 What? Do we dare to rouse the Lord's jealousy? Do you think we are stronger than he is?
고전 10:23 You say, "I am allowed to do anything"① - but not everything is good for you. You say, "I am allowed to do anything"?but not everything is beneficial. / ①Greek All things are lawful; also in 10.23b
고전 10:24 Don't be concerned for your own good but for the good of others.
고전 10:25 So you may eat any meat that is sold in the marketplace without raising questions of conscience.
고전 10:26 For "the earth is the LORD's, and everything in it."① / ①Ps 24.1
고전 10:27 If someone who isn't a believer asks you home for dinner, accept the invitation if you want to. Eat whatever is offered to you without raising questions of conscience.
고전 10:28 (But suppose someone tells you, "This meat was offered to an idol." Don't eat it, out of consideration for the conscience of the one who told you.
고전 10:29 It might not be a matter of conscience for you, but it is for the other person.) For why should my freedom be limited by what someone else thinks?
고전 10:30 If I can thank God for the food and enjoy it, why should I be condemned for eating it?
고전 10:31 So whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God.
고전 10:32 Don't give offense to Jews or Gentiles① or the church of God. / ①Greek or Greeks
고전 10:33 I, too, try to please everyone in everything I do. I don't just do what is best for me; I do what is best for others so that many may be saved.
고전 11:1 And you should imitate me, just as I imitate Christ.
고전 11:2 I am so glad that you always keep me in your thoughts, and that you are following the teachings I passed on to you.
고전 11:3 But there is one thing I want you to know： The head of every man is Christ, the head of woman is man, and the head of Christ is God.① / ①Or to know： The source of every man is Christ, the source of woman is man, and the source of Christ is God. Or to know： Every man is responsible to Christ, a woman is responsible to her husband, and Christ is responsible to God.
고전 11:4 A man dishonors his head① if he covers his head while praying or prophesying. / ①Or dishonors Christ
고전 11:5 But a woman dishonors her head① if she prays or prophesies without a covering on her head, for this is the same as shaving her head. / ①Or dishonors her husband
고전 11:6 Yes, if she refuses to wear a head covering, she should cut off all her hair! But since it is shameful for a woman to have her hair cut or her head shaved, she should wear a covering①. / ①Or should have long hair
고전 11:7 A man should not wear anything on his head when worshiping, for man is made in God's image and reflects God's glory. And woman reflects man's glory.
고전 11:8 For the first man didn't come from woman, but the first woman came from man.
고전 11:9 And man was not made for woman, but woman was made for man.
고전 11:10 For this reason, and because the angels are watching, a woman should wear a covering on her head to show she is under authority①. / ①Greek should have an authority on her head
고전 11:11 But among the Lord's people, women are not independent of men, and men are not independent of women.
고전 11:12 For although the first woman came from man, every other man was born from a woman, and everything comes from God.
고전 11:13 Judge for yourselves. Is it right for a woman to pray to God in public without covering her head?
고전 11:14 Isn't it obvious that it's disgraceful for a man to have long hair?
고전 11:15 And isn't long hair a woman's pride and joy? For it has been given to her as a covering.
고전 11:16 But if anyone wants to argue about this, I simply say that we have no other custom than this, and neither do God's other churches.
고전 11:17 But in the following instructions, I cannot praise you. For it sounds as if more harm than good is done when you meet together.
고전 11:18 First, I hear that there are divisions among you when you meet as a church, and to some extent I believe it.
고전 11:19 But, of course, there must be divisions among you so that you who have God's approval will be recognized!
고전 11:20 When you meet together, you are not really interested in the Lord's Supper.
고전 11:21 For some of you hurry to eat your own meal without sharing with others. As a result, some go hungry while others get drunk.
고전 11:22 What? Don't you have your own homes for eating and drinking? Or do you really want to disgrace God's church and shame the poor? What am I supposed to say? Do you want me to praise you? Well, I certainly will not praise you for this!
고전 11:23 For I pass on to you what I received from the Lord himself. On the night when he was betrayed, the Lord Jesus took some bread
고전 11:24 and gave thanks to God for it. Then he broke it in pieces and said, "This is my body, which is given for you①. Do this to remember me." / ①Greek which is for you; other manuscripts read which is broken for you.
고전 11:25 In the same way, he took the cup of wine after supper, saying, "This cup is the new covenant between God and his people?an agreement confirmed with my blood. Do this to remember me as often as you drink it."
고전 11:26 For every time you eat this bread and drink this cup, you are announcing the Lord's death until he comes again.
고전 11:27 So anyone who eats this bread or drinks this cup of the Lord unworthily is guilty of sinning against① the body and blood of the Lord. / ①Or is responsible for
고전 11:28 That is why you should examine yourself before eating the bread and drinking the cup.
고전 11:29 For if you eat the bread or drink the cup without honoring the body of Christ①, you are eating and drinking God's judgment upon yourself. / ①Greek the body; other manuscripts read the Lord's body
고전 11:30 That is why many of you are weak and sick and some have even died.
고전 11:31 But if we would examine ourselves, we would not be judged by God in this way.
고전 11:32 Yet when we are judged by the Lord, we are being disciplined so that we will not be condemned along with the world.
고전 11:33 So, my dear brothers and sisters①, when you gather for the Lord's Supper, wait for each other. / ①Greek brothers
고전 11:34 If you are really hungry, eat at home so you won't bring judgment upon yourselves when you meet together. I'll give you instructions about the other matters after I arrive.
고전 12:1 Now, dear brothers and sisters①, regarding your question about the special abilities the Spirit gives us. I don't want you to misunderstand this. / ①Greek brothers
고전 12:2 You know that when you were still pagans, you were led astray and swept along in worshiping speechless idols.
고전 12:3 So I want you to know that no one speaking by the Spirit of God will curse Jesus, and no one can say Jesus is Lord, except by the Holy Spirit.
고전 12:4 There are different kinds of spiritual gifts, but the same Spirit is the source of them all.
고전 12:5 There are different kinds of service, but we serve the same Lord.
고전 12:6 God works in different ways, but it is the same God who does the work in all of us.
고전 12:7 A spiritual gift is given to each of us so we can help each other.
고전 12:8 To one person the Spirit gives the ability to give wise advice①; to another the same Spirit gives a message of special knowledge②. / ①Or gives a word of wisdom ②Or gives a word of knowledge
고전 12:9 The same Spirit gives great faith to another, and to someone else the one Spirit gives the gift of healing.
고전 12:10 He gives one person the power to perform miracles, and another the ability to prophesy. He gives someone else the ability to discern whether a message is from the Spirit of God or from another spirit. Still another person is given the ability to speak in unknown languages①, while another is given the ability to interpret what is being said. / ①Or in various tongues; also in 12.28, 30
고전 12:11 It is the one and only Spirit who distributes all these gifts. He alone decides which gift each person should have.
고전 12:12 The human body has many parts, but the many parts make up one whole body. So it is with the body of Christ.
고전 12:13 Some of us are Jews, some are Gentiles①, some are slaves, and some are free. But we have all been baptized into one body by one Spirit, and we all share the same Spirit②. / ①Greek some are Greeks ②Greek we were all given one Spirit to drink
고전 12:14 Yes, the body has many different parts, not just one part.
고전 12:15 If the foot says, "I am not a part of the body because I am not a hand," that does not make it any less a part of the body.
고전 12:16 And if the ear says, "I am not part of the body because I am not an eye," would that make it any less a part of the body?
고전 12:17 If the whole body were an eye, how would you hear? Or if your whole body were an ear, how would you smell anything?
고전 12:18 But our bodies have many parts, and God has put each part just where he wants it.
고전 12:19 How strange a body would be if it had only one part!
고전 12:20 Yes, there are many parts, but only one body.
고전 12:21 The eye can never say to the hand, "I don't need you." The head can't say to the feet, "I don't need you."
고전 12:22 In fact, some parts of the body that seem weakest and least important are actually the most necessary.
고전 12:23 And the parts we regard as less honorable are those we clothe with the greatest care. So we carefully protect those parts that should not be seen,
고전 12:24 while the more honorable parts do not require this special care. So God has put the body together such that extra honor and care are given to those parts that have less dignity.
고전 12:25 This makes for harmony among the members, so that all the members care for each other.
고전 12:26 If one part suffers, all the parts suffer with it, and if one part is honored, all the parts are glad.
고전 12:27 All of you together are Christ's body, and each of you is a part of it.
고전 12:28 Here are some of the parts God has appointed for the church： first are apostles, second are prophets, third are teachers, then those who do miracles, those who have the gift of healing, those who can help others, those who have the gift of leadership, those who speak in unknown languages.
고전 12:29 Are we all apostles? Are we all prophets? Are we all teachers? Do we all have the power to do miracles?
고전 12:30 Do we all have the gift of healing? Do we all have the ability to speak in unknown languages? Do we all have the ability to interpret unknown languages? Of course not!
고전 12:31 So you should earnestly desire the most helpful gifts. But now let me show you a way of life that is best of all.
고전 13:1 If I could speak all the languages of earth and of angels, but didn't love others, I would only be a noisy gong or a clanging cymbal.
고전 13:2 If I had the gift of prophecy, and if I understood all of God's secret plans and possessed all knowledge, and if I had such faith that I could move mountains, but didn't love others, I would be nothing.
고전 13:3 If I gave everything I have to the poor and even sacrificed my body, I could boast about it①; but if I didn't love others, I would have gained nothing. / ①Some manuscripts read sacrificed my body to be burned
고전 13:4 Love is patient and kind. Love is not jealous or boastful or proud
고전 13:5 or rude. It does not demand its own way. It is not irritable, and it keeps no record of being wronged.
고전 13:6 It does not rejoice about injustice but rejoices whenever the truth wins out.
고전 13:7 Love never gives up, never loses faith, is always hopeful, and endures through every circumstance.
고전 13:8 Prophecy and speaking in unknown languages① and special knowledge will become useless. But love will last forever! / ①Or in tongues
고전 13:9 Now our knowledge is partial and incomplete, and even the gift of prophecy reveals only part of the whole picture!
고전 13:10 But when full understanding comes, these partial things will become useless.
고전 13:11 When I was a child, I spoke and thought and reasoned as a child. But when I grew up, I put away childish things.
고전 13:12 Now we see things imperfectly as in a cloudy mirror, but then we will see everything with perfect clarity①. All that I know now is partial and incomplete, but then I will know everything completely, just as God now knows me completely. / ①Greek see face to face
고전 13:13 Three things will last forever?faith, hope, and love?and the greatest of these is love.
고전 14:1 Let love be your highest goal! But you should also desire the special abilities the Spirit gives?especially the ability to prophesy.
고전 14:2 For if you have the ability to speak in tongues①, you will be talking only to God, since people won't be able to understand you. You will be speaking by the power of the Spirit, but it will all be mysterious. / ①Or in unknown languages; also in 14.4, 5, 13, 14, 18, 22, 26, 27, 28, 39
고전 14:3 But one who prophesies strengthens others, encourages them, and comforts them.
고전 14:4 A person who speaks in tongues is strengthened personally, but one who speaks a word of prophecy strengthens the entire church.
고전 14:5 I wish you could all speak in tongues, but even more I wish you could all prophesy. For prophecy is greater than speaking in tongues, unless someone interprets what you are saying so that the whole church will be strengthened.
고전 14:6 Dear brothers and sisters①, if I should come to you speaking in an unknown language②, how would that help you? But if I bring you a revelation or some special knowledge or prophecy or teaching, that will be helpful. / ①Greek brothers; also in 14.20, 26, 39 ②Or in tongues; also in 14.19, 23
고전 14:7 Even lifeless instruments like the flute or the harp must play the notes clearly, or no one will recognize the melody.
고전 14:8 And if the bugler doesn't sound a clear call, how will the soldiers know they are being called to battle?
고전 14:9 It's the same for you. If you speak to people in words they don't understand, how will they know what you are saying? You might as well be talking into empty space.
고전 14:10 There are many different languages in the world, and every language has meaning.
고전 14:11 But if I don't understand a language, I will be a foreigner to someone who speaks it, and the one who speaks it will be a foreigner to me.
고전 14:12 And the same is true for you. Since you are so eager to have the special abilities the Spirit gives, seek those that will strengthen the whole church.
고전 14:13 So anyone who speaks in tongues should pray also for the ability to interpret what has been said.
고전 14:14 For if I pray in tongues, my spirit is praying, but I don't understand what I am saying.
고전 14:15 Well then, what shall I do? I will pray in the spirit①, and I will also pray in words I understand. I will sing in the spirit, and I will also sing in words I understand. / ①Or in the Spirit; also in 14.15b, 16
고전 14:16 For if you praise God only in the spirit, how can those who don't understand you praise God along with you? How can they join you in giving thanks when they don't understand what you are saying?
고전 14:17 You will be giving thanks very well, but it won't strengthen the people who hear you.
고전 14:18 I thank God that I speak in tongues more than any of you.
고전 14:19 But in a church meeting I would rather speak five understandable words to help others than ten thousand words in an unknown language.
고전 14:20 Dear brothers and sisters, don't be childish in your understanding of these things. Be innocent as babies when it comes to evil, but be mature in understanding matters of this kind.
고전 14:21 It is written in the Scriptures①： "I will speak to my own people through strange languages and through the lips of foreigners. But even then, they will not listen to me,"② says the LORD. / ①Greek in the law ②Isa 28.11-12
고전 14:22 So you see that speaking in tongues is a sign, not for believers, but for unbelievers. Prophecy, however, is for the benefit of believers, not unbelievers.
고전 14:23 Even so, if unbelievers or people who don't understand these things come into your church meeting and hear everyone speaking in an unknown language, they will think you are crazy.
고전 14:24 But if all of you are prophesying, and unbelievers or people who don't understand these things come into your meeting, they will be convicted of sin and judged by what you say.
고전 14:25 As they listen, their secret thoughts will be exposed, and they will fall to their knees and worship God, declaring, "God is truly here among you."
고전 14:26 Well, my brothers and sisters, let's summarize. When you meet together, one will sing, another will teach, another will tell some special revelation God has given, one will speak in tongues, and another will interpret what is said. But everything that is done must strengthen all of you.
고전 14:27 No more than two or three should speak in tongues. They must speak one at a time, and someone must interpret what they say.
고전 14:28 But if no one is present who can interpret, they must be silent in your church meeting and speak in tongues to God privately.
고전 14:29 Let two or three people prophesy, and let the others evaluate what is said.
고전 14:30 But if someone is prophesying and another person receives a revelation from the Lord, the one who is speaking must stop.
고전 14:31 In this way, all who prophesy will have a turn to speak, one after the other, so that everyone will learn and be encouraged.
고전 14:32 Remember that people who prophesy are in control of their spirit and can take turns.
고전 14:33 For God is not a God of disorder but of peace, as in all the meetings of God's holy people.① / ①The phrase as in all the meetings of God's holy people could instead be joined to the beginning of 14.34
고전 14:34 Women should be silent during the church meetings. It is not proper for them to speak. They should be submissive, just as the law says.
고전 14:35 If they have any questions, they should ask their husbands at home, for it is improper for women to speak in church meetings.① / ①Some manuscripts place verses 34-35 after 14.40
고전 14:36 Or do you think God's word originated with you Corinthians? Are you the only ones to whom it was given?
고전 14:37 If you claim to be a prophet or think you are spiritual, you should recognize that what I am saying is a command from the Lord himself.
고전 14:38 But if you do not recognize this, you yourself will not be recognized.① / ①Some manuscripts read If you are ignorant of this, stay in your ignorance
고전 14:39 So, my dear brothers and sisters, be eager to prophesy, and don't forbid speaking in tongues.
고전 14:40 But be sure that everything is done properly and in order.
고전 15:1 Let me now remind you, dear brothers and sisters①, of the Good News I preached to you before. You welcomed it then, and you still stand firm in it. / ①Greek brothers; also in 15.31, 50, 58
고전 15:2 It is this Good News that saves you if you continue to believe the message I told you - unless, of course, you believed something that was never true in the first place.① / ①Or unless you never believed it in the first place
고전 15:3 I passed on to you what was most important and what had also been passed on to me. Christ died for our sins, just as the Scriptures said.
고전 15:4 He was buried, and he was raised from the dead on the third day, just as the Scriptures said.
고전 15:5 He was seen by Peter① and then by the Twelve. / ①Greek Cephas
고전 15:6 After that, he was seen by more than 500 of his followers① at one time, most of whom are still alive, though some have died. / ①Greek the brothers
고전 15:7 Then he was seen by James and later by all the apostles.
고전 15:8 Last of all, as though I had been born at the wrong time, I also saw him.
고전 15:9 For I am the least of all the apostles. In fact, I'm not even worthy to be called an apostle after the way I persecuted God's church.
고전 15:10 But whatever I am now, it is all because God poured out his special favor on me?and not without results. For I have worked harder than any of the other apostles; yet it was not I but God who was working through me by his grace.
고전 15:11 So it makes no difference whether I preach or they preach, for we all preach the same message you have already believed.
고전 15:12 But tell me this?since we preach that Christ rose from the dead, why are some of you saying there will be no resurrection of the dead?
고전 15:13 For if there is no resurrection of the dead, then Christ has not been raised either.
고전 15:14 And if Christ has not been raised, then all our preaching is useless, and your faith is useless.
고전 15:15 And we apostles would all be lying about God?for we have said that God raised Christ from the grave. But that can't be true if there is no resurrection of the dead.
고전 15:16 And if there is no resurrection of the dead, then Christ has not been raised.
고전 15:17 And if Christ has not been raised, then your faith is useless and you are still guilty of your sins.
고전 15:18 In that case, all who have died believing in Christ are lost!
고전 15:19 And if our hope in Christ is only for this life, we are more to be pitied than anyone in the world.
고전 15:20 But in fact, Christ has been raised from the dead. He is the first of a great harvest of all who have died.
고전 15:21 So you see, just as death came into the world through a man, now the resurrection from the dead has begun through another man.
고전 15:22 Just as everyone dies because we all belong to Adam, everyone who belongs to Christ will be given new life.
고전 15:23 But there is an order to this resurrection： Christ was raised as the first of the harvest; then all who belong to Christ will be raised when he comes back.
고전 15:24 After that the end will come, when he will turn the Kingdom over to God the Father, having destroyed every ruler and authority and power.
고전 15:25 For Christ must reign until he humbles all his enemies beneath his feet.
고전 15:26 And the last enemy to be destroyed is death.
고전 15:27 For the Scriptures say, "God has put all things under his authority."① (Of course, when it says "all things are under his authority," that does not include God himself, who gave Christ his authority.) / ①Ps 8.6
고전 15:28 Then, when all things are under his authority, the Son will put himself under God's authority, so that God, who gave his Son authority over all things, will be utterly supreme over everything everywhere.
고전 15:29 If the dead will not be raised, what point is there in people being baptized for those who are dead? Why do it unless the dead will someday rise again?
고전 15:30 And why should we ourselves risk our lives hour by hour?
고전 15:31 For I swear, dear brothers and sisters, that I face death daily. This is as certain as my pride in what Christ Jesus our Lord has done in you.
고전 15:32 And what value was there in fighting wild beasts - those people of Ephesus① - if there will be no resurrection from the dead? And if there is no resurrection, "Let's feast and drink, for tomorrow we die!"② / ①Greek fighting wild beasts in Ephesus ②Isa 22.13
고전 15:33 Don't be fooled by those who say such things, for "bad company corrupts good character."
고전 15:34 Think carefully about what is right, and stop sinning. For to your shame I say that some of you don't know God at all.
고전 15:35 But someone may ask, "How will the dead be raised? What kind of bodies will they have?"
고전 15:36 What a foolish question! When you put a seed into the ground, it doesn't grow into a plant unless it dies first.
고전 15:37 And what you put in the ground is not the plant that will grow, but only a bare seed of wheat or whatever you are planting.
고전 15:38 Then God gives it the new body he wants it to have. A different plant grows from each kind of seed.
고전 15:39 Similarly there are different kinds of flesh?one kind for humans, another for animals, another for birds, and another for fish.
고전 15:40 There are also bodies in the heavens and bodies on the earth. The glory of the heavenly bodies is different from the glory of the earthly bodies.
고전 15:41 The sun has one kind of glory, while the moon and stars each have another kind. And even the stars differ from each other in their glory.
고전 15:42 It is the same way with the resurrection of the dead. Our earthly bodies are planted in the ground when we die, but they will be raised to live forever.
고전 15:43 Our bodies are buried in brokenness, but they will be raised in glory. They are buried in weakness, but they will be raised in strength.
고전 15:44 They are buried as natural human bodies, but they will be raised as spiritual bodies. For just as there are natural bodies, there are also spiritual bodies.
고전 15:45 The Scriptures tell us, "The first man, Adam, became a living person."① But the last Adam?that is, Christ?is a life-giving Spirit. / ①Gen 2.7
고전 15:46 What comes first is the natural body, then the spiritual body comes later.
고전 15:47 Adam, the first man, was made from the dust of the earth, while Christ, the second man, came from heaven.
고전 15:48 Earthly people are like the earthly man, and heavenly people are like the heavenly man.
고전 15:49 Just as we are now like the earthly man, we will someday be like① the heavenly man. / ①Some manuscripts read let us be like
고전 15:50 What I am saying, dear brothers and sisters, is that our physical bodies cannot inherit the Kingdom of God. These dying bodies cannot inherit what will last forever.
고전 15:51 But let me reveal to you a wonderful secret. We will not all die, but we will all be transformed!
고전 15:52 It will happen in a moment, in the blink of an eye, when the last trumpet is blown. For when the trumpet sounds, those who have died will be raised to live forever. And we who are living will also be transformed.
고전 15:53 For our dying bodies must be transformed into bodies that will never die; our mortal bodies must be transformed into immortal bodies.
고전 15:54 Then, when our dying bodies have been transformed into bodies that will never die①, this Scripture will be fulfilled： "Death is swallowed up in victory.② / ①Some manuscripts add and our mortal bodies have been transformed into immortal bodies ②Isa 25.8
고전 15:55 O death, where is your victory? O death, where is your sting?①" / ①Hos 13.14 (Greek version)
고전 15:56 For sin is the sting that results in death, and the law gives sin its power.
고전 15:57 But thank God! He gives us victory over sin and death through our Lord Jesus Christ.
고전 15:58 So, my dear brothers and sisters, be strong and immovable. Always work enthusiastically for the Lord, for you know that nothing you do for the Lord is ever useless.
고전 16:1 Now regarding your question about the money being collected for God's people in Jerusalem. You should follow the same procedure I gave to the churches in Galatia.
고전 16:2 On the first day of each week, you should each put aside a portion of the money you have earned. Don't wait until I get there and then try to collect it all at once.
고전 16:3 When I come, I will write letters of recommendation for the messengers you choose to deliver your gift to Jerusalem.
고전 16:4 And if it seems appropriate for me to go along, they can travel with me.
고전 16:5 I am coming to visit you after I have been to Macedonia①, for I am planning to travel through Macedonia. / ①Macedonia was in the northern region of Greece.
고전 16:6 Perhaps I will stay awhile with you, possibly all winter, and then you can send me on my way to my next destination.
고전 16:7 This time I don't want to make just a short visit and then go right on. I want to come and stay awhile, if the Lord will let me.
고전 16:8 In the meantime, I will be staying here at Ephesus until the Festival of Pentecost.
고전 16:9 There is a wide-open door for a great work here, although many oppose me.
고전 16:10 When Timothy comes, don't intimidate him. He is doing the Lord's work, just as I am.
고전 16:11 Don't let anyone treat him with contempt. Send him on his way with your blessing when he returns to me. I expect him to come with the other believers.① / ①Greek with the brothers; also in 16.12
고전 16:12 Now about our brother Apollos?I urged him to visit you with the other believers, but he was not willing to go right now. He will see you later when he has the opportunity.
고전 16:13 Be on guard. Stand firm in the faith. Be courageous①. Be strong. / ①Greek Be men
고전 16:14 And do everything with love.
고전 16:15 You know that Stephanas and his household were the first of the harvest of believers in Greece①, and they are spending their lives in service to God's people. I urge you, dear brothers and sisters②, / ①Greek in Achaia, the southern region of the Greek peninsula ②Greek brothers; also in 16.20
고전 16:16 to submit to them and others like them who serve with such devotion.
고전 16:17 I am very glad that Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus have come here. They have been providing the help you weren't here to give me.
고전 16:18 They have been a wonderful encouragement to me, as they have been to you. You must show your appreciation to all who serve so well.
고전 16:19 The churches here in the province of Asia① send greetings in the Lord, as do Aquila and Priscilla② and all the others who gather in their home for church meetings. / ①Asia was a Roman province in what is now western Turkey ②Greek Prisca
고전 16:20 All the brothers and sisters here send greetings to you. Greet each other with Christian love①. / ①Greek with a sacred kiss
고전 16:21 HERE IS MY GREETING IN MY OWN HANDWRITING - PAUL.
고전 16:22 If anyone does not love the Lord, that person is cursed. Our Lord, come!① / ①From Aramaic, Marana tha. Some manuscripts read Maran atha, "Our Lord has come."
고전 16:23 May the grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.
고전 16:24 My love to all of you in Christ Jesus.① / ①Some manuscripts add Amen
2Corinthians
고후 1:1 This letter is from Paul, chosen by the will of God to be an apostle of Christ Jesus, and from our brother Timothy. I am writing to God’s church in Corinth and to all of his holy people throughout Greece.① / ①Greek Achaia, the southern region of the Greek peninsula
고후 1:2 May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace.
고후 1:3 All praise to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. God is our merciful Father and the source of all comfort. 
고후 1:4 He comforts us in all our troubles so that we can comfort others. When they are troubled, we will be able to give them the same comfort God has given us. 
고후 1:5 For the more we suffer for Christ, the more God will shower us with his comfort through Christ. 
고후 1:6 Even when we are weighed down with troubles, it is for your comfort and salvation! For when we ourselves are comforted, we will certainly comfort you. Then you can patiently endure the same things we suffer. 
고후 1:7 We are confident that as you share in our sufferings, you will also share in the comfort God gives us.
고후 1:8 We think you ought to know, dear brothers and sisters①, about the trouble we went through in the province of Asia. We were crushed and overwhelmed beyond our ability to endure, and we thought we would never live through it. / ①Greek brothers
고후 1:9 In fact, we expected to die. But as a result, we stopped relying on ourselves and learned to rely only on God, who raises the dead. 
고후 1:10 And he did rescue us from mortal danger, and he will rescue us again. We have placed our confidence in him, and he will continue to rescue us. 
고후 1:11 And you are helping us by praying for us. Then many people will give thanks because God has graciously answered so many prayers for our safety.
고후 1:12 We can say with confidence and a clear conscience that we have lived with a God-given holiness① and sincerity in all our dealings. We have depended on God’s grace, not on our own human wisdom. That is how we have conducted ourselves before the world, and especially toward you. / ①Some manuscripts read honesty
고후 1:13 Our letters have been straightforward, and there is nothing written between the lines and nothing you can’t understand. I hope someday you will fully understand us, 
고후 1:14 even if you don’t understand us now. Then on the day when the Lord Jesus① returns, you will be proud of us in the same way we are proud of you. / ①Some manuscripts read our Lord Jesus
고후 1:15 Since I was so sure of your understanding and trust, I wanted to give you a double blessing by visiting you twice?
고후 1:16 first on my way to Macedonia and again when I returned from Macedonia.① Then you could send me on my way to Judea. / ①Macedonia was in the northern region of Greece
고후 1:17 You may be asking why I changed my plan. Do you think I make my plans carelessly? Do you think I am like people of the world who say “Yes” when they really mean “No”? 
고후 1:18 As surely as God is faithful, my word to you does not waver between “Yes” and “No.” 
고후 1:19 For Jesus Christ, the Son of God, does not waver between “Yes” and “No.” He is the one whom Silas①, Timothy, and I preached to you, and as God’s ultimate “Yes,” he always does what he says. / ①Greek Silvanus
고후 1:20 For all of God’s promises have been fulfilled in Christ with a resounding “Yes!” And through Christ, our “Amen” (which means “Yes”) ascends to God for his glory.
고후 1:21 It is God who enables us, along with you, to stand firm for Christ. He has commissioned us, 
고후 1:22 and he has identified us as his own by placing the Holy Spirit in our hearts as the first installment that guarantees everything he has promised us.
고후 1:23 Now I call upon God as my witness that I am telling the truth. The reason I didn’t return to Corinth was to spare you from a severe rebuke. 
고후 1:24 But that does not mean we want to dominate you by telling you how to put your faith into practice. We want to work together with you so you will be full of joy, for it is by your own faith that you stand firm.
고후 2:1 So I decided that I would not bring you grief with another painful visit. 
고후 2:2 For if I cause you grief, who will make me glad? Certainly not someone I have grieved. 
고후 2:3 That is why I wrote to you as I did, so that when I do come, I won’t be grieved by the very ones who ought to give me the greatest joy. Surely you all know that my joy comes from your being joyful. 
고후 2:4 I wrote that letter in great anguish, with a troubled heart and many tears. I didn’t want to grieve you, but I wanted to let you know how much love I have for you.
고후 2:5 I am not overstating it when I say that the man who caused all the trouble hurt all of you more than he hurt me. 
고후 2:6 Most of you opposed him, and that was punishment enough. 
고후 2:7 Now, however, it is time to forgive and comfort him. Otherwise he may be overcome by discouragement. 
고후 2:8 So I urge you now to reaffirm your love for him.
고후 2:9 I wrote to you as I did to test you and see if you would fully comply with my instructions. 
고후 2:10 When you forgive this man, I forgive him, too. And when I forgive whatever needs to be forgiven, I do so with Christ’s authority for your benefit, 
고후 2:11 so that Satan will not outsmart us. For we are familiar with his evil schemes.
고후 2:12 When I came to the city of Troas to preach the Good News of Christ, the Lord opened a door of opportunity for me. 
고후 2:13 But I had no peace of mind because my dear brother Titus hadn’t yet arrived with a report from you. So I said good-bye and went on to Macedonia to find him.
고후 2:14 But thank God! He has made us his captives and continues to lead us along in Christ’s triumphal procession. Now he uses us to spread the knowledge of Christ everywhere, like a sweet perfume. 
고후 2:15 Our lives are a Christ-like fragrance rising up to God. But this fragrance is perceived differently by those who are being saved and by those who are perishing. 
고후 2:16 To those who are perishing, we are a dreadful smell of death and doom. But to those who are being saved, we are a life-giving perfume. And who is adequate for such a task as this?
고후 2:17 You see, we are not like the many hucksters① who preach for personal profit. We preach the word of God with sincerity and with Christ’s authority, knowing that God is watching us. / ①Some manuscripts read the rest of the hucksters
고후 3:1 Are we beginning to praise ourselves again? Are we like others, who need to bring you letters of recommendation, or who ask you to write such letters on their behalf? Surely not! 
고후 3:2 The only letter of recommendation we need is you yourselves. Your lives are a letter written in our① hearts; everyone can read it and recognize our good work among you. / ①Some manuscripts read your
고후 3:3 Clearly, you are a letter from Christ showing the result of our ministry among you. This “letter” is written not with pen and ink, but with the Spirit of the living God. It is carved not on tablets of stone, but on human hearts.
고후 3:4 We are confident of all this because of our great trust in God through Christ. 
고후 3:5 It is not that we think we are qualified to do anything on our own. Our qualification comes from God. 
고후 3:6 He has enabled us to be ministers of his new covenant. This is a covenant not of written laws, but of the Spirit. The old written covenant ends in death; but under the new covenant, the Spirit gives life.
고후 3:7 The old way①, with laws etched in stone, led to death, though it began with such glory that the people of Israel could not bear to look at Moses’ face. For his face shone with the glory of God, even though the brightness was already fading away. / ①Or ministry; also in 3.8, 9, 10, 11, 12
고후 3:8 Shouldn’t we expect far greater glory under the new way, now that the Holy Spirit is giving life? 
고후 3:9 If the old way, which brings condemnation, was glorious, how much more glorious is the new way, which makes us right with God! 
고후 3:10 In fact, that first glory was not glorious at all compared with the overwhelming glory of the new way. 
고후 3:11 So if the old way, which has been replaced, was glorious, how much more glorious is the new, which remains forever!
고후 3:12 Since this new way gives us such confidence, we can be very bold. 
고후 3:13 We are not like Moses, who put a veil over his face so the people of Israel would not see the glory, even though it was destined to fade away. 
고후 3:14 But the people’s minds were hardened, and to this day whenever the old covenant is being read, the same veil covers their minds so they cannot understand the truth. And this veil can be removed only by believing in Christ.
