고후 3:15 Yes, even today when they read Moses’ writings, their hearts are covered with that veil, and they do not understand.
고후 3:16 But whenever someone turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away. 
고후 3:17 For the Lord is the Spirit, and wherever the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom. 
고후 3:18 So all of us who have had that veil removed can see and reflect the glory of the Lord. And the Lord-who is the Spirit-makes us more and more like him as we are changed into his glorious image.
고후 4:1 Therefore, since God in his mercy has given us this new way①, we never give up. / ①Or ministry
고후 4:2 We reject all shameful deeds and underhanded methods. We don’t try to trick anyone or distort the word of God. We tell the truth before God, and all who are honest know this.
고후 4:3 If the Good News we preach is hidden behind a veil, it is hidden only from people who are perishing. 
고후 4:4 Satan, who is the god of this world, has blinded the minds of those who don’t believe. They are unable to see the glorious light of the Good News. They don’t understand this message about the glory of Christ, who is the exact likeness of God.
고후 4:5 You see, we don’t go around preaching about ourselves. We preach that Jesus Christ is Lord, and we ourselves are your servants for Jesus’ sake. 
고후 4:6 For God, who said, “Let there be light in the darkness,” has made this light shine in our hearts so we could know the glory of God that is seen in the face of Jesus Christ.
고후 4:7 We now have this light shining in our hearts, but we ourselves are like fragile clay jars containing this great treasure.① This makes it clear that our great power is from God, not from ourselves. / ①Greek We now have this treasure in clay jars
고후 4:8 We are pressed on every side by troubles, but we are not crushed. We are perplexed, but not driven to despair. 
고후 4:9 We are hunted down, but never abandoned by God. We get knocked down, but we are not destroyed. 
고후 4:10 Through suffering, our bodies continue to share in the death of Jesus so that the life of Jesus may also be seen in our bodies.
고후 4:11 Yes, we live under constant danger of death because we serve Jesus, so that the life of Jesus will be evident in our dying bodies. 
고후 4:12 So we live in the face of death, but this has resulted in eternal life for you.
고후 4:13 But we continue to preach because we have the same kind of faith the psalmist had when he said, “I believed in God, so I spoke.”① / ①Ps 116.10
고후 4:14 We know that God, who raised the Lord Jesus①, will also raise us with Jesus and present us to himself together with you. / ①Some manuscripts read who raised Jesus
고후 4:15 All of this is for your benefit. And as God’s grace reaches more and more people, there will be great thanksgiving, and God will receive more and more glory.
고후 4:16 That is why we never give up. Though our bodies are dying, our spirits are① being renewed every day. / ①Greek our inner being is
고후 4:17 For our present troubles are small and won’t last very long. Yet they produce for us a glory that vastly outweighs them and will last forever! 
고후 4:18 So we don’t look at the troubles we can see now; rather, we fix our gaze on things that cannot be seen. For the things we see now will soon be gone, but the things we cannot see will last forever.
고후 5:1 For we know that when this earthly tent we live in is taken down (that is, when we die and leave this earthly body), we will have a house in heaven, an eternal body made for us by God himself and not by human hands. 
고후 5:2 We grow weary in our present bodies, and we long to put on our heavenly bodies like new clothing. 
고후 5:3 For we will put on heavenly bodies; we will not be spirits without bodies.① / ①Greek we will not be naked
고후 5:4 While we live in these earthly bodies, we groan and sigh, but it’s not that we want to die and get rid of these bodies that clothe us. Rather, we want to put on our new bodies so that these dying bodies will be swallowed up by life. 
고후 5:5 God himself has prepared us for this, and as a guarantee he has given us his Holy Spirit.
고후 5:6 So we are always confident, even though we know that as long as we live in these bodies we are not at home with the Lord. 
고후 5:7 For we live by believing and not by seeing. 
고후 5:8 Yes, we are fully confident, and we would rather be away from these earthly bodies, for then we will be at home with the Lord. 
고후 5:9 So whether we are here in this body or away from this body, our goal is to please him. 
고후 5:10 For we must all stand before Christ to be judged. We will each receive whatever we deserve for the good or evil we have done in this earthly body.
고후 5:11 Because we understand our fearful responsibility to the Lord, we work hard to persuade others. God knows we are sincere, and I hope you know this, too. 
고후 5:12 Are we commending ourselves to you again? No, we are giving you a reason to be proud of us①, so you can answer those who brag about having a spectacular ministry rather than having a sincere heart. / ①Some manuscripts read proud of yourselves
고후 5:13 If it seems we are crazy, it is to bring glory to God. And if we are in our right minds, it is for your benefit. 
고후 5:14 Either way, Christ’s love controls us①. Since we believe that Christ died for all, we also believe that we have all died to our old life.② / ①Or urges us on ②Greek Since one died for all, then all died
고후 5:15 He died for everyone so that those who receive his new life will no longer live for themselves. Instead, they will live for Christ, who died and was raised for them.
고후 5:16 So we have stopped evaluating others from a human point of view. At one time we thought of Christ merely from a human point of view. How differently we know him now! 
고후 5:17 This means that anyone who belongs to Christ has become a new person. The old life is gone; a new life has begun!
고후 5:18 And all of this is a gift from God, who brought us back to himself through Christ. And God has given us this task of reconciling people to him. 
고후 5:19 For God was in Christ, reconciling the world to himself, no longer counting people’s sins against them. And he gave us this wonderful message of reconciliation. 
고후 5:20 So we are Christ’s ambassadors; God is making his appeal through us. We speak for Christ when we plead, “Come back to God!” 
고후 5:21 For God made Christ, who never sinned, to be the offering for our sin①, so that we could be made right with God through Christ. / ①Or to become sin itself
고후 6:1 As God’s partners①, we beg you not to accept this marvelous gift of God’s kindness and then ignore it. / ①Or As we work together
고후 6:2 For God says, “At just the right time, I heard you. On the day of salvation, I helped you.”① Indeed, the “right time” is now. Today is the day of salvation. / ①Isa 49.8 (Greek version)
고후 6:3 We live in such a way that no one will stumble because of us, and no one will find fault with our ministry. 
고후 6:4 In everything we do, we show that we are true ministers of God. We patiently endure troubles and hardships and calamities of every kind. 
고후 6:5 We have been beaten, been put in prison, faced angry mobs, worked to exhaustion, endured sleepless nights, and gone without food. 
고후 6:6 We prove ourselves by our purity, our understanding, our patience, our kindness, by the Holy Spirit within us①, and by our sincere love. / ①Or by our holiness of spirit
고후 6:7 We faithfully preach the truth. God’s power is working in us. We use the weapons of righteousness in the right hand for attack and the left hand for defense. 
고후 6:8 We serve God whether people honor us or despise us, whether they slander us or praise us. We are honest, but they call us impostors. 
고후 6:9 We are ignored, even though we are well known. We live close to death, but we are still alive. We have been beaten, but we have not been killed. 
고후 6:10 Our hearts ache, but we always have joy. We are poor, but we give spiritual riches to others. We own nothing, and yet we have everything.
고후 6:11 Oh, dear Corinthian friends! We have spoken honestly with you, and our hearts are open to you. 
고후 6:12 There is no lack of love on our part, but you have withheld your love from us. 
고후 6:13 I am asking you to respond as if you were my own children. Open your hearts to us!
고후 6:14 Don’t team up with those who are unbelievers. How can righteousness be a partner with wickedness? How can light live with darkness? 
고후 6:15 What harmony can there be between Christ and the devil①? How can a believer be a partner with an unbeliever? / ①Greek Beliar; various other manuscripts render this proper name of the devil as Belian, Beliab, or Belial
고후 6:16 And what union can there be between God’s temple and idols? For we are the temple of the living God. As God said： “I will live in them and walk among them. I will be their God, and they will be my people.① / ①Lev 26.12; Ezek 37.27
고후 6:17 Therefore, come out from among unbelievers, and separate yourselves from them, says the Lord. Don’t touch their filthy things, and I will welcome you.① / ①Isa 52.11; Ezek 20.34 (Greek version)
고후 6:18 And I will be your Father, and you will be my sons and daughters, says the Lord Almighty.”① / ①2 Sam 7.14
고후 7:1 Because we have these promises, dear friends, let us cleanse ourselves from everything that can defile our body or spirit. And let us work toward complete holiness because we fear God.
고후 7:2 Please open your hearts to us. We have not done wrong to anyone, nor led anyone astray, nor taken advantage of anyone. 
고후 7:3 I’m not saying this to condemn you. I said before that you are in our hearts, and we live or die together with you. 
고후 7:4 I have the highest confidence in you, and I take great pride in you. You have greatly encouraged me and made me happy despite all our troubles.
고후 7:5 When we arrived in Macedonia, there was no rest for us. We faced conflict from every direction, with battles on the outside and fear on the inside. 
고후 7:6 But God, who encourages those who are discouraged, encouraged us by the arrival of Titus. 
고후 7:7 His presence was a joy, but so was the news he brought of the encouragement he received from you. When he told us how much you long to see me, and how sorry you are for what happened, and how loyal you are to me, I was filled with joy!
고후 7:8 I am not sorry that I sent that severe letter to you, though I was sorry at first, for I know it was painful to you for a little while. 
고후 7:9 Now I am glad I sent it, not because it hurt you, but because the pain caused you to repent and change your ways. It was the kind of sorrow God wants his people to have, so you were not harmed by us in any way. 
고후 7:10 For the kind of sorrow God wants us to experience leads us away from sin and results in salvation. There’s no regret for that kind of sorrow. But worldly sorrow, which lacks repentance, results in spiritual death.
고후 7:11 Just see what this godly sorrow produced in you! Such earnestness, such concern to clear yourselves, such indignation, such alarm, such longing to see me, such zeal, and such a readiness to punish wrong. You showed that you have done everything necessary to make things right. 
고후 7:12 My purpose, then, was not to write about who did the wrong or who was wronged. I wrote to you so that in the sight of God you could see for yourselves how loyal you are to us. 
고후 7:13 We have been greatly encouraged by this. In addition to our own encouragement, we were especially delighted to see how happy Titus was about the way all of you welcomed him and set his mind① at ease. / ①Greek his spirit
고후 7:14 I had told him how proud I was of you?and you didn’t disappoint me. I have always told you the truth, and now my boasting to Titus has also proved true! 
고후 7:15 Now he cares for you more than ever when he remembers the way all of you obeyed him and welcomed him with such fear and deep respect. 
고후 7:16 I am very happy now because I have complete confidence in you.
고후 8:1 Now I want you to know, dear brothers and sisters①, what God in his kindness has done through the churches in Macedonia. / ①Greek brothers
고후 8:2 They are being tested by many troubles, and they are very poor. But they are also filled with abundant joy, which has overflowed in rich generosity.
고후 8:3 For I can testify that they gave not only what they could afford, but far more. And they did it of their own free will. 
고후 8:4 They begged us again and again for the privilege of sharing in the gift for the believers① in Jerusalem. / ①Greek for God’s holy people
고후 8:5 They even did more than we had hoped, for their first action was to give themselves to the Lord and to us, just as God wanted them to do.
고후 8:6 So we have urged Titus, who encouraged your giving in the first place, to return to you and encourage you to finish this ministry of giving. 
고후 8:7 Since you excel in so many ways-in your faith, your gifted speakers, your knowledge, your enthusiasm, and your love from us① - I want you to excel also in this gracious act of giving. / ①Some manuscripts read your love for us
고후 8:8 I am not commanding you to do this. But I am testing how genuine your love is by comparing it with the eagerness of the other churches.
고후 8:9 You know the generous grace of our Lord Jesus Christ. Though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, so that by his poverty he could make you rich.
고후 8:10 Here is my advice： It would be good for you to finish what you started a year ago. Last year you were the first who wanted to give, and you were the first to begin doing it. 
고후 8:11 Now you should finish what you started. Let the eagerness you showed in the beginning be matched now by your giving. Give in proportion to what you have. 
고후 8:12 Whatever you give is acceptable if you give it eagerly. And give according to what you have, not what you don’t have. 
고후 8:13 Of course, I don’t mean your giving should make life easy for others and hard for yourselves. I only mean that there should be some equality. 
고후 8:14 Right now you have plenty and can help those who are in need. Later, they will have plenty and can share with you when you need it. In this way, things will be equal. 
고후 8:15 As the Scriptures say, “Those who gathered a lot had nothing left over, and those who gathered only a little had enough.”① / ①Exod 16.18
고후 8:16 But thank God! He has given Titus the same enthusiasm for you that I have. 
고후 8:17 Titus welcomed our request that he visit you again. In fact, he himself was very eager to go and see you. 
고후 8:18 We are also sending another brother with Titus. All the churches praise him as a preacher of the Good News. 
고후 8:19 He was appointed by the churches to accompany us as we take the offering to Jerusalem① - a service that glorifies the Lord and shows our eagerness to help. / ①See 1 Cor 16.3-4
고후 8:20 We are traveling together to guard against any criticism for the way we are handling this generous gift. 
고후 8:21 We are careful to be honorable before the Lord, but we also want everyone else to see that we are honorable.
고후 8:22 We are also sending with them another of our brothers who has proven himself many times and has shown on many occasions how eager he is. He is now even more enthusiastic because of his great confidence in you. 
고후 8:23 If anyone asks about Titus, say that he is my partner who works with me to help you. And the brothers with him have been sent by the churches①, and they bring honor to Christ. / ①Greek are apostles of the churches
고후 8:24 So show them your love, and prove to all the churches that our boasting about you is justified.
고후 9:1 I really don’t need to write to you about this ministry of giving for the believers in Jerusalem.① / ①Greek about the offering for God’s holy people
고후 9:2 For I know how eager you are to help, and I have been boasting to the churches in Macedonia that you in Greece① were ready to send an offering a year ago. In fact, it was your enthusiasm that stirred up many of the Macedonian believers to begin giving. / ①Greek in Achaia, the southern region of the Greek peninsula. Macedonia was in the northern region of Greece
고후 9:3 But I am sending these brothers to be sure you really are ready, as I have been telling them, and that your money is all collected. I don’t want to be wrong in my boasting about you. 
고후 9:4 We would be embarrassed?not to mention your own embarrassment?if some Macedonian believers came with me and found that you weren’t ready after all I had told them! 
고후 9:5 So I thought I should send these brothers ahead of me to make sure the gift you promised is ready. But I want it to be a willing gift, not one given grudgingly.
고후 9:6 Remember this?a farmer who plants only a few seeds will get a small crop. But the one who plants generously will get a generous crop. 
고후 9:7 You must each decide in your heart how much to give. And don’t give reluctantly or in response to pressure. “For God loves a person who gives cheerfully.”① / ①See footnote on Prov 22.8
고후 9:8 And God will generously provide all you need. Then you will always have everything you need and plenty left over to share with others. 
고후 9:9 As the Scriptures say, “They share freely and give generously to the poor. Their good deeds will be remembered forever.”① / ①Ps 112.9
고후 9:10 For God is the one who provides seed for the farmer and then bread to eat. In the same way, he will provide and increase your resources and then produce a great harvest of generosity① in you. / ①Greek righteousness
고후 9:11 Yes, you will be enriched in every way so that you can always be generous. And when we take your gifts to those who need them, they will thank God. 
고후 9:12 So two good things will result from this ministry of giving - the needs of the believers in Jerusalem① will be met, and they will joyfully express their thanks to God. / ①Greek of God’s holy people
고후 9:13 As a result of your ministry, they will give glory to God. For your generosity to them and to all believers will prove that you are obedient to the Good News of Christ. 
고후 9:14 And they will pray for you with deep affection because of the overflowing grace God has given to you. 
고후 9:15 Thank God for this gift① too wonderful for words! / ①Greek his gift
고후 10:1 Now I, Paul, appeal to you with the gentleness and kindness of Christ?though I realize you think I am timid in person and bold only when I write from far away. 
고후 10:2 Well, I am begging you now so that when I come I won’t have to be bold with those who think we act from human motives.
고후 10:3 We are human, but we don’t wage war as humans do. 
고후 10:4 ①We use God’s mighty weapons, not worldly weapons, to knock down the strongholds of human reasoning and to destroy false arguments. / ①English translations divide verses 4 and 5 in various ways
고후 10:5 We destroy every proud obstacle that keeps people from knowing God. We capture their rebellious thoughts and teach them to obey Christ. 
고후 10:6 And after you have become fully obedient, we will punish everyone who remains disobedient.
고후 10:7 Look at the obvious facts①. Those who say they belong to Christ must recognize that we belong to Christ as much as they do. / ①Or You look at things only on the basis of appearance
고후 10:8 I may seem to be boasting too much about the authority given to us by the Lord. But our authority builds you up; it doesn’t tear you down. So I will not be ashamed of using my authority.
고후 10:9 I’m not trying to frighten you by my letters. 
고후 10:10 For some say, “Paul’s letters are demanding and forceful, but in person he is weak, and his speeches are worthless!” 
고후 10:11 Those people should realize that our actions when we arrive in person will be as forceful as what we say in our letters from far away.
고후 10:12 Oh, don’t worry; we wouldn’t dare say that we are as wonderful as these other men who tell you how important they are! But they are only comparing themselves with each other, using themselves as the standard of measurement. How ignorant!
고후 10:13 We will not boast about things done outside our area of authority. We will boast only about what has happened within the boundaries of the work God has given us, which includes our working with you. 
고후 10:14 We are not reaching beyond these boundaries when we claim authority over you, as if we had never visited you. For we were the first to travel all the way to Corinth with the Good News of Christ.
고후 10:15 Nor do we boast and claim credit for the work someone else has done. Instead, we hope that your faith will grow so that the boundaries of our work among you will be extended. 
고후 10:16 Then we will be able to go and preach the Good News in other places far beyond you, where no one else is working. Then there will be no question of our boasting about work done in someone else’s territory. 
고후 10:17 As the Scriptures say, “If you want to boast, boast only about the Lord.”① / ①Jer 9.24
고후 10:18 When people commend themselves, it doesn’t count for much. The important thing is for the Lord to commend them.
고후 11:1 I hope you will put up with a little more of my foolishness. Please bear with me. 
고후 11:2 For I am jealous for you with the jealousy of God himself. I promised you as a pure bride① to one husband - Christ. / ①Greek a virgin
고후 11:3 But I fear that somehow your pure and undivided devotion to Christ will be corrupted, just as Eve was deceived by the cunning ways of the serpent. 
고후 11:4 You happily put up with whatever anyone tells you, even if they preach a different Jesus than the one we preach, or a different kind of Spirit than the one you received, or a different kind of gospel than the one you believed.
고후 11:5 But I don’t consider myself inferior in any way to these “super apostles” who teach such things. 
고후 11:6 I may be unskilled as a speaker, but I’m not lacking in knowledge. We have made this clear to you in every possible way.
고후 11:7 Was I wrong when I humbled myself and honored you by preaching God’s Good News to you without expecting anything in return? 
고후 11:8 I “robbed” other churches by accepting their contributions so I could serve you at no cost. 
고후 11:9 And when I was with you and didn’t have enough to live on, I did not become a financial burden to anyone. For the brothers who came from Macedonia brought me all that I needed. I have never been a burden to you, and I never will be. 
고후 11:10 As surely as the truth of Christ is in me, no one in all of Greece① will ever stop me from boasting about this. / ①Greek Achaia, the southern region of the Greek peninsula
고후 11:11 Why? Because I don’t love you? God knows that I do.
고후 11:12 But I will continue doing what I have always done. This will undercut those who are looking for an opportunity to boast that their work is just like ours. 
고후 11:13 These people are false apostles. They are deceitful workers who disguise themselves as apostles of Christ. 
고후 11:14 But I am not surprised! Even Satan disguises himself as an angel of light. 
고후 11:15 So it is no wonder that his servants also disguise themselves as servants of righteousness. In the end they will get the punishment their wicked deeds deserve.
고후 11:16 Again I say, don’t think that I am a fool to talk like this. But even if you do, listen to me, as you would to a foolish person, while I also boast a little. 
고후 11:17 Such boasting is not from the Lord, but I am acting like a fool. 
고후 11:18 And since others boast about their human achievements, I will, too. 
고후 11:19 After all, you think you are so wise, but you enjoy putting up with fools! 
고후 11:20 You put up with it when someone enslaves you, takes everything you have, takes advantage of you, takes control of everything, and slaps you in the face. 
고후 11:21 I’m ashamed to say that we’ve been too “weak” to do that! But whatever they dare to boast about?I’m talking like a fool again?I dare to boast about it, too. 
고후 11:22 Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they descendants of Abraham? So am I. 
고후 11:23 Are they servants of Christ? I know I sound like a madman, but I have served him far more! I have worked harder, been put in prison more often, been whipped times without number, and faced death again and again. 
고후 11:24 Five different times the Jewish leaders gave me thirty-nine lashes. 
고후 11:25 Three times I was beaten with rods. Once I was stoned. Three times I was shipwrecked. Once I spent a whole night and a day adrift at sea. 
고후 11:26 I have traveled on many long journeys. I have faced danger from rivers and from robbers. I have faced danger from my own people, the Jews, as well as from the Gentiles. I have faced danger in the cities, in the deserts, and on the seas. And I have faced danger from men who claim to be believers but are not.① / ①Greek from false brothers
고후 11:27 I have worked hard and long, enduring many sleepless nights. I have been hungry and thirsty and have often gone without food. I have shivered in the cold, without enough clothing to keep me warm.
고후 11:28 Then, besides all this, I have the daily burden of my concern for all the churches. 
고후 11:29 Who is weak without my feeling that weakness? Who is led astray, and I do not burn with anger?
고후 11:30 If I must boast, I would rather boast about the things that show how weak I am. 
고후 11:31 God, the Father of our Lord Jesus, who is worthy of eternal praise, knows I am not lying. 
고후 11:32 When I was in Damascus, the governor under King Aretas kept guards at the city gates to catch me. 
고후 11:33 I had to be lowered in a basket through a window in the city wall to escape from him.
고후 12:1 This boasting will do no good, but I must go on. I will reluctantly tell about visions and revelations from the Lord. 
고후 12:2 I① was caught up to the third heaven fourteen years ago. Whether I was in my body or out of my body, I don’t know?only God knows. / ①Greek I know a man in Christ who
고후 12:3 Yes, only God knows whether I was in my body or outside my body. But I do know 
고후 12:4 that I was caught up① to paradise and heard things so astounding that they cannot be expressed in words, things no human is allowed to tell. / ①Greek But I know such a man, 4that he was caught up
고후 12:5 That experience is worth boasting about, but I’m not going to do it. I will boast only about my weaknesses. 
고후 12:6 If I wanted to boast, I would be no fool in doing so, because I would be telling the truth. But I won’t do it, because I don’t want anyone to give me credit beyond what they can see in my life or hear in my message, 
고후 12:7 even though I have received such wonderful revelations from God. So to keep me from becoming proud, I was given a thorn in my flesh, a messenger from Satan to torment me and keep me from becoming proud.
고후 12:8 Three different times I begged the Lord to take it away. 
고후 12:9 Each time he said, “My grace is all you need. My power works best in weakness.” So now I am glad to boast about my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ can work through me. 
고후 12:10 That’s why I take pleasure in my weaknesses, and in the insults, hardships, persecutions, and troubles that I suffer for Christ. For when I am weak, then I am strong.
고후 12:11 You have made me act like a fool - boasting like this①. You ought to be writing commendations for me, for I am not at all inferior to these “super apostles,” even though I am nothing at all. / ①Some manuscripts omit boasting like this
고후 12:12 When I was with you, I certainly gave you proof that I am an apostle. For I patiently did many signs and wonders and miracles among you. 
고후 12:13 The only thing I failed to do, which I do in the other churches, was to become a financial burden to you. Please forgive me for this wrong!
고후 12:14 Now I am coming to you for the third time, and I will not be a burden to you. I don’t want what you have?I want you. After all, children don’t provide for their parents. Rather, parents provide for their children. 
고후 12:15 I will gladly spend myself and all I have for you, even though it seems that the more I love you, the less you love me.
고후 12:16 Some of you admit I was not a burden to you. But others still think I was sneaky and took advantage of you by trickery. 
고후 12:17 But how? Did any of the men I sent to you take advantage of you? 
고후 12:18 When I urged Titus to visit you and sent our other brother with him, did Titus take advantage of you? No! For we have the same spirit and walk in each other’s steps, doing things the same way.
고후 12:19 Perhaps you think we’re saying these things just to defend ourselves. No, we tell you this as Christ’s servants, and with God as our witness. Everything we do, dear friends, is to strengthen you. 
고후 12:20 For I am afraid that when I come I won’t like what I find, and you won’t like my response. I am afraid that I will find quarreling, jealousy, anger, selfishness, slander, gossip, arrogance, and disorderly behavior. 
고후 12:21 Yes, I am afraid that when I come again, God will humble me in your presence. And I will be grieved because many of you have not given up your old sins. You have not repented of your impurity, sexual immorality, and eagerness for lustful pleasure.
고후 13:1 This is the third time I am coming to visit you (and as the Scriptures say, “The facts of every case must be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.”①) / ①Deut 19.15
고후 13:2 I have already warned those who had been sinning when I was there on my second visit. Now I again warn them and all others, just as I did before, that next time I will not spare them.
고후 13:3 I will give you all the proof you want that Christ speaks through me. Christ is not weak when he deals with you; he is powerful among you. 
고후 13:4 Although he was crucified in weakness, he now lives by the power of God. We, too, are weak, just as Christ was, but when we deal with you we will be alive with him and will have God’s power.
고후 13:5 Examine yourselves to see if your faith is genuine. Test yourselves. Surely you know that Jesus Christ is among you①; if not, you have failed the test of genuine faith. / ①Or in you
고후 13:6 As you test yourselves, I hope you will recognize that we have not failed the test of apostolic authority.
고후 13:7 We pray to God that you will not do what is wrong by refusing our correction. I hope we won’t need to demonstrate our authority when we arrive. Do the right thing before we come - even if that makes it look like we have failed to demonstrate our authority. 
고후 13:8 For we cannot oppose the truth, but must always stand for the truth. 
고후 13:9 We are glad to seem weak if it helps show that you are actually strong. We pray that you will become mature.
고후 13:10 I am writing this to you before I come, hoping that I won’t need to deal severely with you when I do come. For I want to use the authority the Lord has given me to strengthen you, not to tear you down.
고후 13:11 Dear brothers and sisters①, I close my letter with these last words： Be joyful. Grow to maturity. Encourage each other. Live in harmony and peace. Then the God of love and peace will be with you. / ①Greek Brothers
고후 13:12 Greet each other with Christian love①. / ①Greek with a sacred kiss
고후 13:13 All of God’s people here send you their greetings.
고후 13:14 ① May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all. / ①Some English translations include verse 13 as part of verse 12, and then verse 14 becomes verse 13
Galatians
갈 1:1 This letter is from Paul, an apostle. I was not appointed by any group of people or any human authority, but by Jesus Christ himself and by God the Father, who raised Jesus from the dead.
갈 1:2 All the brothers and sisters① here join me in sending this letter to the churches of Galatia. / ①Greek brothers; also in 1.11
갈 1:3 May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ① give you grace and peace. / ①Some manuscripts read God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ
갈 1:4 Jesus gave his life for our sins, just as God our Father planned, in order to rescue us from this evil world in which we live. 
갈 1:5 All glory to God forever and ever! Amen.
갈 1:6 I am shocked that you are turning away so soon from God, who called you to himself through the loving mercy of Christ①. You are following a different way that pretends to be the Good News / ①Some manuscripts read through loving mercy
갈 1:7 but is not the Good News at all. You are being fooled by those who deliberately twist the truth concerning Christ.
갈 1:8 Let God’s curse fall on anyone, including us or even an angel from heaven, who preaches a different kind of Good News than the one we preached to you. 
갈 1:9 I say again what we have said before： If anyone preaches any other Good News than the one you welcomed, let that person be cursed.
갈 1:10 Obviously, I’m not trying to win the approval of people, but of God. If pleasing people were my goal, I would not be Christ’s servant.
갈 1:11 Dear brothers and sisters, I want you to understand that the gospel message I preach is not based on mere human reasoning. 
갈 1:12 I received my message from no human source, and no one taught me. Instead, I received it by direct revelation from Jesus Christ①. / ①Or by the revelation of Jesus Christ
갈 1:13 You know what I was like when I followed the Jewish religion?how I violently persecuted God’s church. I did my best to destroy it. 
갈 1:14 I was far ahead of my fellow Jews in my zeal for the traditions of my ancestors.
갈 1:15 But even before I was born, God chose me and called me by his marvelous grace. Then it pleased him 
갈 1:16 to reveal his Son to me① so that I would proclaim the Good News about Jesus to the Gentiles. When this happened, I did not rush out to consult with any human being②. / ①Or in me ②Greek with flesh and blood
갈 1:17 Nor did I go up to Jerusalem to consult with those who were apostles before I was. Instead, I went away into Arabia, and later I returned to the city of Damascus.
갈 1:18 Then three years later I went to Jerusalem to get to know Peter①, and I stayed with him for fifteen days. / ①Greek Cephas
갈 1:19 The only other apostle I met at that time was James, the Lord’s brother. 
갈 1:20 I declare before God that what I am writing to you is not a lie.
갈 1:21 After that visit I went north into the provinces of Syria and Cilicia. 
갈 1:22 And still the Christians in the churches in Judea didn’t know me personally. 
갈 1:23 All they knew was that people were saying, “The one who used to persecute us is now preaching the very faith he tried to destroy!” 
갈 1:24 And they praised God because of me.
갈 2:1 Then fourteen years later I went back to Jerusalem again, this time with Barnabas; and Titus came along, too. 
갈 2:2 I went there because God revealed to me that I should go. While I was there I met privately with those considered to be leaders of the church and shared with them the message I had been preaching to the Gentiles. I wanted to make sure that we were in agreement, for fear that all my efforts had been wasted and I was running the race for nothing. 
갈 2:3 And they supported me and did not even demand that my companion Titus be circumcised, though he was a Gentile①. / ①Greek a Greek
갈 2:4 Even that question came up only because of some so-called Christians there - false ones, really① - who were secretly brought in. They sneaked in to spy on us and take away the freedom we have in Christ Jesus. They wanted to enslave us and force us to follow their Jewish regulations. / ①Greek some false brothers
갈 2:5 But we refused to give in to them for a single moment. We wanted to preserve the truth of the gospel message for you.
갈 2:6 And the leaders of the church had nothing to add to what I was preaching. (By the way, their reputation as great leaders made no difference to me, for God has no favorites.) 
갈 2:7 Instead, they saw that God had given me the responsibility of preaching the gospel to the Gentiles, just as he had given Peter the responsibility of preaching to the Jews. 
갈 2:8 For the same God who worked through Peter as the apostle to the Jews also worked through me as the apostle to the Gentiles.
갈 2:9 In fact, James, Peter①, and John, who were known as pillars of the church, recognized the gift God had given me, and they accepted Barnabas and me as their co-workers. They encouraged us to keep preaching to the Gentiles, while they continued their work with the Jews. / ①Greek Cephas; also in 2.11, 14
갈 2:10 Their only suggestion was that we keep on helping the poor, which I have always been eager to do.
갈 2:11 But when Peter came to Antioch, I had to oppose him to his face, for what he did was very wrong. 
갈 2:12 When he first arrived, he ate with the Gentile Christians, who were not circumcised. But afterward, when some friends of James came, Peter wouldn’t eat with the Gentiles anymore. He was afraid of criticism from these people who insisted on the necessity of circumcision. 
갈 2:13 As a result, other Jewish Christians followed Peter’s hypocrisy, and even Barnabas was led astray by their hypocrisy.
갈 2:14 When I saw that they were not following the truth of the gospel message, I said to Peter in front of all the others, “Since you, a Jew by birth, have discarded the Jewish laws and are living like a Gentile, why are you now trying to make these Gentiles follow the Jewish traditions?
갈 2:15 “You and I are Jews by birth, not ‘sinners’ like the Gentiles. 
갈 2:16 Yet we know that a person is made right with God by faith in Jesus Christ, not by obeying the law. And we have believed in Christ Jesus, so that we might be made right with God because of our faith in Christ, not because we have obeyed the law. For no one will ever be made right with God by obeying the law.”① / ①Some translators hold that the quotation extends through verse 14; others through verse 16; and still others through verse 21
갈 2:17 But suppose we seek to be made right with God through faith in Christ and then we are found guilty because we have abandoned the law. Would that mean Christ has led us into sin? Absolutely not! 
갈 2:18 Rather, I am a sinner if I rebuild the old system of law I already tore down. 
갈 2:19 For when I tried to keep the law, it condemned me. So I died to the law?I stopped trying to meet all its requirements?so that I might live for God. 
갈 2:20 My old self has been crucified with Christ.① It is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me. So I live in this earthly body by trusting in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me. / ①Some English translations put this sentence in verse 19
갈 2:21 I do not treat the grace of God as meaningless. For if keeping the law could make us right with God, then there was no need for Christ to die.
갈 3:1 Oh, foolish Galatians! Who has cast an evil spell on you? For the meaning of Jesus Christ’s death was made as clear to you as if you had seen a picture of his death on the cross. 
갈 3:2 Let me ask you this one question： Did you receive the Holy Spirit by obeying the law of Moses? Of course not! You received the Spirit because you believed the message you heard about Christ. 
갈 3:3 How foolish can you be? After starting your Christian lives in the Spirit, why are you now trying to become perfect by your own human effort? 
갈 3:4 Have you experienced① so much for nothing? Surely it was not in vain, was it? / ①Or Have you suffered
갈 3:5 I ask you again, does God give you the Holy Spirit and work miracles among you because you obey the law? Of course not! It is because you believe the message you heard about Christ.
갈 3:6 In the same way, “Abraham believed God, and God counted him as righteous because of his faith.”① / ①Gen 15.6
갈 3:7 The real children of Abraham, then, are those who put their faith in God.
갈 3:8 What’s more, the Scriptures looked forward to this time when God would declare the Gentiles to be righteous because of their faith. God proclaimed this good news to Abraham long ago when he said, “All nations will be blessed through you.”① / ①Gen 12.3; 18.18; 22.18
갈 3:9 So all who put their faith in Christ share the same blessing Abraham received because of his faith.
갈 3:10 But those who depend on the law to make them right with God are under his curse, for the Scriptures say, “Cursed is everyone who does not observe and obey all the commands that are written in God’s Book of the Law.”① / ①Deut 27.26
갈 3:11 So it is clear that no one can be made right with God by trying to keep the law. For the Scriptures say, “It is through faith that a righteous person has life.”① / ①Hab 2.4
갈 3:12 This way of faith is very different from the way of law, which says, “It is through obeying the law that a person has life.”① / ①Lev 18.5
갈 3:13 But Christ has rescued us from the curse pronounced by the law. When he was hung on the cross, he took upon himself the curse for our wrongdoing. For it is written in the Scriptures, “Cursed is everyone who is hung on a tree.”① / ①Deut 21.23 (Greek version)
갈 3:14 Through Christ Jesus, God has blessed the Gentiles with the same blessing he promised to Abraham, so that we who are believers might receive the promised① Holy Spirit through faith. / ①Some manuscripts read the blessing of the
갈 3:15 Dear brothers and sisters①, here’s an example from everyday life. Just as no one can set aside or amend an irrevocable agreement, so it is in this case. / ①Greek Brothers
갈 3:16 God gave the promises to Abraham and his child①. And notice that the Scripture doesn’t say “to his children②,” as if it meant many descendants. Rather, it says “to his child”?and that, of course, means Christ. / ①Greek seed; also in 3.16c, 19See notes on Gen 12.7 and 13.15 ②Greek seeds
갈 3:17 This is what I am trying to say： The agreement God made with Abraham could not be canceled 430 years later when God gave the law to Moses. God would be breaking his promise. 
갈 3:18 For if the inheritance could be received by keeping the law, then it would not be the result of accepting God’s promise. But God graciously gave it to Abraham as a promise.
갈 3:19 Why, then, was the law given? It was given alongside the promise to show people their sins. But the law was designed to last only until the coming of the child who was promised. God gave his law through angels to Moses, who was the mediator between God and the people. 
갈 3:20 Now a mediator is helpful if more than one party must reach an agreement. But God, who is one, did not use a mediator when he gave his promise to Abraham.
갈 3:21 Is there a conflict, then, between God’s law and God’s promises①? Absolutely not! If the law could give us new life, we could be made right with God by obeying it. / ①Some manuscripts read and the promises
갈 3:22 But the Scriptures declare that we are all prisoners of sin, so we receive God’s promise of freedom only by believing in Jesus Christ.
갈 3:23 Before the way of faith in Christ was available to us, we were placed under guard by the law. We were kept in protective custody, so to speak, until the way of faith was revealed.
갈 3:24 Let me put it another way. The law was our guardian until Christ came; it protected us until we could be made right with God through faith. 
갈 3:25 And now that the way of faith has come, we no longer need the law as our guardian.
갈 3:26 For you are all children① of God through faith in Christ Jesus. / ①Greek sons
갈 3:27 And all who have been united with Christ in baptism have put on Christ, like putting on new clothes①. / ①Greek have put on Christ
갈 3:28 There is no longer Jew or Gentile①, slave or free, male and female. For you are all one in Christ Jesus. / ①Greek Jew or Greek
갈 3:29 And now that you belong to Christ, you are the true children① of Abraham. You are his heirs, and God’s promise to Abraham belongs to you. / ①Greek seed
갈 4:1 Think of it this way. If a father dies and leaves an inheritance for his young children, those children are not much better off than slaves until they grow up, even though they actually own everything their father had. 
갈 4:2 They have to obey their guardians until they reach whatever age their father set. 
갈 4:3 And that’s the way it was with us before Christ came. We were like children; we were slaves to the basic spiritual principles① of this world. / ①Or powers; also in 4.9
갈 4:4 But when the right time came, God sent his Son, born of a woman, subject to the law. 
갈 4:5 God sent him to buy freedom for us who were slaves to the law, so that he could adopt us as his very own children①. / ①Greek sons; also in 4.6
갈 4:6 And because we① are his children, God has sent the Spirit of his Son into our hearts, prompting us to call out, “Abba, Father.”② / ①Greek you ②Abba is an Aramaic term for “father.”
갈 4:7 Now you are no longer a slave but God’s own child①. And since you are his child, God has made you his heir. / ①Greek son; also in 4.7b
갈 4:8 Before you Gentiles knew God, you were slaves to so-called gods that do not even exist. 
갈 4:9 So now that you know God (or should I say, now that God knows you), why do you want to go back again and become slaves once more to the weak and useless spiritual principles of this world? 
갈 4:10 You are trying to earn favor with God by observing certain days or months or seasons or years. 
갈 4:11 I fear for you. Perhaps all my hard work with you was for nothing. 
갈 4:12 Dear brothers and sisters①, I plead with you to live as I do in freedom from these things, for I have become like you Gentiles - free from those laws. You did not mistreat me when I first preached to you. / ①Greek brothers; also in 4.28, 31
갈 4:13 Surely you remember that I was sick when I first brought you the Good News. 
갈 4:14 But even though my condition tempted you to reject me, you did not despise me or turn me away. No, you took me in and cared for me as though I were an angel from God or even Christ Jesus himself. 
갈 4:15 Where is that joyful and grateful spirit you felt then? I am sure you would have taken out your own eyes and given them to me if it had been possible. 
갈 4:16 Have I now become your enemy because I am telling you the truth?
갈 4:17 Those false teachers are so eager to win your favor, but their intentions are not good. They are trying to shut you off from me so that you will pay attention only to them. 
갈 4:18 If someone is eager to do good things for you, that’s all right; but let them do it all the time, not just when I’m with you.
갈 4:19 Oh, my dear children! I feel as if I’m going through labor pains for you again, and they will continue until Christ is fully developed in your lives. 
갈 4:20 I wish I were with you right now so I could change my tone. But at this distance I don’t know how else to help you.
갈 4:21 Tell me, you who want to live under the law, do you know what the law actually says? 
갈 4:22 The Scriptures say that Abraham had two sons, one from his slave wife and one from his freeborn wife.① / ①See Gen 16.15; 21.2-3 
갈 4:23 The son of the slave wife was born in a human attempt to bring about the fulfillment of God’s promise. But the son of the freeborn wife was born as God’s own fulfillment of his promise.
갈 4:24 These two women serve as an illustration of God’s two covenants. The first woman, Hagar, represents Mount Sinai where people received the law that enslaved them. 
갈 4:25 And now Jerusalem is just like Mount Sinai in Arabia①, because she and her children live in slavery to the law. / ①Greek And Hagar, which is Mount Sinai in Arabia, is now like Jerusalem; other manuscripts read And Mount Sinai in Arabia is now like Jerusalem
갈 4:26 But the other woman, Sarah, represents the heavenly Jerusalem. She is the free woman, and she is our mother. 
갈 4:27 As Isaiah said, “Rejoice, O childless woman, you who have never given birth! Break into a joyful shout, you who have never been in labor! For the desolate woman now has more children than the woman who lives with her husband!”① / ①Isa 54.1
갈 4:28 And you, dear brothers and sisters, are children of the promise, just like Isaac. 
갈 4:29 But you are now being persecuted by those who want you to keep the law, just as Ishmael, the child born by human effort, persecuted Isaac, the child born by the power of the Spirit.
갈 4:30 But what do the Scriptures say about that? “Get rid of the slave and her son, for the son of the slave woman will not share the inheritance with the free woman’s son.”① / ①Gen 21.10 
갈 4:31 So, dear brothers and sisters, we are not children of the slave woman; we are children of the free woman.
갈 5:1 So Christ has truly set us free. Now make sure that you stay free, and don’t get tied up again in slavery to the law.
갈 5:2 Listen! I, Paul, tell you this： If you are counting on circumcision to make you right with God, then Christ will be of no benefit to you. 
갈 5:3 I’ll say it again. If you are trying to find favor with God by being circumcised, you must obey every regulation in the whole law of Moses. 
갈 5:4 For if you are trying to make yourselves right with God by keeping the law, you have been cut off from Christ! You have fallen away from God’s grace.
갈 5:5 But we who live by the Spirit eagerly wait to receive by faith the righteousness God has promised to us. 
갈 5:6 For when we place our faith in Christ Jesus, there is no benefit in being circumcised or being uncircumcised. What is important is faith expressing itself in love.
갈 5:7 You were running the race so well. Who has held you back from following the truth? 
갈 5:8 It certainly isn’t God, for he is the one who called you to freedom. 
갈 5:9 This false teaching is like a little yeast that spreads through the whole batch of dough! 
갈 5:10 I am trusting the Lord to keep you from believing false teachings. God will judge that person, whoever he is, who has been confusing you.
갈 5:11 Dear brothers and sisters①, if I were still preaching that you must be circumcised - as some say I do - why am I still being persecuted? If I were no longer preaching salvation through the cross of Christ, no one would be offended. / ①Greek Brothers; similarly in 5.13
갈 5:12 I just wish that those troublemakers who want to mutilate you by circumcision would mutilate themselves.① / ①Or castrate themselves, or cut themselves off from you; Greek reads cut themselves off
갈 5:13 For you have been called to live in freedom, my brothers and sisters. But don’t use your freedom to satisfy your sinful nature. Instead, use your freedom to serve one another in love. 
갈 5:14 For the whole law can be summed up in this one command： “Love your neighbor as yourself.”① / ①Lev 19.18 
갈 5:15 But if you are always biting and devouring one another, watch out! Beware of destroying one another.
갈 5:16 So I say, let the Holy Spirit guide your lives. Then you won’t be doing what your sinful nature craves. 
갈 5:17 The sinful nature wants to do evil, which is just the opposite of what the Spirit wants. And the Spirit gives us desires that are the opposite of what the sinful nature desires. These two forces are constantly fighting each other, so you are not free to carry out your good intentions. 
갈 5:18 But when you are directed by the Spirit, you are not under obligation to the law of Moses.
갈 5:19 When you follow the desires of your sinful nature, the results are very clear： sexual immorality, impurity, lustful pleasures, 
갈 5:20 idolatry, sorcery, hostility, quarreling, jealousy, outbursts of anger, selfish ambition, dissension, division, 
갈 5:21 envy, drunkenness, wild parties, and other sins like these. Let me tell you again, as I have before, that anyone living that sort of life will not inherit the Kingdom of God.
갈 5:22 But the Holy Spirit produces this kind of fruit in our lives： love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, 
갈 5:23 gentleness, and self-control. There is no law against these things!
갈 5:24 Those who belong to Christ Jesus have nailed the passions and desires of their sinful nature to his cross and crucified them there. 
갈 5:25 Since we are living by the Spirit, let us follow the Spirit’s leading in every part of our lives. 
갈 5:26 Let us not become conceited, or provoke one another, or be jealous of one another.
갈 6:1 Dear brothers and sisters, if another believer① is overcome by some sin, you who are godly② should gently and humbly help that person back onto the right path. And be careful not to fall into the same temptation yourself. / ①Greek Brothers, if a man ②Greek spiritual
갈 6:2 Share each other’s burdens, and in this way obey the law of Christ. 
갈 6:3 If you think you are too important to help someone, you are only fooling yourself. You are not that important.
갈 6:4 Pay careful attention to your own work, for then you will get the satisfaction of a job well done, and you won’t need to compare yourself to anyone else. 
갈 6:5 For we are each responsible for our own conduct.
갈 6:6 Those who are taught the word of God should provide for their teachers, sharing all good things with them.
갈 6:7 Don’t be misled?you cannot mock the justice of God. You will always harvest what you plant. 
갈 6:8 Those who live only to satisfy their own sinful nature will harvest decay and death from that sinful nature. But those who live to please the Spirit will harvest everlasting life from the Spirit. 
갈 6:9 So let’s not get tired of doing what is good. At just the right time we will reap a harvest of blessing if we don’t give up. 
갈 6:10 Therefore, whenever we have the opportunity, we should do good to everyone?especially to those in the family of faith.
갈 6:11 Notice what large letters I use as I write these closing words in my own handwriting.
갈 6:12 Those who are trying to force you to be circumcised want to look good to others. They don’t want to be persecuted for teaching that the cross of Christ alone can save. 
갈 6:13 And even those who advocate circumcision don’t keep the whole law themselves. They only want you to be circumcised so they can boast about it and claim you as their disciples.
갈 6:14 As for me, may I never boast about anything except the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ. Because of that cross①, my interest in this world has been crucified, and the world’s interest in me has also died. / ①Or Because of him
갈 6:15 It doesn’t matter whether we have been circumcised or not. What counts is whether we have been transformed into a new creation. 
갈 6:16 May God’s peace and mercy be upon all who live by this principle; they are the new people of God.① / ①Greek this principle, and upon the Israel of God
갈 6:17 From now on, don’t let anyone trouble me with these things. For I bear on my body the scars that show I belong to Jesus.
갈 6:18 Dear brothers and sisters①, may the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen. / ①Greek Brothers
Ephesians
엡 1:1 This letter is from Paul, chosen by the will of God to be an apostle of Christ Jesus. I am writing to God's holy people in Ephesus①, who are faithful followers of Christ Jesus. / ①The most ancient manuscripts do not include in Ephesus
엡 1:2 May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace.
엡 1:3 All praise to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly realms because we are united with Christ.
엡 1:4 Even before he made the world, God loved us and chose us in Christ to be holy and without fault in his eyes.
엡 1:5 God decided in advance to adopt us into his own family by bringing us to himself through Jesus Christ. This is what he wanted to do, and it gave him great pleasure.
엡 1:6 So we praise God for the glorious grace he has poured out on us who belong to his dear Son.① / ①Greek to us in the beloved
엡 1:7 He is so rich in kindness and grace that he purchased our freedom with the blood of his Son and forgave our sins.
엡 1:8 He has showered his kindness on us, along with all wisdom and understanding.
엡 1:9 God has now revealed to us his mysterious plan regarding Christ, a plan to fulfill his own good pleasure.
엡 1:10 And this is the plan： At the right time he will bring everything together under the authority of Christ?everything in heaven and on earth.
엡 1:11 Furthermore, because we are united with Christ, we have received an inheritance from God①, for he chose us in advance, and he makes everything work out according to his plan. / ①Or we have become God's inheritance
엡 1:12 God's purpose was that we Jews who were the first to trust in Christ would bring praise and glory to God.
엡 1:13 And now you Gentiles have also heard the truth, the Good News that God saves you. And when you believed in Christ, he identified you as his own① by giving you the Holy Spirit, whom he promised long ago. / ①Or he put his seal on you
엡 1:14 The Spirit is God's guarantee that he will give us the inheritance he promised and that he has purchased us to be his own people. He did this so we would praise and glorify him.
엡 1:15 Ever since I first heard of your strong faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for God's people everywhere,① / ①Some manuscripts read your faithfulness to the Lord Jesus and to God's people everywhere
엡 1:16 I have not stopped thanking God for you. I pray for you constantly,
엡 1:17 asking God, the glorious Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, to give you spiritual wisdom① and insight so that you might grow in your knowledge of God. / ①Or to give you the Spirit of wisdom
엡 1:18 I pray that your hearts will be flooded with light so that you can understand the confident hope he has given to those he called?his holy people who are his rich and glorious inheritance.① / ①Or called, and the rich and glorious inheritance he has given to his holy people
엡 1:19 I also pray that you will understand the incredible greatness of God's power for us who believe him. This is the same mighty power
엡 1:20 that raised Christ from the dead and seated him in the place of honor at God's right hand in the heavenly realms.
엡 1:21 Now he is far above any ruler or authority or power or leader or anything else?not only in this world but also in the world to come.
엡 1:22 God has put all things under the authority of Christ and has made him head over all things for the benefit of the church.
엡 1:23 And the church is his body; it is made full and complete by Christ, who fills all things everywhere with himself.
엡 2:1 Once you were dead because of your disobedience and your many sins.
엡 2:2 You used to live in sin, just like the rest of the world, obeying the devil - the commander of the powers in the unseen world.① He is the spirit at work in the hearts of those who refuse to obey God. / ①Greek obeying the commander of the power of the air
엡 2:3 All of us used to live that way, following the passionate desires and inclinations of our sinful nature. By our very nature we were subject to God's anger, just like everyone else.
엡 2:4 But God is so rich in mercy, and he loved us so much,
엡 2:5 that even though we were dead because of our sins, he gave us life when he raised Christ from the dead. (It is only by God's grace that you have been saved!)
엡 2:6 For he raised us from the dead along with Christ and seated us with him in the heavenly realms because we are united with Christ Jesus.
엡 2:7 So God can point to us in all future ages as examples of the incredible wealth of his grace and kindness toward us, as shown in all he has done for us who are united with Christ Jesus.
엡 2:8 God saved you by his grace when you believed. And you can't take credit for this; it is a gift from God.
엡 2:9 Salvation is not a reward for the good things we have done, so none of us can boast about it.
엡 2:10 For we are God's masterpiece. He has created us anew in Christ Jesus, so we can do the good things he planned for us long ago.
엡 2:11 Don't forget that you Gentiles used to be outsiders. You were called "uncircumcised heathens" by the Jews, who were proud of their circumcision, even though it affected only their bodies and not their hearts.
엡 2:12 In those days you were living apart from Christ. You were excluded from citizenship among the people of Israel, and you did not know the covenant promises God had made to them. You lived in this world without God and without hope.
엡 2:13 But now you have been united with Christ Jesus. Once you were far away from God, but now you have been brought near to him through the blood of Christ.
엡 2:14 For Christ himself has brought peace to us. He united Jews and Gentiles into one people when, in his own body on the cross, he broke down the wall of hostility that separated us.
엡 2:15 He did this by ending the system of law with its commandments and regulations. He made peace between Jews and Gentiles by creating in himself one new people from the two groups.
엡 2:16 Together as one body, Christ reconciled both groups to God by means of his death on the cross, and our hostility toward each other was put to death.
엡 2:17 He brought this Good News of peace to you Gentiles who were far away from him, and peace to the Jews who were near.
엡 2:18 Now all of us can come to the Father through the same Holy Spirit because of what Christ has done for us.
엡 2:19 So now you Gentiles are no longer strangers and foreigners. You are citizens along with all of God's holy people. You are members of God's family.
엡 2:20 Together, we are his house, built on the foundation of the apostles and the prophets. And the cornerstone is Christ Jesus himself.
엡 2:21 We are carefully joined together in him, becoming a holy temple for the Lord.
엡 2:22 Through him you Gentiles are also being made part of this dwelling where God lives by his Spirit.
엡 3:1 When I think of all this, I, Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus for the benefit of you Gentiles① . . . / ①Paul resumes this thought in verse 14： "When I think of all this, I fall to my knees and pray to the Father."
엡 3:2 assuming, by the way, that you know God gave me the special responsibility of extending his grace to you Gentiles.
엡 3:3 As I briefly wrote earlier, God himself revealed his mysterious plan to me.
엡 3:4 As you read what I have written, you will understand my insight into this plan regarding Christ.
엡 3:5 God did not reveal it to previous generations, but now by his Spirit he has revealed it to his holy apostles and prophets.
엡 3:6 And this is God's plan： Both Gentiles and Jews who believe the Good News share equally in the riches inherited by God's children. Both are part of the same body, and both enjoy the promise of blessings because they belong to Christ Jesus.① / ①Or because they are united with Christ Jesus
엡 3:7 By God's grace and mighty power, I have been given the privilege of serving him by spreading this Good News.
엡 3:8 Though I am the least deserving of all God's people, he graciously gave me the privilege of telling the Gentiles about the endless treasures available to them in Christ.
엡 3:9 I was chosen to explain to everyone① this mysterious plan that God, the Creator of all things, had kept secret from the beginning. / ①Some manuscripts do not include to everyone
엡 3:10 God's purpose in all this was to use the church to display his wisdom in its rich variety to all the unseen rulers and authorities in the heavenly places.
엡 3:11 This was his eternal plan, which he carried out through Christ Jesus our Lord.
엡 3:12 Because of Christ and our faith in him①, we can now come boldly and confidently into God's presence. / ①Or Because of Christ's faithfulness
엡 3:13 So please don't lose heart because of my trials here. I am suffering for you, so you should feel honored.
엡 3:14 When I think of all this, I fall to my knees and pray to the Father①, / ①Some manuscripts read the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ
엡 3:15 the Creator of everything in heaven and on earth.① / ①Or from whom every family in heaven and on earth takes its name
엡 3:16 I pray that from his glorious, unlimited resources he will empower you with inner strength through his Spirit.
엡 3:17 Then Christ will make his home in your hearts as you trust in him. Your roots will grow down into God's love and keep you strong.
엡 3:18 And may you have the power to understand, as all God's people should, how wide, how long, how high, and how deep his love is.
엡 3:19 May you experience the love of Christ, though it is too great to understand fully. Then you will be made complete with all the fullness of life and power that comes from God.
엡 3:20 Now all glory to God, who is able, through his mighty power at work within us, to accomplish infinitely more than we might ask or think.
엡 3:21 Glory to him in the church and in Christ Jesus through all generations forever and ever! Amen.
엡 4:1 Therefore I, a prisoner for serving the Lord, beg you to lead a life worthy of your calling, for you have been called by God.
엡 4:2 Always be humble and gentle. Be patient with each other, making allowance for each other's faults because of your love.
엡 4:3 Make every effort to keep yourselves united in the Spirit, binding yourselves together with peace.
엡 4:4 For there is one body and one Spirit, just as you have been called to one glorious hope for the future.
엡 4:5 There is one Lord, one faith, one baptism,
엡 4:6 and one God and Father, who is over all and in all and living through all.
엡 4:7 However, he has given each one of us a special gift① through the generosity of Christ. / ①Greek a grace
엡 4:8 That is why the Scriptures say, "When he ascended to the heights, he led a crowd of captives and gave gifts to his people."① / ①Ps 68.18
엡 4:9 Notice that it says "he ascended." This clearly means that Christ also descended to our lowly world.① / ①Or to the lowest parts of the earth
엡 4:10 And the same one who descended is the one who ascended higher than all the heavens, so that he might fill the entire universe with himself.
엡 4:11 Now these are the gifts Christ gave to the church： the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, and the pastors and teachers.
엡 4:12 Their responsibility is to equip God's people to do his work and build up the church, the body of Christ.
엡 4:13 This will continue until we all come to such unity in our faith and knowledge of God's Son that we will be mature in the Lord, measuring up to the full and complete standard of Christ.
엡 4:14 Then we will no longer be immature like children. We won't be tossed and blown about by every wind of new teaching. We will not be influenced when people try to trick us with lies so clever they sound like the truth.
엡 4:15 Instead, we will speak the truth in love, growing in every way more and more like Christ, who is the head of his body, the church.
엡 4:16 He makes the whole body fit together perfectly. As each part does its own special work, it helps the other parts grow, so that the whole body is healthy and growing and full of love.
엡 4:17 With the Lord's authority I say this： Live no longer as the Gentiles do, for they are hopelessly confused.
엡 4:18 Their minds are full of darkness; they wander far from the life God gives because they have closed their minds and hardened their hearts against him.
엡 4:19 They have no sense of shame. They live for lustful pleasure and eagerly practice every kind of impurity.
엡 4:20 But that isn't what you learned about Christ.
엡 4:21 Since you have heard about Jesus and have learned the truth that comes from him,
엡 4:22 throw off your old sinful nature and your former way of life, which is corrupted by lust and deception.
엡 4:23 Instead, let the Spirit renew your thoughts and attitudes.
엡 4:24 Put on your new nature, created to be like God?truly righteous and holy.
엡 4:25 So stop telling lies. Let us tell our neighbors the truth, for we are all parts of the same body.
엡 4:26 And "don't sin by letting anger control you."① Don't let the sun go down while you are still angry, / ①Ps 4.4
엡 4:27 for anger gives a foothold to the devil.
엡 4:28 If you are a thief, quit stealing. Instead, use your hands for good hard work, and then give generously to others in need.
엡 4:29 Don't use foul or abusive language. Let everything you say be good and helpful, so that your words will be an encouragement to those who hear them.
엡 4:30 And do not bring sorrow to God's Holy Spirit by the way you live. Remember, he has identified you as his own①, guaranteeing that you will be saved on the day of redemption. / ①Or has put his seal on you
엡 4:31 Get rid of all bitterness, rage, anger, harsh words, and slander, as well as all types of evil behavior.
엡 4:32 Instead, be kind to each other, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, just as God through Christ has forgiven you.
엡 5:1 Imitate God, therefore, in everything you do, because you are his dear children.
엡 5:2 Live a life filled with love, following the example of Christ. He loved us① and offered himself as a sacrifice for us, a pleasing aroma to God. / ①Some manuscripts read loved you
엡 5:3 Let there be no sexual immorality, impurity, or greed among you. Such sins have no place among God's people.
엡 5:4 Obscene stories, foolish talk, and coarse jokes?these are not for you. Instead, let there be thankfulness to God.
엡 5:5 You can be sure that no immoral, impure, or greedy person will inherit the Kingdom of Christ and of God. For a greedy person is an idolater, worshiping the things of this world.
엡 5:6 Don't be fooled by those who try to excuse these sins, for the anger of God will fall on all who disobey him.
엡 5:7 Don't participate in the things these people do.
엡 5:8 For once you were full of darkness, but now you have light from the Lord. So live as people of light!
엡 5:9 For this light within you produces only what is good and right and true.
엡 5:10 Carefully determine what pleases the Lord.
엡 5:11 Take no part in the worthless deeds of evil and darkness; instead, expose them.
엡 5:12 It is shameful even to talk about the things that ungodly people do in secret.
엡 5:13 But their evil intentions will be exposed when the light shines on them,
엡 5:14 for the light makes everything visible. This is why it is said, "Awake, O sleeper, rise up from the dead, and Christ will give you light."
엡 5:15 So be careful how you live. Don't live like fools, but like those who are wise.
엡 5:16 Make the most of every opportunity in these evil days.
엡 5:17 Don't act thoughtlessly, but understand what the Lord wants you to do.
엡 5:18 Don't be drunk with wine, because that will ruin your life. Instead, be filled with the Holy Spirit,
엡 5:19 singing psalms and hymns and spiritual songs among yourselves, and making music to the Lord in your hearts.
엡 5:20 And give thanks for everything to God the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
엡 5:21 And further, submit to one another out of reverence for Christ.
엡 5:22 For wives, this means submit to your husbands as to the Lord.
엡 5:23 For a husband is the head of his wife as Christ is the head of the church. He is the Savior of his body, the church.
엡 5:24 As the church submits to Christ, so you wives should submit to your husbands in everything.
엡 5:25 For husbands, this means love your wives, just as Christ loved the church. He gave up his life for her
엡 5:26 to make her holy and clean, washed by the cleansing of God's word.① / ①Greek washed by water with the word
엡 5:27 He did this to present her to himself as a glorious church without a spot or wrinkle or any other blemish. Instead, she will be holy and without fault.
엡 5:28 In the same way, husbands ought to love their wives as they love their own bodies. For a man who loves his wife actually shows love for himself.
엡 5:29 No one hates his own body but feeds and cares for it, just as Christ cares for the church.
엡 5:30 And we are members of his body.
엡 5:31 As the Scriptures say, "A man leaves his father and mother and is joined to his wife, and the two are united into one."① / ①Gen 2.24
엡 5:32 This is a great mystery, but it is an illustration of the way Christ and the church are one.
엡 5:33 So again I say, each man must love his wife as he loves himself, and the wife must respect her husband.
엡 6:1 Children, obey your parents because you belong to the Lord①, for this is the right thing to do. / ①Or Children, obey your parents who belong to the Lord; some manuscripts read simply Children, obey your parents
엡 6:2 "Honor your father and mother." This is the first commandment with a promise.
엡 6:3 If you honor your father and mother, "things will go well for you, and you will have a long life on the earth."① / ①Exod 20.12; Deut 5.16
엡 6:4 Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger by the way you treat them. Rather, bring them up with the discipline and instruction that comes from the Lord.
엡 6:5 Slaves, obey your earthly masters with deep respect and fear. Serve them sincerely as you would serve Christ.
엡 6:6 Try to please them all the time, not just when they are watching you. As slaves of Christ, do the will of God with all your heart.
엡 6:7 Work with enthusiasm, as though you were working for the Lord rather than for people.
엡 6:8 Remember that the Lord will reward each one of us for the good we do, whether we are slaves or free.
엡 6:9 Masters, treat your slaves in the same way. Don't threaten them; remember, you both have the same Master in heaven, and he has no favorites.
엡 6:10 A final word： Be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power.
엡 6:11 Put on all of God's armor so that you will be able to stand firm against all strategies of the devil.
엡 6:12 For we① are not fighting against flesh-and-blood enemies, but against evil rulers and authorities of the unseen world, against mighty powers in this dark world, and against evil spirits in the heavenly places. / ①Some manuscripts read you
엡 6:13 Therefore, put on every piece of God's armor so you will be able to resist the enemy in the time of evil. Then after the battle you will still be standing firm.
엡 6:14 Stand your ground, putting on the belt of truth and the body armor of God's righteousness.
엡 6:15 For shoes, put on the peace that comes from the Good News so that you will be fully prepared.① / ①Or For shoes, put on the readiness to preach the Good News of peace with God
엡 6:16 In addition to all of these, hold up the shield of faith to stop the fiery arrows of the devil.① / ①Greek the evil one
엡 6:17 Put on salvation as your helmet, and take the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God.
엡 6:18 Pray in the Spirit at all times and on every occasion. Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for all believers everywhere.① / ①Greek all of God's holy people
엡 6:19 And pray for me, too. Ask God to give me the right words so I can boldly explain God's mysterious plan that the Good News is for Jews and Gentiles alike.① / ①Greek explain the mystery of the Good News; some manuscripts read simply explain the mystery
엡 6:20 I am in chains now, still preaching this message as God's ambassador. So pray that I will keep on speaking boldly for him, as I should.
엡 6:21 To bring you up to date, Tychicus will give you a full report about what I am doing and how I am getting along. He is a beloved brother and faithful helper in the Lord's work.
엡 6:22 I have sent him to you for this very purpose?to let you know how we are doing and to encourage you.
엡 6:23 Peace be with you, dear brothers and sisters①, and may God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you love with faithfulness. / ①Greek brothers
엡 6:24 May God's grace be eternally upon all who love our Lord Jesus Christ.
Philippians
빌 1:1 This letter is from Paul and Timothy, slaves of Christ Jesus. I am writing to all of God's holy people in Philippi who belong to Christ Jesus, including the elders① and deacons. / ①Or overseers; or bishops
빌 1:2 May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace.
빌 1:3 Every time I think of you, I give thanks to my God.
빌 1:4 Whenever I pray, I make my requests for all of you with joy,
빌 1:5 for you have been my partners in spreading the Good News about Christ from the time you first heard it until now.
빌 1:6 And I am certain that God, who began the good work within you, will continue his work until it is finally finished on the day when Christ Jesus returns.
빌 1:7 So it is right that I should feel as I do about all of you, for you have a special place in my heart. You share with me the special favor of God, both in my imprisonment and in defending and confirming the truth of the Good News.
빌 1:8 God knows how much I love you and long for you with the tender compassion of Christ Jesus.
빌 1:9 I pray that your love will overflow more and more, and that you will keep on growing in knowledge and understanding.
빌 1:10 For I want you to understand what really matters, so that you may live pure and blameless lives until the day of Christ's return.
빌 1:11 May you always be filled with the fruit of your salvation - the righteous character produced in your life by Jesus Christ① - for this will bring much glory and praise to God. / ①Greek with the fruit of righteousness through Jesus Christ
빌 1:12 And I want you to know, my dear brothers and sisters①, that everything that has happened to me here has helped to spread the Good News. / ①Greek brothers
빌 1:13 For everyone here, including the whole palace guard①, knows that I am in chains because of Christ. / ①Greek including all the Praetorium
빌 1:14 And because of my imprisonment, most of the believers① here have gained confidence and boldly speak God's message② without fear. / ①Greek brothers in the Lord ②Some manuscripts read speak the message
빌 1:15 It's true that some are preaching out of jealousy and rivalry. But others preach about Christ with pure motives.
빌 1:16 They preach because they love me, for they know I have been appointed to defend the Good News.
빌 1:17 Those others do not have pure motives as they preach about Christ. They preach with selfish ambition, not sincerely, intending to make my chains more painful to me.
빌 1:18 But that doesn't matter. Whether their motives are false or genuine, the message about Christ is being preached either way, so I rejoice. And I will continue to rejoice.
빌 1:19 For I know that as you pray for me and the Spirit of Jesus Christ helps me, this will lead to my deliverance.
빌 1:20 For I fully expect and hope that I will never be ashamed, but that I will continue to be bold for Christ, as I have been in the past. And I trust that my life will bring honor to Christ, whether I live or die.
빌 1:21 For to me, living means living for Christ, and dying is even better.
빌 1:22 But if I live, I can do more fruitful work for Christ. So I really don't know which is better.
빌 1:23 I'm torn between two desires： I long to go and be with Christ, which would be far better for me.
빌 1:24 But for your sakes, it is better that I continue to live.
빌 1:25 Knowing this, I am convinced that I will remain alive so I can continue to help all of you grow and experience the joy of your faith.
빌 1:26 And when I come to you again, you will have even more reason to take pride in Christ Jesus because of what he is doing through me.
빌 1:27 Above all, you must live as citizens of heaven, conducting yourselves in a manner worthy of the Good News about Christ. Then, whether I come and see you again or only hear about you, I will know that you are standing together with one spirit and one purpose, fighting together for the faith, which is the Good News.
빌 1:28 Don't be intimidated in any way by your enemies. This will be a sign to them that they are going to be destroyed, but that you are going to be saved, even by God himself.
빌 1:29 For you have been given not only the privilege of trusting in Christ but also the privilege of suffering for him.
