빌 1:30 We are in this struggle together. You have seen my struggle in the past, and you know that I am still in the midst of it.
빌 2:1 Is there any encouragement from belonging to Christ? Any comfort from his love? Any fellowship together in the Spirit? Are your hearts tender and compassionate?
빌 2:2 Then make me truly happy by agreeing wholeheartedly with each other, loving one another, and working together with one mind and purpose.
빌 2:3 Don't be selfish; don't try to impress others. Be humble, thinking of others as better than yourselves.
빌 2:4 Don't look out only for your own interests, but take an interest in others, too.
빌 2:5 You must have the same attitude that Christ Jesus had.
빌 2:6 Though he was God①, he did not think of equality with God as something to cling to. / ①Or Being in the form of God
빌 2:7 Instead, he gave up his divine privileges①; he took the humble position of a slave② and was born as a human being. When he appeared in human form③, / ①Greek he emptied himself ②Or the form of a slave ③Some English translations put this phrase in verse 8
빌 2:8 he humbled himself in obedience to God and died a criminal's death on a cross.
빌 2:9 Therefore, God elevated him to the place of highest honor and gave him the name above all other names,
빌 2:10 that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, in heaven and on earth and under the earth,
빌 2:11 and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
빌 2:12 Dear friends, you always followed my instructions when I was with you. And now that I am away, it is even more important. Work hard to show the results of your salvation, obeying God with deep reverence and fear.
빌 2:13 For God is working in you, giving you the desire and the power to do what pleases him.
빌 2:14 Do everything without complaining and arguing,
빌 2:15 so that no one can criticize you. Live clean, innocent lives as children of God, shining like bright lights in a world full of crooked and perverse people.
빌 2:16 Hold firmly to the word of life; then, on the day of Christ's return, I will be proud that I did not run the race in vain and that my work was not useless.
빌 2:17 But I will rejoice even if I lose my life, pouring it out like a liquid offering to God①, just like your faithful service is an offering to God. And I want all of you to share that joy. / ①Greek I will rejoice even if I am to be poured out as a liquid offering
빌 2:18 Yes, you should rejoice, and I will share your joy.
빌 2:19 If the Lord Jesus is willing, I hope to send Timothy to you soon for a visit. Then he can cheer me up by telling me how you are getting along.
빌 2:20 I have no one else like Timothy, who genuinely cares about your welfare.
빌 2:21 All the others care only for themselves and not for what matters to Jesus Christ.
빌 2:22 But you know how Timothy has proved himself. Like a son with his father, he has served with me in preaching the Good News.
빌 2:23 I hope to send him to you just as soon as I find out what is going to happen to me here.
빌 2:24 And I have confidence from the Lord that I myself will come to see you soon.
빌 2:25 Meanwhile, I thought I should send Epaphroditus back to you. He is a true brother, co-worker, and fellow soldier. And he was your messenger to help me in my need.
빌 2:26 I am sending him because he has been longing to see you, and he was very distressed that you heard he was ill.
빌 2:27 And he certainly was ill; in fact, he almost died. But God had mercy on him?and also on me, so that I would not have one sorrow after another.
빌 2:28 So I am all the more anxious to send him back to you, for I know you will be glad to see him, and then I will not be so worried about you.
빌 2:29 Welcome him with Christian love① and with great joy, and give him the honor that people like him deserve. / ①Greek in the Lord
빌 2:30 For he risked his life for the work of Christ, and he was at the point of death while doing for me what you couldn't do from far away.
빌 3:1 Whatever happens, my dear brothers and sisters①, rejoice in the Lord. I never get tired of telling you these things, and I do it to safeguard your faith. / ①Greek brothers; also in 3.13, 17
빌 3:2 Watch out for those dogs, those people who do evil, those mutilators who say you must be circumcised to be saved.
빌 3:3 For we who worship by the Spirit of God① are the ones who are truly circumcised. We rely on what Christ Jesus has done for us. We put no confidence in human effort, / ①Some manuscripts read worship God in spirit; one early manuscript reads worship in spirit
빌 3:4 though I could have confidence in my own effort if anyone could. Indeed, if others have reason for confidence in their own efforts, I have even more!
빌 3:5 I was circumcised when I was eight days old. I am a pure-blooded citizen of Israel and a member of the tribe of Benjamin?a real Hebrew if there ever was one! I was a member of the Pharisees, who demand the strictest obedience to the Jewish law.
빌 3:6 I was so zealous that I harshly persecuted the church. And as for righteousness, I obeyed the law without fault.
빌 3:7 I once thought these things were valuable, but now I consider them worthless because of what Christ has done.
빌 3:8 Yes, everything else is worthless when compared with the infinite value of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord. For his sake I have discarded everything else, counting it all as garbage, so that I could gain Christ
빌 3:9 and become one with him. I no longer count on my own righteousness through obeying the law; rather, I become righteous through faith in Christ①. For God's way of making us right with himself depends on faith. / ①Or through the faithfulness of Christ
빌 3:10 I want to know Christ and experience the mighty power that raised him from the dead. I want to suffer with him, sharing in his death,
빌 3:11 so that one way or another I will experience the resurrection from the dead!
빌 3:12 I don't mean to say that I have already achieved these things or that I have already reached perfection. But I press on to possess that perfection for which Christ Jesus first possessed me.
빌 3:13 No, dear brothers and sisters, I have not achieved it①, but I focus on this one thing： Forgetting the past and looking forward to what lies ahead, / ①Some manuscripts read not yet achieved it
빌 3:14 I press on to reach the end of the race and receive the heavenly prize for which God, through Christ Jesus, is calling us.
빌 3:15 Let all who are spiritually mature agree on these things. If you disagree on some point, I believe God will make it plain to you.
빌 3:16 But we must hold on to the progress we have already made.
빌 3:17 Dear brothers and sisters, pattern your lives after mine, and learn from those who follow our example.
빌 3:18 For I have told you often before, and I say it again with tears in my eyes, that there are many whose conduct shows they are really enemies of the cross of Christ.
빌 3:19 They are headed for destruction. Their god is their appetite, they brag about shameful things, and they think only about this life here on earth.
빌 3:20 But we are citizens of heaven, where the Lord Jesus Christ lives. And we are eagerly waiting for him to return as our Savior.
빌 3:21 He will take our weak mortal bodies and change them into glorious bodies like his own, using the same power with which he will bring everything under his control.
빌 4:1 Therefore, my dear brothers and sisters①, stay true to the Lord. I love you and long to see you, dear friends, for you are my joy and the crown I receive for my work. / ①Greek brothers; also in 4.8
빌 4:2 Now I appeal to Euodia and Syntyche. Please, because you belong to the Lord, settle your disagreement.
빌 4:3 And I ask you, my true partner①, to help these two women, for they worked hard with me in telling others the Good News. They worked along with Clement and the rest of my co-workers, whose names are written in the Book of Life. / ①Or loyal Syzygus
빌 4:4 Always be full of joy in the Lord. I say it again - rejoice!
빌 4:5 Let everyone see that you are considerate in all you do. Remember, the Lord is coming soon.
빌 4:6 Don't worry about anything; instead, pray about everything. Tell God what you need, and thank him for all he has done.
빌 4:7 Then you will experience God's peace, which exceeds anything we can understand. His peace will guard your hearts and minds as you live in Christ Jesus.
빌 4:8 And now, dear brothers and sisters, one final thing. Fix your thoughts on what is true, and honorable, and right, and pure, and lovely, and admirable. Think about things that are excellent and worthy of praise.
빌 4:9 Keep putting into practice all you learned and received from me?everything you heard from me and saw me doing. Then the God of peace will be with you.
빌 4:10 How I praise the Lord that you are concerned about me again. I know you have always been concerned for me, but you didn't have the chance to help me.
빌 4:11 Not that I was ever in need, for I have learned how to be content with whatever I have.
빌 4:12 I know how to live on almost nothing or with everything. I have learned the secret of living in every situation, whether it is with a full stomach or empty, with plenty or little.
빌 4:13 For I can do everything through Christ①, who gives me strength. / ①Greek through the one
빌 4:14 Even so, you have done well to share with me in my present difficulty.
빌 4:15 As you know, you Philippians were the only ones who gave me financial help when I first brought you the Good News and then traveled on from Macedonia. No other church did this.
빌 4:16 Even when I was in Thessalonica you sent help more than once.
빌 4:17 I don't say this because I want a gift from you. Rather, I want you to receive a reward for your kindness.
빌 4:18 At the moment I have all I need?and more! I am generously supplied with the gifts you sent me with Epaphroditus. They are a sweet-smelling sacrifice that is acceptable and pleasing to God.
빌 4:19 And this same God who takes care of me will supply all your needs from his glorious riches, which have been given to us in Christ Jesus.
빌 4:20 Now all glory to God our Father forever and ever! Amen.
빌 4:21 Give my greetings to each of God's holy people?all who belong to Christ Jesus. The brothers who are with me send you their greetings.
빌 4:22 And all the rest of God's people send you greetings, too, especially those in Caesar's household.
빌 4:23 May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
Colossians
골 1:1 This letter is from Paul, chosen by the will of God to be an apostle of Christ Jesus, and from our brother Timothy.
골 1:2 We are writing to God's holy people in the city of Colosse, who are faithful brothers and sisters① in Christ. May God our Father give you grace and peace. / ①Greek faithful brothers
골 1:3 We always pray for you, and we give thanks to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
골 1:4 For we have heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and your love for all of God's people,
골 1:5 which come from your confident hope of what God has reserved for you in heaven. You have had this expectation ever since you first heard the truth of the Good News.
골 1:6 This same Good News that came to you is going out all over the world. It is bearing fruit everywhere by changing lives, just as it changed your lives from the day you first heard and understood the truth about God's wonderful grace.
골 1:7 You learned about the Good News from Epaphras, our beloved co-worker. He is Christ's faithful servant, and he is helping us on your behalf.① / ①Or he is ministering on your behalf; some manuscripts read he is ministering on our behalf
골 1:8 He has told us about the love for others that the Holy Spirit has given you.
골 1:9 So we have not stopped praying for you since we first heard about you. We ask God to give you complete knowledge of his will and to give you spiritual wisdom and understanding.
골 1:10 Then the way you live will always honor and please the Lord, and your lives will produce every kind of good fruit. All the while, you will grow as you learn to know God better and better.
골 1:11 We also pray that you will be strengthened with all his glorious power so you will have all the endurance and patience you need. May you be filled with joy①, / ①Or all the patience and endurance you need with joy
골 1:12 always thanking the Father. He has enabled you to share in the inheritance that belongs to his people, who live in the light.
골 1:13 For he has rescued us from the kingdom of darkness and transferred us into the Kingdom of his dear Son,
골 1:14 who purchased our freedom① and forgave our sins. / ①Some manuscripts add with his blood
골 1:15 Christ is the visible image of the invisible God. He existed before anything was created and is supreme over all creation①, / ①Or He is the firstborn of all creation
골 1:16 for through him God created everything in the heavenly realms and on earth. He made the things we can see and the things we can't see?such as thrones, kingdoms, rulers, and authorities in the unseen world. Everything was created through him and for him.
골 1:17 He existed before anything else, and he holds all creation together.
골 1:18 Christ is also the head of the church, which is his body. He is the beginning, supreme over all who rise from the dead①. So he is first in everything. / ①Or the firstborn from the dead
골 1:19 For God in all his fullness was pleased to live in Christ,
골 1:20 and through him God reconciled everything to himself. He made peace with everything in heaven and on earth by means of Christ's blood on the cross.
골 1:21 This includes you who were once far away from God. You were his enemies, separated from him by your evil thoughts and actions.
골 1:22 Yet now he has reconciled you to himself through the death of Christ in his physical body. As a result, he has brought you into his own presence, and you are holy and blameless as you stand before him without a single fault.
골 1:23 But you must continue to believe this truth and stand firmly in it. Don't drift away from the assurance you received when you heard the Good News. The Good News has been preached all over the world, and I, Paul, have been appointed as God's servant to proclaim it.
골 1:24 I am glad when I suffer for you in my body, for I am participating in the sufferings of Christ that continue for his body, the church.
골 1:25 God has given me the responsibility of serving his church by proclaiming his entire message to you.
골 1:26 This message was kept secret for centuries and generations past, but now it has been revealed to God's people.
골 1:27 For God wanted them to know that the riches and glory of Christ are for you Gentiles, too. And this is the secret： Christ lives in you. This gives you assurance of sharing his glory.
골 1:28 So we tell others about Christ, warning everyone and teaching everyone with all the wisdom God has given us. We want to present them to God, perfect① in their relationship to Christ. / ①Or mature
골 1:29 That's why I work and struggle so hard, depending on Christ's mighty power that works within me.
골 2:1 I want you to know how much I have agonized for you and for the church at Laodicea, and for many other believers who have never met me personally.
골 2:2 I want them to be encouraged and knit together by strong ties of love. I want them to have complete confidence that they understand God's mysterious plan, which is Christ himself.
골 2:3 In him lie hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
골 2:4 I am telling you this so no one will deceive you with well-crafted arguments.
골 2:5 For though I am far away from you, my heart is with you. And I rejoice that you are living as you should and that your faith in Christ is strong.
골 2:6 And now, just as you accepted Christ Jesus as your Lord, you must continue to follow him.
골 2:7 Let your roots grow down into him, and let your lives be built on him. Then your faith will grow strong in the truth you were taught, and you will overflow with thankfulness.
골 2:8 Don't let anyone capture you with empty philosophies and high-sounding nonsense that come from human thinking and from the spiritual powers① of this world, rather than from Christ. / ①Or the spiritual principles; also in 2.20
골 2:9 For in Christ lives all the fullness of God in a human body①. / ①Or in him dwells all the completeness of the Godhead bodily
골 2:10 So you also are complete through your union with Christ, who is the head over every ruler and authority.
골 2:11 When you came to Christ, you were "circumcised," but not by a physical procedure. Christ performed a spiritual circumcision?the cutting away of your sinful nature①. / ①Greek the cutting away of the body of the flesh
골 2:12 For you were buried with Christ when you were baptized. And with him you were raised to new life because you trusted the mighty power of God, who raised Christ from the dead.
골 2:13 You were dead because of your sins and because your sinful nature was not yet cut away. Then God made you alive with Christ, for he forgave all our sins.
골 2:14 He canceled the record of the charges against us and took it away by nailing it to the cross.
골 2:15 In this way, he disarmed① the spiritual rulers and authorities. He shamed them publicly by his victory over them on the cross. / ①Or he stripped off
골 2:16 So don't let anyone condemn you for what you eat or drink, or for not celebrating certain holy days or new moon ceremonies or Sabbaths.
골 2:17 For these rules are only shadows of the reality yet to come. And Christ himself is that reality.
골 2:18 Don't let anyone condemn you by insisting on pious self-denial or the worship of angels①, saying they have had visions about these things. Their sinful minds have made them proud, / ①Or or worshiping with angels
골 2:19 and they are not connected to Christ, the head of the body. For he holds the whole body together with its joints and ligaments, and it grows as God nourishes it.
골 2:20 You have died with Christ, and he has set you free from the spiritual powers of this world. So why do you keep on following the rules of the world, such as,
골 2:21 "Don't handle! Don't taste! Don't touch!"?
골 2:22 Such rules are mere human teachings about things that deteriorate as we use them.
골 2:23 These rules may seem wise because they require strong devotion, pious self-denial, and severe bodily discipline. But they provide no help in conquering a person's evil desires.
골 3:1 Since you have been raised to new life with Christ, set your sights on the realities of heaven, where Christ sits in the place of honor at God's right hand.
골 3:2 Think about the things of heaven, not the things of earth.
골 3:3 For you died to this life, and your real life is hidden with Christ in God.
골 3:4 And when Christ, who is your① life, is revealed to the whole world, you will share in all his glory. / ①Some manuscripts read our
골 3:5 So put to death the sinful, earthly things lurking within you. Have nothing to do with sexual immorality, impurity, lust, and evil desires. Don't be greedy, for a greedy person is an idolater, worshiping the things of this world.
골 3:6 Because of these sins, the anger of God is coming①. / ①Some manuscripts read is coming on all who disobey him
골 3:7 You used to do these things when your life was still part of this world.
골 3:8 But now is the time to get rid of anger, rage, malicious behavior, slander, and dirty language.
골 3:9 Don't lie to each other, for you have stripped off your old sinful nature and all its wicked deeds.
골 3:10 Put on your new nature, and be renewed as you learn to know your Creator and become like him.
골 3:11 In this new life, it doesn't matter if you are a Jew or a Gentile①, circumcised or uncircumcised, barbaric, uncivilized②, slave, or free. Christ is all that matters, and he lives in all of us. / ①Greek a Greek ②Greek Barbarian, Scythian
골 3:12 Since God chose you to be the holy people he loves, you must clothe yourselves with tenderhearted mercy, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience.
골 3:13 Make allowance for each other's faults, and forgive anyone who offends you. Remember, the Lord forgave you, so you must forgive others.
골 3:14 Above all, clothe yourselves with love, which binds us all together in perfect harmony.
골 3:15 And let the peace that comes from Christ rule in your hearts. For as members of one body you are called to live in peace. And always be thankful.
골 3:16 Let the message about Christ, in all its richness, fill your lives. Teach and counsel each other with all the wisdom he gives. Sing psalms and hymns and spiritual songs to God with thankful hearts.
골 3:17 And whatever you do or say, do it as a representative of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks through him to God the Father.
골 3:18 Wives, submit to your husbands, as is fitting for those who belong to the Lord.
골 3:19 Husbands, love your wives and never treat them harshly.
골 3:20 Children, always obey your parents, for this pleases the Lord.
골 3:21 Fathers, do not aggravate your children, or they will become discouraged.
골 3:22 Slaves, obey your earthly masters in everything you do. Try to please them all the time, not just when they are watching you. Serve them sincerely because of your reverent fear of the Lord.
골 3:23 Work willingly at whatever you do, as though you were working for the Lord rather than for people.
골 3:24 Remember that the Lord will give you an inheritance as your reward, and that the Master you are serving is Christ①. / ①Or and serve Christ as your Master
골 3:25 But if you do what is wrong, you will be paid back for the wrong you have done. For God has no favorites.
골 4:1 Masters, be just and fair to your slaves. Remember that you also have a Master?in heaven.
골 4:2 Devote yourselves to prayer with an alert mind and a thankful heart.
골 4:3 Pray for us, too, that God will give us many opportunities to speak about his mysterious plan concerning Christ. That is why I am here in chains.
골 4:4 Pray that I will proclaim this message as clearly as I should.
골 4:5 Live wisely among those who are not believers, and make the most of every opportunity.
골 4:6 Let your conversation be gracious and attractive① so that you will have the right response for everyone. / ①Greek and seasoned with salt
골 4:7 Tychicus will give you a full report about how I am getting along. He is a beloved brother and faithful helper who serves with me in the Lord's work.
골 4:8 I have sent him to you for this very purpose?to let you know how we are doing and to encourage you.
골 4:9 I am also sending Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, one of your own people. He and Tychicus will tell you everything that's happening here.
골 4:10 Aristarchus, who is in prison with me, sends you his greetings, and so does Mark, Barnabas's cousin. As you were instructed before, make Mark welcome if he comes your way.
골 4:11 Jesus (the one we call Justus) also sends his greetings. These are the only Jewish believers among my co-workers; they are working with me here for the Kingdom of God. And what a comfort they have been!
골 4:12 Epaphras, a member of your own fellowship and a servant of Christ Jesus, sends you his greetings. He always prays earnestly for you, asking God to make you strong and perfect, fully confident that you are following the whole will of God.
골 4:13 I can assure you that he prays hard for you and also for the believers in Laodicea and Hierapolis.
골 4:14 Luke, the beloved doctor, sends his greetings, and so does Demas.
골 4:15 Please give my greetings to our brothers and sisters① at Laodicea, and to Nympha and the church that meets in her house. / ①Greek brothers
골 4:16 After you have read this letter, pass it on to the church at Laodicea so they can read it, too. And you should read the letter I wrote to them.
골 4:17 And say to Archippus, "Be sure to carry out the ministry the Lord gave you."
골 4:18 HERE IS MY GREETING IN MY OWN HANDWRITING - PAUL. Remember my chains. May God's grace be with you.
1Thessalonians
살전 1:1 This letter is from Paul, Silas①, and Timothy. We are writing to the church in Thessalonica, to you who belong to God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. May God give you grace and peace. / ①Greek Silvanus, the Greek form of the name
살전 1:2 We always thank God for all of you and pray for you constantly.
살전 1:3 As we pray to our God and Father about you, we think of your faithful work, your loving deeds, and the enduring hope you have because of our Lord Jesus Christ.
살전 1:4 We know, dear brothers and sisters①, that God loves you and has chosen you to be his own people. / ①Greek brothers
살전 1:5 For when we brought you the Good News, it was not only with words but also with power, for the Holy Spirit gave you full assurance① that what we said was true. And you know of our concern for you from the way we lived when we were with you. / ①Or with the power of the Holy Spirit, so you can have full assurance
살전 1:6 So you received the message with joy from the Holy Spirit in spite of the severe suffering it brought you. In this way, you imitated both us and the Lord.
살전 1:7 As a result, you have become an example to all the believers in Greece - throughout both Macedonia and Achaia①. / ①Macedonia and Achaia were the northern and southern regions of Greece
살전 1:8 And now the word of the Lord is ringing out from you to people everywhere, even beyond Macedonia and Achaia, for wherever we go we find people telling us about your faith in God. We don't need to tell them about it,
살전 1:9 for they keep talking about the wonderful welcome you gave us and how you turned away from idols to serve the living and true God.
살전 1:10 And they speak of how you are looking forward to the coming of God's Son from heaven - Jesus, whom God raised from the dead. He is the one who has rescued us from the terrors of the coming judgment.
살전 2:1 You yourselves know, dear brothers and sisters①, that our visit to you was not a failure. / ①Greek brothers; also in 2.9, 14, 17
살전 2:2 You know how badly we had been treated at Philippi just before we came to you and how much we suffered there. Yet our God gave us the courage to declare his Good News to you boldly, in spite of great opposition.
살전 2:3 So you can see we were not preaching with any deceit or impure motives or trickery.
살전 2:4 For we speak as messengers approved by God to be entrusted with the Good News. Our purpose is to please God, not people. He alone examines the motives of our hearts.
살전 2:5 Never once did we try to win you with flattery, as you well know. And God is our witness that we were not pretending to be your friends just to get your money!
살전 2:6 As for human praise, we have never sought it from you or anyone else.
살전 2:7 As apostles of Christ we certainly had a right to make some demands of you, but instead we were like children① among you. Or we were like a mother feeding and caring for her own children. / ①Some manuscripts read we were gentle
살전 2:8 We loved you so much that we shared with you not only God's Good News but our own lives, too.
살전 2:9 Don't you remember, dear brothers and sisters, how hard we worked among you? Night and day we toiled to earn a living so that we would not be a burden to any of you as we preached God's Good News to you.
살전 2:10 You yourselves are our witnesses - and so is God - that we were devout and honest and faultless toward all of you believers.
살전 2:11 And you know that we treated each of you as a father treats his own children.
살전 2:12 We pleaded with you, encouraged you, and urged you to live your lives in a way that God would consider worthy. For he called you to share in his Kingdom and glory.
살전 2:13 Therefore, we never stop thanking God that when you received his message from us, you didn't think of our words as mere human ideas. You accepted what we said as the very word of God - which, of course, it is. And this word continues to work in you who believe.
살전 2:14 And then, dear brothers and sisters, you suffered persecution from your own countrymen. In this way, you imitated the believers in God's churches in Judea who, because of their belief in Christ Jesus, suffered from their own people, the Jews.
살전 2:15 For some of the Jews killed the prophets, and some even killed the Lord Jesus. Now they have persecuted us, too. They fail to please God and work against all humanity
살전 2:16 as they try to keep us from preaching the Good News of salvation to the Gentiles. By doing this, they continue to pile up their sins. But the anger of God has caught up with them at last.
살전 2:17 Dear brothers and sisters, after we were separated from you for a little while (though our hearts never left you), we tried very hard to come back because of our intense longing to see you again.
살전 2:18 We wanted very much to come to you, and I, Paul, tried again and again, but Satan prevented us.
살전 2:19 After all, what gives us hope and joy, and what will be our proud reward and crown as we stand before our Lord Jesus when he returns? It is you!
살전 2:20 Yes, you are our pride and joy.
살전 3:1 Finally, when we could stand it no longer, we decided to stay alone in Athens,
살전 3:2 and we sent Timothy to visit you. He is our brother and God's co-worker① in proclaiming the Good News of Christ. We sent him to strengthen you, to encourage you in your faith, / ①Other manuscripts read and God's servant; still others read and a co-worker, or and a servant and co-worker for God, or and God's servant and our co-worker
살전 3:3 and to keep you from being shaken by the troubles you were going through. But you know that we are destined for such troubles.
살전 3:4 Even while we were with you, we warned you that troubles would soon come - and they did, as you well know.
살전 3:5 That is why, when I could bear it no longer, I sent Timothy to find out whether your faith was still strong. I was afraid that the tempter had gotten the best of you and that our work had been useless.
살전 3:6 But now Timothy has just returned, bringing us good news about your faith and love. He reports that you always remember our visit with joy and that you want to see us as much as we want to see you.
살전 3:7 So we have been greatly encouraged in the midst of our troubles and suffering, dear brothers and sisters①, because you have remained strong in your faith. / ①Greek brothers
살전 3:8 It gives us new life to know that you are standing firm in the Lord.
살전 3:9 How we thank God for you! Because of you we have great joy as we enter God's presence.
살전 3:10 Night and day we pray earnestly for you, asking God to let us see you again to fill the gaps in your faith.
살전 3:11 May God our Father and our Lord Jesus bring us to you very soon.
살전 3:12 And may the Lord make your love for one another and for all people grow and overflow, just as our love for you overflows.
살전 3:13 May he, as a result, make your hearts strong, blameless, and holy as you stand before God our Father when our Lord Jesus comes again with all his holy people. Amen.
살전 4:1 Finally, dear brothers and sisters①, we urge you in the name of the Lord Jesus to live in a way that pleases God, as we have taught you. You live this way already, and we encourage you to do so even more. / ①Greek brothers; also in 4.10, 13
살전 4:2 For you remember what we taught you by the authority of the Lord Jesus.
살전 4:3 God's will is for you to be holy, so stay away from all sexual sin.
살전 4:4 Then each of you will control his own body① and live in holiness and honor - / ①Or will know how to take a wife for himself; or will learn to live with his own wife; Greek reads will know how to possess his own vessel
살전 4:5 not in lustful passion like the pagans who do not know God and his ways.
살전 4:6 Never harm or cheat a Christian brother in this matter by violating his wife①, for the Lord avenges all such sins, as we have solemnly warned you before. / ①Greek Never harm or cheat a brother in this matter
살전 4:7 God has called us to live holy lives, not impure lives.
살전 4:8 Therefore, anyone who refuses to live by these rules is not disobeying human teaching but is rejecting God, who gives his Holy Spirit to you.
살전 4:9 But we don't need to write to you about the importance of loving each other①, for God himself has taught you to love one another. / ①Greek about brotherly love
살전 4:10 Indeed, you already show your love for all the believers① throughout Macedonia. Even so, dear brothers and sisters, we urge you to love them even more. / ①Greek the brothers
살전 4:11 Make it your goal to live a quiet life, minding your own business and working with your hands, just as we instructed you before.
살전 4:12 Then people who are not Christians will respect the way you live, and you will not need to depend on others.
살전 4:13 And now, dear brothers and sisters, we want you to know what will happen to the believers who have died① so you will not grieve like people who have no hope. / ①Greek those who have fallen asleep; also in 4.14
살전 4:14 For since we believe that Jesus died and was raised to life again, we also believe that when Jesus returns, God will bring back with him the believers who have died.
살전 4:15 We tell you this directly from the Lord： We who are still living when the Lord returns will not meet him ahead of those who have died①. / ①Greek those who have fallen asleep
살전 4:16 For the Lord himself will come down from heaven with a commanding shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trumpet call of God. First, the Christians who have died① will rise from their graves. / ①Greek the dead in Christ
살전 4:17 Then, together with them, we who are still alive and remain on the earth will be caught up in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. Then we will be with the Lord forever.
살전 4:18 So encourage each other with these words.
살전 5:1 Now concerning how and when all this will happen, dear brothers and sisters①, we don't really need to write you. / ①Greek brothers; also in 5.4, 12, 14, 25, 26, 27
살전 5:2 For you know quite well that the day of the Lord's return will come unexpectedly, like a thief in the night.
살전 5:3 When people are saying, "Everything is peaceful and secure," then disaster will fall on them as suddenly as a pregnant woman's labor pains begin. And there will be no escape.
살전 5:4 But you aren't in the dark about these things, dear brothers and sisters, and you won't be surprised when the day of the Lord comes like a thief①. / ①Some manuscripts read comes upon you as if you were thieves
살전 5:5 For you are all children of the light and of the day; we don't belong to darkness and night.
살전 5:6 So be on your guard, not asleep like the others. Stay alert and be clearheaded.
살전 5:7 Night is the time when people sleep and drinkers get drunk.
살전 5:8 But let us who live in the light be clearheaded, protected by the armor of faith and love, and wearing as our helmet the confidence of our salvation.
살전 5:9 For God chose to save us through our Lord Jesus Christ, not to pour out his anger on us.
살전 5:10 Christ died for us so that, whether we are dead or alive when he returns, we can live with him forever.
살전 5:11 So encourage each other and build each other up, just as you are already doing.
살전 5:12 Dear brothers and sisters, honor those who are your leaders in the Lord's work. They work hard among you and give you spiritual guidance.
살전 5:13 Show them great respect and wholehearted love because of their work. And live peacefully with each other.
살전 5:14 Brothers and sisters, we urge you to warn those who are lazy. Encourage those who are timid. Take tender care of those who are weak. Be patient with everyone.
살전 5:15 See that no one pays back evil for evil, but always try to do good to each other and to all people.
살전 5:16 Always be joyful.
살전 5:17 Never stop praying.
살전 5:18 Be thankful in all circumstances, for this is God's will for you who belong to Christ Jesus.
살전 5:19 Do not stifle the Holy Spirit.
살전 5:20 Do not scoff at prophecies,
살전 5:21 but test everything that is said. Hold on to what is good.
살전 5:22 Stay away from every kind of evil.
살전 5:23 Now may the God of peace make you holy in every way, and may your whole spirit and soul and body be kept blameless until our Lord Jesus Christ comes again.
살전 5:24 God will make this happen, for he who calls you is faithful.
살전 5:25 Dear brothers and sisters, pray for us.
살전 5:26 Greet all the brothers and sisters with Christian love①. / ①Greek with a holy kiss
살전 5:27 I command you in the name of the Lord to read this letter to all the brothers and sisters.
살전 5:28 May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
2Thessalonians
살후 1:1 This letter is from Paul, Silas①, and Timothy. We are writing to the church in Thessalonica, to you who belong to God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. / ①Greek Silvanus, the Greek form of the name
살후 1:2 May God our Father① and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace. / ①Some manuscripts read God the Father
살후 1:3 Dear brothers and sisters①, we can't help but thank God for you, because your faith is flourishing and your love for one another is growing. / ①Greek Brothers
살후 1:4 We proudly tell God's other churches about your endurance and faithfulness in all the persecutions and hardships you are suffering.
살후 1:5 And God will use this persecution to show his justice and to make you worthy of his Kingdom, for which you are suffering.
살후 1:6 In his justice he will pay back those who persecute you.
살후 1:7 And God will provide rest for you who are being persecuted and also for us when the Lord Jesus appears from heaven. He will come with his mighty angels,
살후 1:8 in flaming fire, bringing judgment on those who don't know God and on those who refuse to obey the Good News of our Lord Jesus.
살후 1:9 They will be punished with eternal destruction, forever separated from the Lord and from his glorious power.
살후 1:10 When he comes on that day, he will receive glory from his holy people - praise from all who believe. And this includes you, for you believed what we told you about him.
살후 1:11 So we keep on praying for you, asking our God to enable you to live a life worthy of his call. May he give you the power to accomplish all the good things your faith prompts you to do.
살후 1:12 Then the name of our Lord Jesus will be honored because of the way you live, and you will be honored along with him. This is all made possible because of the grace of our God and Lord, Jesus Christ①. / ①Or of our God and our Lord Jesus Christ
살후 2:1 Now, dear brothers and sisters①, let us clarify some things about the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and how we will be gathered to meet him. / ①Greek brothers; also in 2.13, 15
살후 2:2 Don't be so easily shaken or alarmed by those who say that the day of the Lord has already begun. Don't believe them, even if they claim to have had a spiritual vision, a revelation, or a letter supposedly from us.
살후 2:3 Don't be fooled by what they say. For that day will not come until there is a great rebellion against God and the man of lawlessness① is revealed - the one who brings destruction②. / ①Some manuscripts read the man of sin ②Greek the son of destruction
살후 2:4 He will exalt himself and defy everything that people call god and every object of worship. He will even sit in the temple of God, claiming that he himself is God.
살후 2:5 Don't you remember that I told you about all this when I was with you?
살후 2:6 And you know what is holding him back, for he can be revealed only when his time comes.
살후 2:7 For this lawlessness is already at work secretly, and it will remain secret until the one who is holding it back steps out of the way.
살후 2:8 Then the man of lawlessness will be revealed, but the Lord Jesus will kill him with the breath of his mouth and destroy him by the splendor of his coming.
살후 2:9 This man will come to do the work of Satan with counterfeit power and signs and miracles.
살후 2:10 He will use every kind of evil deception to fool those on their way to destruction, because they refuse to love and accept the truth that would save them.
살후 2:11 So God will cause them to be greatly deceived, and they will believe these lies.
살후 2:12 Then they will be condemned for enjoying evil rather than believing the truth.
살후 2:13 As for us, we can't help but thank God for you, dear brothers and sisters loved by the Lord. We are always thankful that God chose you to be among the first① to experience salvation - a salvation that came through the Spirit who makes you holy and through your belief in the truth. / ①Some manuscripts read chose you from the very beginning
살후 2:14 He called you to salvation when we told you the Good News; now you can share in the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
살후 2:15 With all these things in mind, dear brothers and sisters, stand firm and keep a strong grip on the teaching we passed on to you both in person and by letter.
살후 2:16 Now may our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God our Father, who loved us and by his grace gave us eternal comfort and a wonderful hope,
살후 2:17 comfort you and strengthen you in every good thing you do and say.
살후 3:1 Finally, dear brothers and sisters①, we ask you to pray for us. Pray that the Lord's message will spread rapidly and be honored wherever it goes, just as when it came to you. / ①Greek brothers; also in 3.6, 13
살후 3:2 Pray, too, that we will be rescued from wicked and evil people, for not everyone is a believer.
살후 3:3 But the Lord is faithful; he will strengthen you and guard you from the evil one①. / ①Or from evil
살후 3:4 And we are confident in the Lord that you are doing and will continue to do the things we commanded you.
살후 3:5 May the Lord lead your hearts into a full understanding and expression of the love of God and the patient endurance that comes from Christ.
살후 3:6 And now, dear brothers and sisters, we give you this command in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ： Stay away from all believers① who live idle lives and don't follow the tradition they received② from us. / ①Greek from every brother ②Some manuscripts read you received
살후 3:7 For you know that you ought to imitate us. We were not idle when we were with you.
살후 3:8 We never accepted food from anyone without paying for it. We worked hard day and night so we would not be a burden to any of you.
살후 3:9 We certainly had the right to ask you to feed us, but we wanted to give you an example to follow.
살후 3:10 Even while we were with you, we gave you this command： "Those unwilling to work will not get to eat."
살후 3:11 Yet we hear that some of you are living idle lives, refusing to work and meddling in other people's business.
살후 3:12 We command such people and urge them in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ to settle down and work to earn their own living.
살후 3:13 As for the rest of you, dear brothers and sisters, never get tired of doing good.
살후 3:14 Take note of those who refuse to obey what we say in this letter. Stay away from them so they will be ashamed.
살후 3:15 Don't think of them as enemies, but warn them as you would a brother or sister①. / ①Greek as a brother
살후 3:16 Now may the Lord of peace himself give you his peace at all times and in every situation. The Lord be with you all.
살후 3:17 HERE IS MY GREETING IN MY OWN HANDWRITING - PAUL. I DO THIS IN ALL MY LETTERS TO PROVE THEY ARE FROM ME.
살후 3:18 May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
1Timothy
딤전 1:1 This letter is from Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus, appointed by the command of God our Savior and Christ Jesus, who gives us hope.
딤전 1:2 I am writing to Timothy, my true son in the faith. May God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord give you grace, mercy, and peace.
딤전 1:3 When I left for Macedonia, I urged you to stay there in Ephesus and stop those whose teaching is contrary to the truth.
딤전 1:4 Don't let them waste their time in endless discussion of myths and spiritual pedigrees. These things only lead to meaningless speculations①, which don't help people live a life of faith in God②. / ①Greek in myths and endless genealogies, which cause speculation ②Greek a stewardship of God in faith
딤전 1:5 The purpose of my instruction is that all believers would be filled with love that comes from a pure heart, a clear conscience, and genuine faith.
딤전 1:6 But some people have missed this whole point. They have turned away from these things and spend their time in meaningless discussions.
딤전 1:7 They want to be known as teachers of the law of Moses, but they don't know what they are talking about, even though they speak so confidently.
딤전 1:8 We know that the law is good when used correctly.
딤전 1:9 For the law was not intended for people who do what is right. It is for people who are lawless and rebellious, who are ungodly and sinful, who consider nothing sacred and defile what is holy, who kill their father or mother or commit other murders.
딤전 1:10 The law is for people who are sexually immoral, or who practice homosexuality, or are slave traders①, liars, promise breakers, or who do anything else that contradicts the wholesome teaching / ①Or kidnappers
딤전 1:11 that comes from the glorious Good News entrusted to me by our blessed God.
딤전 1:12 I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who has given me strength to do his work. He considered me trustworthy and appointed me to serve him,
딤전 1:13 even though I used to blaspheme the name of Christ. In my insolence, I persecuted his people. But God had mercy on me because I did it in ignorance and unbelief.
딤전 1:14 Oh, how generous and gracious our Lord was! He filled me with the faith and love that come from Christ Jesus.
딤전 1:15 This is a trustworthy saying, and everyone should accept it： "Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners" - and I am the worst of them all.
딤전 1:16 But God had mercy on me so that Christ Jesus could use me as a prime example of his great patience with even the worst sinners. Then others will realize that they, too, can believe in him and receive eternal life.
딤전 1:17 All honor and glory to God forever and ever! He is the eternal King, the unseen one who never dies; he alone is God. Amen.
딤전 1:18 Timothy, my son, here are my instructions for you, based on the prophetic words spoken about you earlier. May they help you fight well in the Lord's battles.
딤전 1:19 Cling to your faith in Christ, and keep your conscience clear. For some people have deliberately violated their consciences; as a result, their faith has been shipwrecked.
딤전 1:20 Hymenaeus and Alexander are two examples. I threw them out and handed them over to Satan so they might learn not to blaspheme God.
딤전 2:1 I urge you, first of all, to pray for all people. Ask God to help them; intercede on their behalf, and give thanks for them.
딤전 2:2 Pray this way for kings and all who are in authority so that we can live peaceful and quiet lives marked by godliness and dignity.
딤전 2:3 This is good and pleases God our Savior,
딤전 2:4 who wants everyone to be saved and to understand the truth.
딤전 2:5 For there is only one God and one Mediator who can reconcile God and humanity - the man Christ Jesus.
딤전 2:6 He gave his life to purchase freedom for everyone. This is the message God gave to the world at just the right time.
딤전 2:7 And I have been chosen as a preacher and apostle to teach the Gentiles this message about faith and truth. I'm not exaggerating - just telling the truth.
딤전 2:8 In every place of worship, I want men to pray with holy hands lifted up to God, free from anger and controversy.
딤전 2:9 And I want women to be modest in their appearance①. They should wear decent and appropriate clothing and not draw attention to themselves by the way they fix their hair or by wearing gold or pearls or expensive clothes. / ①Or to pray in modest apparel
딤전 2:10 For women who claim to be devoted to God should make themselves attractive by the good things they do.
딤전 2:11 Women should learn quietly and submissively.
딤전 2:12 I do not let women teach men or have authority over them①. Let them listen quietly. / ①Or teach men or usurp their authority
딤전 2:13 For God made Adam first, and afterward he made Eve.
딤전 2:14 And it was not Adam who was deceived by Satan. The woman was deceived, and sin was the result.
딤전 2:15 But women will be saved through childbearing①, assuming they continue to live in faith, love, holiness, and modesty. / ①Or will be saved by accepting their role as mothers, or will be saved by the birth of the Child
딤전 3:1 This is a trustworthy saying： "If someone aspires to be an elder①, he desires an honorable position." / ①Or an overseer, or a bishop; also in 3.2, 6
딤전 3:2 So an elder must be a man whose life is above reproach. He must be faithful to his wife①. He must exercise self-control, live wisely, and have a good reputation. He must enjoy having guests in his home, and he must be able to teach. / ①Or must have only one wife, or must be married only once; Greek reads must be the husband of one wife; also in 3.12
딤전 3:3 He must not be a heavy drinker① or be violent. He must be gentle, not quarrelsome, and not love money. / ①Greek must not drink too much wine; similarly in 3.8
딤전 3:4 He must manage his own family well, having children who respect and obey him.
딤전 3:5 For if a man cannot manage his own household, how can he take care of God's church?
딤전 3:6 An elder must not be a new believer, because he might become proud, and the devil would cause him to fall①. / ①Or he might fall into the same judgment as the devil
딤전 3:7 Also, people outside the church must speak well of him so that he will not be disgraced and fall into the devil's trap.
딤전 3:8 In the same way, deacons must be well respected and have integrity. They must not be heavy drinkers or dishonest with money.
딤전 3:9 They must be committed to the mystery of the faith now revealed and must live with a clear conscience.
딤전 3:10 Before they are appointed as deacons, let them be closely examined. If they pass the test, then let them serve as deacons.
딤전 3:11 In the same way, their wives① must be respected and must not slander others. They must exercise self-control and be faithful in everything they do. / ①Or the women deacons. The Greek word can be translated women or wives
딤전 3:12 A deacon must be faithful to his wife, and he must manage his children and household well.
딤전 3:13 Those who do well as deacons will be rewarded with respect from others and will have increased confidence in their faith in Christ Jesus.
딤전 3:14 I am writing these things to you now, even though I hope to be with you soon,
딤전 3:15 so that if I am delayed, you will know how people must conduct themselves in the household of God. This is the church of the living God, which is the pillar and foundation of the truth.
딤전 3:16 Without question, this is the great mystery of our faith①： Christ② was revealed in a human body and vindicated by the Spirit③. He was seen by angels and announced to the nations. He was believed in throughout the world and taken to heaven in glory. / ①Or of godliness ②Greek He who; other manuscripts read God ③Or in his spirit
딤전 4:1 Now the Holy Spirit tells us clearly that in the last times some will turn away from the true faith; they will follow deceptive spirits and teachings that come from demons.
딤전 4:2 These people are hypocrites and liars, and their consciences are dead①. / ①Greek are seared
딤전 4:3 They will say it is wrong to be married and wrong to eat certain foods. But God created those foods to be eaten with thanks by faithful people who know the truth.
딤전 4:4 Since everything God created is good, we should not reject any of it but receive it with thanks.
딤전 4:5 For we know it is made acceptable① by the word of God and prayer. / ①Or made holy
딤전 4:6 If you explain these things to the brothers and sisters①, Timothy, you will be a worthy servant of Christ Jesus, one who is nourished by the message of faith and the good teaching you have followed. / ①Greek brothers
딤전 4:7 Do not waste time arguing over godless ideas and old wives' tales. Instead, train yourself to be godly.
딤전 4:8 "Physical training is good, but training for godliness is much better, promising benefits in this life and in the life to come."
딤전 4:9 This is a trustworthy saying, and everyone should accept it.
딤전 4:10 This is why we work hard and continue to struggle①, for our hope is in the living God, who is the Savior of all people and particularly of all believers. / ①Some manuscripts read continue to suffer
딤전 4:11 Teach these things and insist that everyone learn them.
딤전 4:12 Don't let anyone think less of you because you are young. Be an example to all believers in what you say, in the way you live, in your love, your faith, and your purity.
딤전 4:13 Until I get there, focus on reading the Scriptures to the church, encouraging the believers, and teaching them.
딤전 4:14 Do not neglect the spiritual gift you received through the prophecy spoken over you when the elders of the church laid their hands on you.
딤전 4:15 Give your complete attention to these matters. Throw yourself into your tasks so that everyone will see your progress.
딤전 4:16 Keep a close watch on how you live and on your teaching. Stay true to what is right for the sake of your own salvation and the salvation of those who hear you.
딤전 5:1 Never speak harshly to an older man①, but appeal to him respectfully as you would to your own father. Talk to younger men as you would to your own brothers. / ①Or an elder
딤전 5:2 Treat older women as you would your mother, and treat younger women with all purity as you would your own sisters.
딤전 5:3 Take care of① any widow who has no one else to care for her. / ①Or Honor
딤전 5:4 But if she has children or grandchildren, their first responsibility is to show godliness at home and repay their parents by taking care of them. This is something that pleases God.
딤전 5:5 Now a true widow, a woman who is truly alone in this world, has placed her hope in God. She prays night and day, asking God for his help.
딤전 5:6 But the widow who lives only for pleasure is spiritually dead even while she lives.
딤전 5:7 Give these instructions to the church so that no one will be open to criticism.
딤전 5:8 But those who won't care for their relatives, especially those in their own household, have denied the true faith. Such people are worse than unbelievers.
딤전 5:9 A widow who is put on the list for support must be a woman who is at least sixty years old and was faithful to her husband①. / ①Greek was the wife of one husband
딤전 5:10 She must be well respected by everyone because of the good she has done. Has she brought up her children well? Has she been kind to strangers and served other believers humbly①? Has she helped those who are in trouble? Has she always been ready to do good? / ①Greek and washed the feet of God's holy people
딤전 5:11 The younger widows should not be on the list, because their physical desires will overpower their devotion to Christ and they will want to remarry.
딤전 5:12 Then they would be guilty of breaking their previous pledge.
딤전 5:13 And if they are on the list, they will learn to be lazy and will spend their time gossiping from house to house, meddling in other people's business and talking about things they shouldn't.
딤전 5:14 So I advise these younger widows to marry again, have children, and take care of their own homes. Then the enemy will not be able to say anything against them.
딤전 5:15 For I am afraid that some of them have already gone astray and now follow Satan.
딤전 5:16 If a woman who is a believer has relatives who are widows, she must take care of them and not put the responsibility on the church. Then the church can care for the widows who are truly alone.
딤전 5:17 Elders who do their work well should be respected and paid well①, especially those who work hard at both preaching and teaching. / ①Greek should be worthy of double honor
딤전 5:18 For the Scripture says, "You must not muzzle an ox to keep it from eating as it treads out the grain." And in another place, "Those who work deserve their pay!"① / ①Deut 25.4; Luke 10.7
딤전 5:19 Do not listen to an accusation against an elder unless it is confirmed by two or three witnesses.
딤전 5:20 Those who sin should be reprimanded in front of the whole church; this will serve as a strong warning to others.
딤전 5:21 I solemnly command you in the presence of God and Christ Jesus and the highest angels to obey these instructions without taking sides or showing favoritism to anyone.
딤전 5:22 Never be in a hurry about appointing a church leader①. Do not share in the sins of others. Keep yourself pure. / ①Greek about the laying on of hands
딤전 5:23 Don't drink only water. You ought to drink a little wine for the sake of your stomach because you are sick so often.
딤전 5:24 Remember, the sins of some people are obvious, leading them to certain judgment. But there are others whose sins will not be revealed until later.
딤전 5:25 In the same way, the good deeds of some people are obvious. And the good deeds done in secret will someday come to light.
딤전 6:1 All slaves should show full respect for their masters so they will not bring shame on the name of God and his teaching.
딤전 6:2 If the masters are believers, that is no excuse for being disrespectful. Those slaves should work all the harder because their efforts are helping other believers① who are well loved. Teach these things, Timothy, and encourage everyone to obey them. / ①Greek brothers
딤전 6:3 Some people may contradict our teaching, but these are the wholesome teachings of the Lord Jesus Christ. These teachings promote a godly life.
딤전 6:4 Anyone who teaches something different is arrogant and lacks understanding. Such a person has an unhealthy desire to quibble over the meaning of words. This stirs up arguments ending in jealousy, division, slander, and evil suspicions.
딤전 6:5 These people always cause trouble. Their minds are corrupt, and they have turned their backs on the truth. To them, a show of godliness is just a way to become wealthy.
딤전 6:6 Yet true godliness with contentment is itself great wealth.
딤전 6:7 After all, we brought nothing with us when we came into the world, and we can't take anything with us when we leave it.
딤전 6:8 So if we have enough food and clothing, let us be content.
딤전 6:9 But people who long to be rich fall into temptation and are trapped by many foolish and harmful desires that plunge them into ruin and destruction.
딤전 6:10 For the love of money is the root of all kinds of evil. And some people, craving money, have wandered from the true faith and pierced themselves with many sorrows.
딤전 6:11 But you, Timothy, are a man of God; so run from all these evil things. Pursue righteousness and a godly life, along with faith, love, perseverance, and gentleness.
딤전 6:12 Fight the good fight for the true faith. Hold tightly to the eternal life to which God has called you, which you have confessed so well before many witnesses.
딤전 6:13 And I charge you before God, who gives life to all, and before Christ Jesus, who gave a good testimony before Pontius Pilate,
딤전 6:14 that you obey this command without wavering. Then no one can find fault with you from now until our Lord Jesus Christ comes again.
딤전 6:15 For at just the right time Christ will be revealed from heaven by the blessed and only almighty God, the King of all kings and Lord of all lords.
딤전 6:16 He alone can never die, and he lives in light so brilliant that no human can approach him. No human eye has ever seen him, nor ever will. All honor and power to him forever! Amen.
딤전 6:17 Teach those who are rich in this world not to be proud and not to trust in their money, which is so unreliable. Their trust should be in God, who richly gives us all we need for our enjoyment.
딤전 6:18 Tell them to use their money to do good. They should be rich in good works and generous to those in need, always being ready to share with others.
딤전 6:19 By doing this they will be storing up their treasure as a good foundation for the future so that they may experience true life.
딤전 6:20 Timothy, guard what God has entrusted to you. Avoid godless, foolish discussions with those who oppose you with their so-called knowledge.
딤전 6:21 Some people have wandered from the faith by following such foolishness. May God's grace be with you all.
2Timothy
딤후 1:1 This letter is from Paul, chosen by the will of God to be an apostle of Christ Jesus. I have been sent out to tell others about the life he has promised through faith in Christ Jesus.
딤후 1:2 I am writing to Timothy, my dear son. May God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord give you grace, mercy, and peace.
딤후 1:3 Timothy, I thank God for you - the God I serve with a clear conscience, just as my ancestors did. Night and day I constantly remember you in my prayers.
딤후 1:4 I long to see you again, for I remember your tears as we parted. And I will be filled with joy when we are together again.
딤후 1:5 I remember your genuine faith, for you share the faith that first filled your grandmother Lois and your mother, Eunice. And I know that same faith continues strong in you.
딤후 1:6 This is why I remind you to fan into flames the spiritual gift God gave you when I laid my hands on you.
딤후 1:7 For God has not given us a spirit of fear and timidity, but of power, love, and self-discipline.
딤후 1:8 So never be ashamed to tell others about our Lord. And don't be ashamed of me, either, even though I'm in prison for him. With the strength God gives you, be ready to suffer with me for the sake of the Good News.
딤후 1:9 For God saved us and called us to live a holy life. He did this, not because we deserved it, but because that was his plan from before the beginning of time - to show us his grace through Christ Jesus.
딤후 1:10 And now he has made all of this plain to us by the appearing of Christ Jesus, our Savior. He broke the power of death and illuminated the way to life and immortality through the Good News.
딤후 1:11 And God chose me to be a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher of this Good News.
딤후 1:12 That is why I am suffering here in prison. But I am not ashamed of it, for I know the one in whom I trust, and I am sure that he is able to guard what I have entrusted to him① until the day of his return. / ①Or what has been entrusted to me
딤후 1:13 Hold on to the pattern of wholesome teaching you learned from me - a pattern shaped by the faith and love that you have in Christ Jesus.
딤후 1:14 Through the power of the Holy Spirit who lives within us, carefully guard the precious truth that has been entrusted to you.
딤후 1:15 As you know, everyone from the province of Asia has deserted me - even Phygelus and Hermogenes.
딤후 1:16 May the Lord show special kindness to Onesiphorus and all his family because he often visited and encouraged me. He was never ashamed of me because I was in chains.
딤후 1:17 When he came to Rome, he searched everywhere until he found me.
딤후 1:18 May the Lord show him special kindness on the day of Christ's return. And you know very well how helpful he was in Ephesus.
딤후 2:1 Timothy, my dear son, be strong through the grace that God gives you in Christ Jesus.
딤후 2:2 You have heard me teach things that have been confirmed by many reliable witnesses. Now teach these truths to other trustworthy people who will be able to pass them on to others.
딤후 2:3 Endure suffering along with me, as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
딤후 2:4 Soldiers don't get tied up in the affairs of civilian life, for then they cannot please the officer who enlisted them.
딤후 2:5 And athletes cannot win the prize unless they follow the rules.
딤후 2:6 And hardworking farmers should be the first to enjoy the fruit of their labor.
딤후 2:7 Think about what I am saying. The Lord will help you understand all these things.
딤후 2:8 Always remember that Jesus Christ, a descendant of King David, was raised from the dead. This is the Good News I preach.
딤후 2:9 And because I preach this Good News, I am suffering and have been chained like a criminal. But the word of God cannot be chained.
딤후 2:10 So I am willing to endure anything if it will bring salvation and eternal glory in Christ Jesus to those God has chosen.
딤후 2:11 This is a trustworthy saying： If we die with him, we will also live with him.
딤후 2:12 If we endure hardship, we will reign with him. If we deny him, he will deny us.
딤후 2:13 If we are unfaithful, he remains faithful, for he cannot deny who he is.
딤후 2:14 Remind everyone about these things, and command them in God's presence to stop fighting over words. Such arguments are useless, and they can ruin those who hear them.
딤후 2:15 Work hard so you can present yourself to God and receive his approval. Be a good worker, one who does not need to be ashamed and who correctly explains the word of truth.
딤후 2:16 Avoid worthless, foolish talk that only leads to more godless behavior.
딤후 2:17 This kind of talk spreads like cancer①, as in the case of Hymenaeus and Philetus. / ①Greek gangrene
딤후 2:18 They have left the path of truth, claiming that the resurrection of the dead has already occurred; in this way, they have turned some people away from the faith.
딤후 2:19 But God's truth stands firm like a foundation stone with this inscription： "The LORD knows those who are his,"① and "All who belong to the LORD must turn away from evil."② / ①Num 16.5 ②See Isa 52.11
딤후 2:20 In a wealthy home some utensils are made of gold and silver, and some are made of wood and clay. The expensive utensils are used for special occasions, and the cheap ones are for everyday use.
딤후 2:21 If you keep yourself pure, you will be a special utensil for honorable use. Your life will be clean, and you will be ready for the Master to use you for every good work.
딤후 2:22 Run from anything that stimulates youthful lusts. Instead, pursue righteous living, faithfulness, love, and peace. Enjoy the companionship of those who call on the Lord with pure hearts.
딤후 2:23 Again I say, don't get involved in foolish, ignorant arguments that only start fights.
딤후 2:24 A servant of the Lord must not quarrel but must be kind to everyone, be able to teach, and be patient with difficult people.
딤후 2:25 Gently instruct those who oppose the truth. Perhaps God will change those people's hearts, and they will learn the truth.
딤후 2:26 Then they will come to their senses and escape from the devil's trap. For they have been held captive by him to do whatever he wants.
딤후 3:1 You should know this, Timothy, that in the last days there will be very difficult times.
딤후 3:2 For people will love only themselves and their money. They will be boastful and proud, scoffing at God, disobedient to their parents, and ungrateful. They will consider nothing sacred.
딤후 3:3 They will be unloving and unforgiving; they will slander others and have no self-control. They will be cruel and hate what is good.
딤후 3:4 They will betray their friends, be reckless, be puffed up with pride, and love pleasure rather than God.
딤후 3:5 They will act religious, but they will reject the power that could make them godly. Stay away from people like that!
딤후 3:6 They are the kind who work their way into people's homes and win the confidence of① vulnerable women who are burdened with the guilt of sin and controlled by various desires. / ①Greek and take captive
딤후 3:7 (Such women are forever following new teachings, but they are never able to understand the truth.)
딤후 3:8 These teachers oppose the truth just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses. They have depraved minds and a counterfeit faith.
딤후 3:9 But they won't get away with this for long. Someday everyone will recognize what fools they are, just as with Jannes and Jambres.
딤후 3:10 But you, Timothy, certainly know what I teach, and how I live, and what my purpose in life is. You know my faith, my patience, my love, and my endurance.
딤후 3:11 You know how much persecution and suffering I have endured. You know all about how I was persecuted in Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra - but the Lord rescued me from all of it.
딤후 3:12 Yes, and everyone who wants to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution.
딤후 3:13 But evil people and impostors will flourish. They will deceive others and will themselves be deceived.
딤후 3:14 But you must remain faithful to the things you have been taught. You know they are true, for you know you can trust those who taught you.
딤후 3:15 You have been taught the holy Scriptures from childhood, and they have given you the wisdom to receive the salvation that comes by trusting in Christ Jesus.
딤후 3:16 All Scripture is inspired by God and is useful to teach us what is true and to make us realize what is wrong in our lives. It corrects us when we are wrong and teaches us to do what is right.
딤후 3:17 God uses it to prepare and equip his people to do every good work.
딤후 4:1 I solemnly urge you in the presence of God and Christ Jesus, who will someday judge the living and the dead when he appears to set up his Kingdom.
딤후 4:2 Preach the word of God. Be prepared, whether the time is favorable or not. Patiently correct, rebuke, and encourage your people with good teaching.
딤후 4:3 For a time is coming when people will no longer listen to sound and wholesome teaching. They will follow their own desires and will look for teachers who will tell them whatever their itching ears want to hear.
딤후 4:4 They will reject the truth and chase after myths.
딤후 4:5 But you should keep a clear mind in every situation. Don't be afraid of suffering for the Lord. Work at telling others the Good News, and fully carry out the ministry God has given you.
딤후 4:6 As for me, my life has already been poured out as an offering to God. The time of my death is near.
딤후 4:7 I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, and I have remained faithful.
딤후 4:8 And now the prize awaits me - the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give me on the day of his return. And the prize is not just for me but for all who eagerly look forward to his appearing.
딤후 4:9 Timothy, please come as soon as you can.
딤후 4:10 Demas has deserted me because he loves the things of this life and has gone to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus has gone to Dalmatia.
딤후 4:11 Only Luke is with me. Bring Mark with you when you come, for he will be helpful to me in my ministry.
딤후 4:12 I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
딤후 4:13 When you come, be sure to bring the coat I left with Carpus at Troas. Also bring my books, and especially my papers①. / ①Greek especially the parchments
딤후 4:14 Alexander the coppersmith did me much harm, but the Lord will judge him for what he has done.
딤후 4:15 Be careful of him, for he fought against everything we said.
딤후 4:16 The first time I was brought before the judge, no one came with me. Everyone abandoned me. May it not be counted against them.
딤후 4:17 But the Lord stood with me and gave me strength so that I might preach the Good News in its entirety for all the Gentiles to hear. And he rescued me from certain death①. / ①Greek from the mouth of a lion
딤후 4:18 Yes, and the Lord will deliver me from every evil attack and will bring me safely into his heavenly Kingdom. All glory to God forever and ever! Amen.
딤후 4:19 Give my greetings to Priscilla and Aquila and those living in the household of Onesiphorus.
딤후 4:20 Erastus stayed at Corinth, and I left Trophimus sick at Miletus.
딤후 4:21 Do your best to get here before winter. Eubulus sends you greetings, and so do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers and sisters①. / ①Greek brothers
딤후 4:22 May the Lord be with your spirit. And may his grace be with all of you.
Titus
딛 1:1 This letter is from Paul, a slave of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ. I have been sent to proclaim faith to① those God has chosen and to teach them to know the truth that shows them how to live godly lives. / ①Or to strengthen the faith of
딛 1:2 This truth gives them confidence that they have eternal life, which God - who does not lie - promised them before the world began.
딛 1:3 And now at just the right time he has revealed this message, which we announce to everyone. It is by the command of God our Savior that I have been entrusted with this work for him.
딛 1:4 I am writing to Titus, my true son in the faith that we share. May God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior give you grace and peace.
딛 1:5 I left you on the island of Crete so you could complete our work there and appoint elders in each town as I instructed you.
딛 1:6 An elder must live a blameless life. He must be faithful to his wife①, and his children must be believers who don't have a reputation for being wild or rebellious. / ①Or must have only one wife, or must be married only once; Greek reads must be the husband of one wife
딛 1:7 An elder① is a manager of God's household, so he must live a blameless life. He must not be arrogant or quick-tempered; he must not be a heavy drinker②, violent, or dishonest with money. / ①Or An overseer, or A bishop ②Greek must not drink too much wine
딛 1:8 Rather, he must enjoy having guests in his home, and he must love what is good. He must live wisely and be just. He must live a devout and disciplined life.
딛 1:9 He must have a strong belief in the trustworthy message he was taught; then he will be able to encourage others with wholesome teaching and show those who oppose it where they are wrong.
딛 1:10 For there are many rebellious people who engage in useless talk and deceive others. This is especially true of those who insist on circumcision for salvation.
딛 1:11 They must be silenced, because they are turning whole families away from the truth by their false teaching. And they do it only for money.
딛 1:12 Even one of their own men, a prophet from Crete, has said about them, "The people of Crete are all liars, cruel animals, and lazy gluttons."① / ①This quotation is from Epimenides of Knossos
딛 1:13 This is true. So reprimand them sternly to make them strong in the faith.
딛 1:14 They must stop listening to Jewish myths and the commands of people who have turned away from the truth.
딛 1:15 Everything is pure to those whose hearts are pure. But nothing is pure to those who are corrupt and unbelieving, because their minds and consciences are corrupted.
딛 1:16 Such people claim they know God, but they deny him by the way they live. They are detestable and disobedient, worthless for doing anything good.
딛 2:1 As for you, Titus, promote the kind of living that reflects wholesome teaching.
딛 2:2 Teach the older men to exercise self-control, to be worthy of respect, and to live wisely. They must have sound faith and be filled with love and patience.
딛 2:3 Similarly, teach the older women to live in a way that honors God. They must not slander others or be heavy drinkers①. Instead, they should teach others what is good. / ①Greek be enslaved to much wine
딛 2:4 These older women must train the younger women to love their husbands and their children,
딛 2:5 to live wisely and be pure, to work in their homes①, to do good, and to be submissive to their husbands. Then they will not bring shame on the word of God. / ①Some manuscripts read to care for their homes
딛 2:6 In the same way, encourage the young men to live wisely.
딛 2:7 And you yourself must be an example to them by doing good works of every kind. Let everything you do reflect the integrity and seriousness of your teaching.
딛 2:8 Teach the truth so that your teaching can't be criticized. Then those who oppose us will be ashamed and have nothing bad to say about us.
딛 2:9 Slaves must always obey their masters and do their best to please them. They must not talk back
딛 2:10 or steal, but must show themselves to be entirely trustworthy and good. Then they will make the teaching about God our Savior attractive in every way.
딛 2:11 For the grace of God has been revealed, bringing salvation to all people.
딛 2:12 And we are instructed to turn from godless living and sinful pleasures. We should live in this evil world with wisdom, righteousness, and devotion to God,
딛 2:13 while we look forward with hope to that wonderful day when the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ, will be revealed.
딛 2:14 He gave his life to free us from every kind of sin, to cleanse us, and to make us his very own people, totally committed to doing good deeds.
딛 2:15 You must teach these things and encourage the believers to do them. You have the authority to correct them when necessary, so don't let anyone disregard what you say.
딛 3:1 Remind the believers to submit to the government and its officers. They should be obedient, always ready to do what is good.
딛 3:2 They must not slander anyone and must avoid quarreling. Instead, they should be gentle and show true humility to everyone.
딛 3:3 Once we, too, were foolish and disobedient. We were misled and became slaves to many lusts and pleasures. Our lives were full of evil and envy, and we hated each other.
딛 3:4 But - "When God our Savior revealed his kindness and love,
딛 3:5 he saved us, not because of the righteous things we had done, but because of his mercy. He washed away our sins, giving us a new birth and new life through the Holy Spirit①. / ①Greek He saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit
딛 3:6 He generously poured out the Spirit upon us through Jesus Christ our Savior.
딛 3:7 Because of his grace he declared us righteous and gave us confidence that we will inherit eternal life."
딛 3:8 This is a trustworthy saying, and I want you to insist on these teachings so that all who trust in God will devote themselves to doing good. These teachings are good and beneficial for everyone.
딛 3:9 Do not get involved in foolish discussions about spiritual pedigrees① or in quarrels and fights about obedience to Jewish laws. These things are useless and a waste of time. / ①Or spiritual genealogies
딛 3:10 If people are causing divisions among you, give a first and second warning. After that, have nothing more to do with them.
딛 3:11 For people like that have turned away from the truth, and their own sins condemn them.
딛 3:12 I am planning to send either Artemas or Tychicus to you. As soon as one of them arrives, do your best to meet me at Nicopolis, for I have decided to stay there for the winter.
딛 3:13 Do everything you can to help Zenas the lawyer and Apollos with their trip. See that they are given everything they need.
딛 3:14 Our people must learn to do good by meeting the urgent needs of others; then they will not be unproductive.
딛 3:15 Everybody here sends greetings. Please give my greetings to the believers - all who love us. May God's grace be with you all.
Philemon
몬 1:1 This letter is from Paul, a prisoner for preaching the Good News about Christ Jesus, and from our brother Timothy. I am writing to Philemon, our beloved co-worker,
몬 1:2 and to our sister Apphia, and to our fellow soldier Archippus, and to the church that meets in your① house. / ①Throughout this letter, you and your are singular except in verses 3, 22, and 25
몬 1:3 May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace.
몬 1:4 I always thank my God when I pray for you, Philemon,
몬 1:5 because I keep hearing about your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all of God's people.
몬 1:6 And I am praying that you will put into action the generosity that comes from your faith as you understand and experience all the good things we have in Christ.
몬 1:7 Your love has given me much joy and comfort, my brother, for your kindness has often refreshed the hearts of God's people.
