벧전 5:1 And now, a word to you who are elders in the churches. I, too, am an elder and a witness to the sufferings of Christ. And I, too, will share in his glory when he is revealed to the whole world. As a fellow elder, I appeal to you.
벧전 5:2 Care for the flock that God has entrusted to you. Watch over it willingly, not grudgingly - not for what you will get out of it, but because you are eager to serve God.
벧전 5:3 Don't lord it over the people assigned to your care, but lead them by your own good example.
벧전 5:4 And when the Great Shepherd appears, you will receive a crown of never-ending glory and honor.
벧전 5:5 In the same way, you younger men must accept the authority of the elders. And all of you, serve each other in humility, for "God opposes the proud but favors the humble."① / ①Prov 3.34 (Greek version)
벧전 5:6 So humble yourselves under the mighty power of God, and at the right time he will lift you up in honor.
벧전 5:7 Give all your worries and cares to God, for he cares about you.
벧전 5:8 Stay alert! Watch out for your great enemy, the devil. He prowls around like a roaring lion, looking for someone to devour.
벧전 5:9 Stand firm against him, and be strong in your faith. Remember that your Christian brothers and sisters① all over the world are going through the same kind of suffering you are. / ①Greek your brothers
벧전 5:10 In his kindness God called you to share in his eternal glory by means of Christ Jesus. So after you have suffered a little while, he will restore, support, and strengthen you, and he will place you on a firm foundation.
벧전 5:11 All power to him forever! Amen.
벧전 5:12 I have written and sent this short letter to you with the help of Silas①, whom I commend to you as a faithful brother. My purpose in writing is to encourage you and assure you that what you are experiencing is truly part of God's grace for you. Stand firm in this grace. / ①Greek Silvanus
벧전 5:13 Your sister church here in Babylon① sends you greetings, and so does my son Mark. / ①Greek The elect one in Babylon. Babylon was probably symbolic for Rome
벧전 5:14 Greet each other with Christian love①. Peace be with all of you who are in Christ. / ①Greek with a kiss of love
2Peter
벧후 1:1 This letter is from Simon① Peter, a slave and apostle of Jesus Christ. I am writing to you who share the same precious faith we have. This faith was given to you because of the justice and fairness② of Jesus Christ, our God and Savior. / ①Greek Symeon ②Or to you in the righteousness
벧후 1:2 May God give you more and more grace and peace as you grow in your knowledge of God and Jesus our Lord.
벧후 1:3 By his divine power, God has given us everything we need for living a godly life. We have received all of this by coming to know him, the one who called us to himself by means of his marvelous glory and excellence.
벧후 1:4 And because of his glory and excellence, he has given us great and precious promises. These are the promises that enable you to share his divine nature and escape the world's corruption caused by human desires.
벧후 1:5 In view of all this, make every effort to respond to God's promises. Supplement your faith with a generous provision of moral excellence, and moral excellence with knowledge,
벧후 1:6 and knowledge with self-control, and self-control with patient endurance, and patient endurance with godliness,
벧후 1:7 and godliness with brotherly affection, and brotherly affection with love for everyone.
벧후 1:8 The more you grow like this, the more productive and useful you will be in your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
벧후 1:9 But those who fail to develop in this way are shortsighted or blind, forgetting that they have been cleansed from their old sins.
벧후 1:10 So, dear brothers and sisters①, work hard to prove that you really are among those God has called and chosen. Do these things, and you will never fall away. / ①Greek brothers
벧후 1:11 Then God will give you a grand entrance into the eternal Kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.
벧후 1:12 Therefore, I will always remind you about these things - even though you already know them and are standing firm in the truth you have been taught.
벧후 1:13 And it is only right that I should keep on reminding you as long as I live①. / ①Greek as long as I am in this tent [or tabernacle]
벧후 1:14 For our Lord Jesus Christ has shown me that I must soon leave this earthly life①, / ①Greek I must soon put off my tent [or tabernacle]
벧후 1:15 so I will work hard to make sure you always remember these things after I am gone.
벧후 1:16 For we were not making up clever stories when we told you about the powerful coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. We saw his majestic splendor with our own eyes
벧후 1:17 when he received honor and glory from God the Father. The voice from the majestic glory of God said to him, "This is my dearly loved Son, who brings me great joy."① / ①Matt 17.5; Mark 9.7; Luke 9.35
벧후 1:18 We ourselves heard that voice from heaven when we were with him on the holy mountain.
벧후 1:19 Because of that experience, we have even greater confidence in the message proclaimed by the prophets. You must pay close attention to what they wrote, for their words are like a lamp shining in a dark place - until the Day dawns, and Christ the Morning Star shines① in your hearts. / ①Or rises
벧후 1:20 Above all, you must realize that no prophecy in Scripture ever came from the prophet's own understanding①, / ①Or is a matter of one's own interpretation
벧후 1:21 or from human initiative. No, those prophets were moved by the Holy Spirit, and they spoke from God.
벧후 2:1 But there were also false prophets in Israel, just as there will be false teachers among you. They will cleverly teach destructive heresies and even deny the Master who bought them. In this way, they will bring sudden destruction on themselves.
벧후 2:2 Many will follow their evil teaching and shameful immorality. And because of these teachers, the way of truth will be slandered.
벧후 2:3 In their greed they will make up clever lies to get hold of your money. But God condemned them long ago, and their destruction will not be delayed.
벧후 2:4 For God did not spare even the angels who sinned. He threw them into hell①, in gloomy pits of darkness②, where they are being held until the day of judgment. / ①Greek Tartarus ②Some manuscripts read in chains of gloom
벧후 2:5 And God did not spare the ancient world - except for Noah and the seven others in his family. Noah warned the world of God's righteous judgment. So God protected Noah when he destroyed the world of ungodly people with a vast flood.
벧후 2:6 Later, God condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah and turned them into heaps of ashes. He made them an example of what will happen to ungodly people.
벧후 2:7 But God also rescued Lot out of Sodom because he was a righteous man who was sick of the shameful immorality of the wicked people around him.
벧후 2:8 Yes, Lot was a righteous man who was tormented in his soul by the wickedness he saw and heard day after day.
벧후 2:9 So you see, the Lord knows how to rescue godly people from their trials, even while keeping the wicked under punishment until the day of final judgment.
벧후 2:10 He is especially hard on those who follow their own twisted sexual desire, and who despise authority. These people are proud and arrogant, daring even to scoff at supernatural beings① without so much as trembling. / ①Greek at glorious ones, which are probably evil angels
벧후 2:11 But the angels, who are far greater in power and strength, do not dare to bring from the Lord① a charge of blasphemy against those supernatural beings. / ①Other manuscripts read to the Lord; still others do not include this phrase at all
벧후 2:12 These false teachers are like unthinking animals, creatures of instinct, born to be caught and destroyed. They scoff at things they do not understand, and like animals, they will be destroyed.
벧후 2:13 Their destruction is their reward for the harm they have done. They love to indulge in evil pleasures in broad daylight. They are a disgrace and a stain among you. They delight in deception① even as they eat with you in your fellowship meals. / ①Some manuscripts read in fellowship meals
벧후 2:14 They commit adultery with their eyes, and their desire for sin is never satisfied. They lure unstable people into sin, and they are well trained in greed. They live under God's curse.
벧후 2:15 They have wandered off the right road and followed the footsteps of Balaam son of Beor①, who loved to earn money by doing wrong. / ①Some manuscripts read Bosor
벧후 2:16 But Balaam was stopped from his mad course when his donkey rebuked him with a human voice.
벧후 2:17 These people are as useless as dried-up springs or as mist blown away by the wind. They are doomed to blackest darkness.
벧후 2:18 They brag about themselves with empty, foolish boasting. With an appeal to twisted sexual desires, they lure back into sin those who have barely escaped from a lifestyle of deception.
벧후 2:19 They promise freedom, but they themselves are slaves of sin and corruption. For you are a slave to whatever controls you.
벧후 2:20 And when people escape from the wickedness of the world by knowing our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ and then get tangled up and enslaved by sin again, they are worse off than before.
벧후 2:21 It would be better if they had never known the way to righteousness than to know it and then reject the command they were given to live a holy life.
벧후 2:22 They prove the truth of this proverb： "A dog returns to its vomit."① And another says, "A washed pig returns to the mud." / ①Prov 26.11
벧후 3:1 This is my second letter to you, dear friends, and in both of them I have tried to stimulate your wholesome thinking and refresh your memory.
벧후 3:2 I want you to remember what the holy prophets said long ago and what our Lord and Savior commanded through your apostles.
벧후 3:3 Most importantly, I want to remind you that in the last days scoffers will come, mocking the truth and following their own desires.
벧후 3:4 They will say, "What happened to the promise that Jesus is coming again? From before the times of our ancestors, everything has remained the same since the world was first created."
벧후 3:5 They deliberately forget that God made the heavens by the word of his command, and he brought the earth out from the water and surrounded it with water.
벧후 3:6 Then he used the water to destroy the ancient world with a mighty flood.
벧후 3:7 And by the same word, the present heavens and earth have been stored up for fire. They are being kept for the day of judgment, when ungodly people will be destroyed.
벧후 3:8 But you must not forget this one thing, dear friends： A day is like a thousand years to the Lord, and a thousand years is like a day.
벧후 3:9 The Lord isn't really being slow about his promise, as some people think. No, he is being patient for your sake. He does not want anyone to be destroyed, but wants everyone to repent.
벧후 3:10 But the day of the Lord will come as unexpectedly as a thief. Then the heavens will pass away with a terrible noise, and the very elements themselves will disappear in fire, and the earth and everything on it will be found to deserve judgment①. / ①Other manuscripts read will be burned up; still others read will be found destroyed
벧후 3:11 Since everything around us is going to be destroyed like this, what holy and godly lives you should live,
벧후 3:12 looking forward to the day of God and hurrying it along. On that day, he will set the heavens on fire, and the elements will melt away in the flames.
벧후 3:13 But we are looking forward to the new heavens and new earth he has promised, a world filled with God's righteousness.
벧후 3:14 And so, dear friends, while you are waiting for these things to happen, make every effort to be found living peaceful lives that are pure and blameless in his sight.
벧후 3:15 And remember, our Lord's patience gives people time to be saved. This is what our beloved brother Paul also wrote to you with the wisdom God gave him - 
벧후 3:16 speaking of these things in all of his letters. Some of his comments are hard to understand, and those who are ignorant and unstable have twisted his letters to mean something quite different, just as they do with other parts of Scripture. And this will result in their destruction.
벧후 3:17 I am warning you ahead of time, dear friends. Be on guard so that you will not be carried away by the errors of these wicked people and lose your own secure footing.
벧후 3:18 Rather, you must grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. All glory to him, both now and forever! Amen.
1John
요일 1:1 We proclaim to you the one who existed from the beginning①, whom we have heard and seen. We saw him with our own eyes and touched him with our own hands. He is the Word of life. / ①Greek What was from the beginning
요일 1:2 This one who is life itself was revealed to us, and we have seen him. And now we testify and proclaim to you that he is the one who is eternal life. He was with the Father, and then he was revealed to us.
요일 1:3 We proclaim to you what we ourselves have actually seen and heard so that you may have fellowship with us. And our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son, Jesus Christ.
요일 1:4 We are writing these things so that you may fully share our joy①. / ①Or so that our joy may be complete; some manuscripts read your joy
요일 1:5 This is the message we heard from Jesus① and now declare to you： God is light, and there is no darkness in him at all. / ①Greek from him
요일 1:6 So we are lying if we say we have fellowship with God but go on living in spiritual darkness; we are not practicing the truth.
요일 1:7 But if we are living in the light, as God is in the light, then we have fellowship with each other, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, cleanses us from all sin.
요일 1:8 If we claim we have no sin, we are only fooling ourselves and not living in the truth.
요일 1:9 But if we confess our sins to him, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all wickedness.
요일 1:10 If we claim we have not sinned, we are calling God a liar and showing that his word has no place in our hearts.
요일 2:1 My dear children, I am writing this to you so that you will not sin. But if anyone does sin, we have an advocate who pleads our case before the Father. He is Jesus Christ, the one who is truly righteous.
요일 2:2 He himself is the sacrifice that atones for our sins - and not only our sins but the sins of all the world.
요일 2:3 And we can be sure that we know him if we obey his commandments.
요일 2:4 If someone claims, "I know God," but doesn't obey God's commandments, that person is a liar and is not living in the truth.
요일 2:5 But those who obey God's word truly show how completely they love him. That is how we know we are living in him.
요일 2:6 Those who say they live in God should live their lives as Jesus did.
요일 2:7 Dear friends, I am not writing a new commandment for you; rather it is an old one you have had from the very beginning. This old commandment - to love one another - is the same message you heard before.
요일 2:8 Yet it is also new. Jesus lived the truth of this commandment, and you also are living it. For the darkness is disappearing, and the true light is already shining.
요일 2:9 If anyone claims, "I am living in the light," but hates a Christian brother or sister①, that person is still living in darkness. / ①Greek hates his brother; similarly in 2.11
요일 2:10 Anyone who loves another brother or sister① is living in the light and does not cause others to stumble. / ①Greek loves his brother
요일 2:11 But anyone who hates another brother or sister is still living and walking in darkness. Such a person does not know the way to go, having been blinded by the darkness.
요일 2:12 I am writing to you who are God's children because your sins have been forgiven through Jesus①. / ①Greek through his name
요일 2:13 I am writing to you who are mature in the faith① because you know Christ, who existed from the beginning. I am writing to you who are young in the faith because you have won your battle with the evil one. / ①Or to you fathers; also in 2.14
요일 2:14 I have written to you who are God's children because you know the Father. I have written to you who are mature in the faith because you know Christ, who existed from the beginning. I have written to you who are young in the faith because you are strong. God's word lives in your hearts, and you have won your battle with the evil one.
요일 2:15 Do not love this world nor the things it offers you, for when you love the world, you do not have the love of the Father in you.
요일 2:16 For the world offers only a craving for physical pleasure, a craving for everything we see, and pride in our achievements and possessions. These are not from the Father, but are from this world.
요일 2:17 And this world is fading away, along with everything that people crave. But anyone who does what pleases God will live forever.
요일 2:18 Dear children, the last hour is here. You have heard that the Antichrist is coming, and already many such antichrists have appeared. From this we know that the last hour has come.
요일 2:19 These people left our churches, but they never really belonged with us; otherwise they would have stayed with us. When they left, it proved that they did not belong with us.
요일 2:20 But you are not like that, for the Holy One has given you his Spirit①, and all of you know the truth. / ①Greek But you have an anointing from the Holy One
요일 2:21 So I am writing to you not because you don't know the truth but because you know the difference between truth and lies.
요일 2:22 And who is a liar? Anyone who says that Jesus is not the Christ①. Anyone who denies the Father and the Son is an antichrist②. / ①Or not the Messiah ②Or the antichrist
요일 2:23 Anyone who denies the Son doesn't have the Father, either. But anyone who acknowledges the Son has the Father also.
요일 2:24 So you must remain faithful to what you have been taught from the beginning. If you do, you will remain in fellowship with the Son and with the Father.
요일 2:25 And in this fellowship we enjoy the eternal life he promised us.
요일 2:26 I am writing these things to warn you about those who want to lead you astray.
요일 2:27 But you have received the Holy Spirit①, and he lives within you, so you don't need anyone to teach you what is true. For the Spirit② teaches you everything you need to know, and what he teaches is true - it is not a lie. So just as he has taught you, remain in fellowship with Christ. / ①Greek the anointing from him ②Greek the anointing
요일 2:28 And now, dear children, remain in fellowship with Christ so that when he returns, you will be full of courage and not shrink back from him in shame.
요일 2:29 Since we know that Christ is righteous, we also know that all who do what is right are God's children.
요일 3:1 See how very much our Father loves us, for he calls us his children, and that is what we are! But the people who belong to this world don't recognize that we are God's children because they don't know him.
요일 3:2 Dear friends, we are already God's children, but he has not yet shown us what we will be like when Christ appears. But we do know that we will be like him, for we will see him as he really is.
요일 3:3 And all who have this eager expectation will keep themselves pure, just as he is pure.
요일 3:4 Everyone who sins is breaking God's law, for all sin is contrary to the law of God.
요일 3:5 And you know that Jesus came to take away our sins, and there is no sin in him.
요일 3:6 Anyone who continues to live in him will not sin. But anyone who keeps on sinning does not know him or understand who he is.
요일 3:7 Dear children, don't let anyone deceive you about this： When people do what is right, it shows that they are righteous, even as Christ is righteous.
요일 3:8 But when people keep on sinning, it shows that they belong to the devil, who has been sinning since the beginning. But the Son of God came to destroy the works of the devil.
요일 3:9 Those who have been born into God's family do not make a practice of sinning, because God's life① is in them. So they can't keep on sinning, because they are children of God. / ①Greek because his seed
요일 3:10 So now we can tell who are children of God and who are children of the devil. Anyone who does not live righteously and does not love other believers① does not belong to God. / ①Greek does not love his brother
요일 3:11 This is the message you have heard from the beginning： We should love one another.
요일 3:12 We must not be like Cain, who belonged to the evil one and killed his brother. And why did he kill him? Because Cain had been doing what was evil, and his brother had been doing what was righteous.
요일 3:13 So don't be surprised, dear brothers and sisters①, if the world hates you. / ①Greek brothers
요일 3:14 If we love our Christian brothers and sisters①, it proves that we have passed from death to life. But a person who has no love is still dead. / ①Greek the brothers; similarly in 3.16
요일 3:15 Anyone who hates another brother or sister① is really a murderer at heart. And you know that murderers don't have eternal life within them. / ①Greek hates his brother
요일 3:16 We know what real love is because Jesus gave up his life for us. So we also ought to give up our lives for our brothers and sisters.
요일 3:17 If someone has enough money to live well and sees a brother or sister① in need but shows no compassion - how can God's love be in that person? / ①Greek sees his brother
요일 3:18 Dear children, let's not merely say that we love each other; let us show the truth by our actions.
요일 3:19 Our actions will show that we belong to the truth, so we will be confident when we stand before God.
요일 3:20 Even if we feel guilty, God is greater than our feelings, and he knows everything.
요일 3:21 Dear friends, if we don't feel guilty, we can come to God with bold confidence.
요일 3:22 And we will receive from him whatever we ask because we obey him and do the things that please him.
요일 3:23 And this is his commandment： We must believe in the name of his Son, Jesus Christ, and love one another, just as he commanded us.
요일 3:24 Those who obey God's commandments remain in fellowship with him, and he with them. And we know he lives in us because the Spirit he gave us lives in us.
요일 4:1 Dear friends, do not believe everyone who claims to speak by the Spirit. You must test them to see if the spirit they have comes from God. For there are many false prophets in the world.
요일 4:2 This is how we know if they have the Spirit of God： If a person claiming to be a prophet① acknowledges that Jesus Christ came in a real body, that person has the Spirit of God. / ①Greek If a spirit; similarly in 4.3
요일 4:3 But if someone claims to be a prophet and does not acknowledge the truth about Jesus, that person is not from God. Such a person has the spirit of the Antichrist, which you heard is coming into the world and indeed is already here.
요일 4:4 But you belong to God, my dear children. You have already won a victory over those people, because the Spirit who lives in you is greater than the spirit who lives in the world.
요일 4:5 Those people belong to this world, so they speak from the world's viewpoint, and the world listens to them.
요일 4:6 But we belong to God, and those who know God listen to us. If they do not belong to God, they do not listen to us. That is how we know if someone has the Spirit of truth or the spirit of deception.
요일 4:7 Dear friends, let us continue to love one another, for love comes from God. Anyone who loves is a child of God and knows God.
요일 4:8 But anyone who does not love does not know God, for God is love.
요일 4:9 God showed how much he loved us by sending his one and only Son into the world so that we might have eternal life through him.
요일 4:10 This is real love - not that we loved God, but that he loved us and sent his Son as a sacrifice to take away our sins.
요일 4:11 Dear friends, since God loved us that much, we surely ought to love each other.
요일 4:12 No one has ever seen God. But if we love each other, God lives in us, and his love is brought to full expression in us.
요일 4:13 And God has given us his Spirit as proof that we live in him and he in us.
요일 4:14 Furthermore, we have seen with our own eyes and now testify that the Father sent his Son to be the Savior of the world.
요일 4:15 All who confess that Jesus is the Son of God have God living in them, and they live in God.
요일 4:16 We know how much God loves us, and we have put our trust in his love. God is love, and all who live in love live in God, and God lives in them.
요일 4:17 And as we live in God, our love grows more perfect. So we will not be afraid on the day of judgment, but we can face him with confidence because we live like Jesus here in this world.
요일 4:18 Such love has no fear, because perfect love expels all fear. If we are afraid, it is for fear of punishment, and this shows that we have not fully experienced his perfect love.
요일 4:19 We love each other① because he loved us first. / ①Greek We love. Other manuscripts read We love God; still others read We love him
요일 4:20 If someone says, "I love God," but hates a Christian brother or sister①, that person is a liar; for if we don't love people we can see, how can we love God, whom we cannot see? / ①Greek hates his brother
요일 4:21 And he has given us this command： Those who love God must also love their Christian brothers and sisters①. / ①Greek The one who loves God must also love his brother
요일 5:1 Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ① has become a child of God. And everyone who loves the Father loves his children, too. / ①Or the Messiah
요일 5:2 We know we love God's children if we love God and obey his commandments.
요일 5:3 Loving God means keeping his commandments, and his commandments are not burdensome.
요일 5:4 For every child of God defeats this evil world, and we achieve this victory through our faith.
요일 5:5 And who can win this battle against the world? Only those who believe that Jesus is the Son of God.
요일 5:6 And Jesus Christ was revealed as God's Son by his baptism in water and by shedding his blood on the cross① - not by water only, but by water and blood. And the Spirit, who is truth, confirms it with his testimony. / ①Greek This is he who came by water and blood
요일 5:7 So we have these three witnesses① - / ①A few very late manuscripts add in heaven - the Father, the Word, and the Holy Spirit, and these three are one. And we have three witnesses on earth
요일 5:8 the Spirit, the water, and the blood - and all three agree.
요일 5:9 Since we believe human testimony, surely we can believe the greater testimony that comes from God. And God has testified about his Son.
요일 5:10 All who believe in the Son of God know in their hearts that this testimony is true. Those who don't believe this are actually calling God a liar because they don't believe what God has testified about his Son.
요일 5:11 And this is what God has testified： He has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
요일 5:12 Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have God's Son does not have life.
요일 5:13 I have written this to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, so that you may know you have eternal life.
요일 5:14 And we are confident that he hears us whenever we ask for anything that pleases him.
요일 5:15 And since we know he hears us when we make our requests, we also know that he will give us what we ask for.
요일 5:16 If you see a Christian brother or sister① sinning in a way that does not lead to death, you should pray, and God will give that person life. But there is a sin that leads to death, and I am not saying you should pray for those who commit it. / ①Greek a brother
요일 5:17 All wicked actions are sin, but not every sin leads to death.
요일 5:18 We know that God's children do not make a practice of sinning, for God's Son holds them securely, and the evil one cannot touch them.
요일 5:19 We know that we are children of God and that the world around us is under the control of the evil one.
요일 5:20 And we know that the Son of God has come, and he has given us understanding so that we can know the true God①. And now we live in fellowship with the true God because we live in fellowship with his Son, Jesus Christ. He is the only true God, and he is eternal life. / ①Greek the one who is true
요일 5:21 Dear children, keep away from anything that might take God's place in your hearts①. / ①Greek keep yourselves from idols
2John
요이 1:1 This letter is from John, the elder①. I am writing to the chosen lady and to her children②, whom I love in the truth - as does everyone else who knows the truth - / ①Greek From the elder ②Or the church God has chosen and its members
요이 1:2 because the truth lives in us and will be with us forever.
요이 1:3 Grace, mercy, and peace, which come from God the Father and from Jesus Christ - the Son of the Father - will continue to be with us who live in truth and love.
요이 1:4 How happy I was to meet some of your children and find them living according to the truth, just as the Father commanded.
요이 1:5 I am writing to remind you, dear friends①, that we should love one another. This is not a new commandment, but one we have had from the beginning. / ①Greek I urge you, lady
요이 1:6 Love means doing what God has commanded us, and he has commanded us to love one another, just as you heard from the beginning.
요이 1:7 I say this because many deceivers have gone out into the world. They deny that Jesus Christ came① in a real body. Such a person is a deceiver and an antichrist. / ①Or will come
요이 1:8 Watch out that you do not lose what we① have worked so hard to achieve. Be diligent so that you receive your full reward. / ①Some manuscripts read you
요이 1:9 Anyone who wanders away from this teaching has no relationship with God. But anyone who remains in the teaching of Christ has a relationship with both the Father and the Son.
요이 1:10 If anyone comes to your meeting and does not teach the truth about Christ, don't invite that person into your home or give any kind of encouragement.
요이 1:11 Anyone who encourages such people becomes a partner in their evil work.
요이 1:12 I have much more to say to you, but I don't want to do it with paper and ink. For I hope to visit you soon and talk with you face to face. Then our joy will be complete.
요이 1:13 Greetings from the children of your sister①, chosen by God. / ①Or from the members of your sister church
3John
요삼 1:1 This letter is from John, the elder①. I am writing to Gaius, my dear friend, whom I love in the truth. / ①Greek From the elder
요삼 1:2 Dear friend, I hope all is well with you and that you are as healthy in body as you are strong in spirit.
요삼 1:3 Some of the traveling teachers① recently returned and made me very happy by telling me about your faithfulness and that you are living according to the truth. / ①Greek the brothers; also in verses 5 and 10
요삼 1:4 I could have no greater joy than to hear that my children are following the truth.
요삼 1:5 Dear friend, you are being faithful to God when you care for the traveling teachers who pass through, even though they are strangers to you.
요삼 1:6 They have told the church here of your loving friendship. Please continue providing for such teachers in a manner that pleases God.
요삼 1:7 For they are traveling for the Lord①, and they accept nothing from people who are not believers②. / ①Greek They went out on behalf of the Name ②Greek from Gentiles
요삼 1:8 So we ourselves should support them so that we can be their partners as they teach the truth.
요삼 1:9 I wrote to the church about this, but Diotrephes, who loves to be the leader, refuses to have anything to do with us.
요삼 1:10 When I come, I will report some of the things he is doing and the evil accusations he is making against us. Not only does he refuse to welcome the traveling teachers, he also tells others not to help them. And when they do help, he puts them out of the church.
요삼 1:11 Dear friend, don't let this bad example influence you. Follow only what is good. Remember that those who do good prove that they are God's children, and those who do evil prove that they do not know God①. / ①Greek they have not seen God
요삼 1:12 Everyone speaks highly of Demetrius, as does the truth itself. We ourselves can say the same for him, and you know we speak the truth.
요삼 1:13 I have much more to say to you, but I don't want to write it with pen and ink.
요삼 1:14 For I hope to see you soon, and then we will talk face to face.
요삼 1:15 ①Peace be with you. Your friends here send you their greetings. Please give my personal greetings to each of our friends there. / ①Some English translations combine verses 14 and 15 into verse 14
Jude
유 1:1 This letter is from Jude, a slave of Jesus Christ and a brother of James. I am writing to all who have been called by God the Father, who loves you and keeps you safe in the care of Jesus Christ①. / ①Or keeps you for Jesus Christ
유 1:2 May God give you more and more mercy, peace, and love.
유 1:3 Dear friends, I had been eagerly planning to write to you about the salvation we all share. But now I find that I must write about something else, urging you to defend the faith that God has entrusted once for all time to his holy people.
유 1:4 I say this because some ungodly people have wormed their way into your churches, saying that God's marvelous grace allows us to live immoral lives. The condemnation of such people was recorded long ago, for they have denied our only Master and Lord, Jesus Christ.
유 1:5 So I want to remind you, though you already know these things, that Jesus① first rescued the nation of Israel from Egypt, but later he destroyed those who did not remain faithful. / ①As in the best manuscripts; various other manuscripts read [the] Lord, or God, or Christ; one reads God Christ
유 1:6 And I remind you of the angels who did not stay within the limits of authority God gave them but left the place where they belonged. God has kept them securely chained in prisons of darkness, waiting for the great day of judgment.
유 1:7 And don't forget Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighboring towns, which were filled with immorality and every kind of sexual perversion. Those cities were destroyed by fire and serve as a warning of the eternal fire of God's judgment.
유 1:8 In the same way, these people - who claim authority from their dreams - live immoral lives, defy authority, and scoff at supernatural beings①. / ①Greek at glorious ones, which are probably evil angels
유 1:9 But even Michael, one of the mightiest of the angels①, did not dare accuse the devil of blasphemy, but simply said, "The Lord rebuke you!" (This took place when Michael was arguing with the devil about Moses' body.) / ①Greek Michael, the archangel
유 1:10 But these people scoff at things they do not understand. Like unthinking animals, they do whatever their instincts tell them, and so they bring about their own destruction.
유 1:11 What sorrow awaits them! For they follow in the footsteps of Cain, who killed his brother. Like Balaam, they deceive people for money. And like Korah, they perish in their rebellion.
유 1:12 When these people eat with you in your fellowship meals commemorating the Lord's love, they are like dangerous reefs that can shipwreck you①. They are like shameless shepherds who care only for themselves. They are like clouds blowing over the land without giving any rain. They are like trees in autumn that are doubly dead, for they bear no fruit and have been pulled up by the roots. / ①Or they are contaminants among you; or they are stains
유 1:13 They are like wild waves of the sea, churning up the foam of their shameful deeds. They are like wandering stars, doomed forever to blackest darkness.
유 1:14 Enoch, who lived in the seventh generation after Adam, prophesied about these people. He said, "Listen! The Lord is coming with countless thousands of his holy ones
유 1:15 to execute judgment on the people of the world. He will convict every person of all the ungodly things they have done and for all the insults that ungodly sinners have spoken against him."① / ①The quotation comes from intertestamental literature： Enoch 1.9
유 1:16 These people are grumblers and complainers, living only to satisfy their desires. They brag loudly about themselves, and they flatter others to get what they want.
유 1:17 But you, my dear friends, must remember what the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ said.
유 1:18 They told you that in the last times there would be scoffers whose purpose in life is to satisfy their ungodly desires.
유 1:19 These people are the ones who are creating divisions among you. They follow their natural instincts because they do not have God's Spirit in them.
유 1:20 But you, dear friends, must build each other up in your most holy faith, pray in the power of the Holy Spirit①, / ①Greek pray in the Holy Spirit
유 1:21 and await the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ, who will bring you eternal life. In this way, you will keep yourselves safe in God's love.
유 1:22 And you must show mercy to① those whose faith is wavering. / ①Some manuscripts read must reprove
유 1:23 Rescue others by snatching them from the flames of judgment. Show mercy to still others①, but do so with great caution, hating the sins that contaminate their lives②. / ①Some manuscripts have only two categories of people： (1) those whose faith is wavering and therefore need to be snatched from the flames of judgment, and (2) those who need to be shown mercy ②Greek with fear, hating even the clothing stained by the flesh
유 1:24 Now all glory to God, who is able to keep you from falling away and will bring you with great joy into his glorious presence without a single fault.
유 1:25 All glory to him who alone is God, our Savior through Jesus Christ our Lord. All glory, majesty, power, and authority are his before all time, and in the present, and beyond all time! Amen.
Revelation
계 1:1 This is a revelation from① Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show his servants the events that must soon② take place. He sent an angel to present this revelation to his servant John, / ①Or of ②Or suddenly, or quickly
계 1:2 who faithfully reported everything he saw. This is his report of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ.
계 1:3 God blesses the one who reads the words of this prophecy to the church, and he blesses all who listen to its message and obey what it says, for the time is near.
계 1:4 This letter is from John to the seven churches in the province of Asia①. Grace and peace to you from the one who is, who always was, and who is still to come; from the sevenfold Spirit② before his throne; / ①Asia was a Roman province in what is now western Turkey ②Greek the seven spirits
계 1:5 and from Jesus Christ. He is the faithful witness to these things, the first to rise from the dead, and the ruler of all the kings of the world. All glory to him who loves us and has freed us from our sins by shedding his blood for us.
계 1:6 He has made us a Kingdom of priests for God his Father. All glory and power to him forever and ever! Amen.
계 1:7 Look! He comes with the clouds of heaven. And everyone will see him - even those who pierced him. And all the nations of the world will mourn for him. Yes! Amen!
계 1:8 "I am the Alpha and the Omega - the beginning and the end,"① says the Lord God. "I am the one who is, who always was, and who is still to come - the Almighty One." / ①Greek I am the Alpha and the Omega, referring to the first and last letters of the Greek alphabet
계 1:9 I, John, am your brother and your partner in suffering and in God's Kingdom and in the patient endurance to which Jesus calls us. I was exiled to the island of Patmos for preaching the word of God and for my testimony about Jesus.
계 1:10 It was the Lord's Day, and I was worshiping in the Spirit①. Suddenly, I heard behind me a loud voice like a trumpet blast. / ①Or in spirit
계 1:11 It said, "Write in a book① everything you see, and send it to the seven churches in the cities of Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and Laodicea." / ①Or on a scroll
계 1:12 When I turned to see who was speaking to me, I saw seven gold lampstands.
계 1:13 And standing in the middle of the lampstands was someone like the Son of Man①. He was wearing a long robe with a gold sash across his chest. / ①Or like a son of man. See Dan 7.13. "Son of Man" is a title Jesus used for himself
계 1:14 His head and his hair were white like wool, as white as snow. And his eyes were like flames of fire.
계 1:15 His feet were like polished bronze refined in a furnace, and his voice thundered like mighty ocean waves.
계 1:16 He held seven stars in his right hand, and a sharp two-edged sword came from his mouth. And his face was like the sun in all its brilliance.
계 1:17 When I saw him, I fell at his feet as if I were dead. But he laid his right hand on me and said, "Don't be afraid! I am the First and the Last.
계 1:18 I am the living one. I died, but look - I am alive forever and ever! And I hold the keys of death and the grave①. / ①Greek and Hades
계 1:19 "Write down what you have seen - both the things that are now happening and the things that will happen①. / ①Or what you have seen and what they mean - the things that have already begun to happen
계 1:20 This is the meaning of the mystery of the seven stars you saw in my right hand and the seven gold lampstands： The seven stars are the angels① of the seven churches, and the seven lampstands are the seven churches. / ①Or the messengers
계 2:1 "Write this letter to the angel① of the church in Ephesus. This is the message from the one who holds the seven stars in his right hand, the one who walks among the seven gold lampstands. / ①Or the messenger; also in 2.8, 12, 18
계 2:2 "I know all the things you do. I have seen your hard work and your patient endurance. I know you don't tolerate evil people. You have examined the claims of those who say they are apostles but are not. You have discovered they are liars.
계 2:3 You have patiently suffered for me without quitting.
계 2:4 "But I have this complaint against you. You don't love me or each other as you did at first①! / ①Greek You have lost your first love
계 2:5 Look how far you have fallen! Turn back to me and do the works you did at first. If you don't repent, I will come and remove your lampstand from its place among the churches.
계 2:6 But this is in your favor： You hate the evil deeds of the Nicolaitans, just as I do.
계 2:7 "Anyone with ears to hear must listen to the Spirit and understand what he is saying to the churches. To everyone who is victorious I will give fruit from the tree of life in the paradise of God.
계 2:8 "Write this letter to the angel of the church in Smyrna. This is the message from the one who is the First and the Last, who was dead but is now alive.
계 2:9 "I know about your suffering and your poverty - but you are rich! I know the blasphemy of those opposing you. They say they are Jews, but they are not, because their synagogue belongs to Satan.
계 2:10 Don't be afraid of what you are about to suffer. The devil will throw some of you into prison to test you. You will suffer for ten days. But if you remain faithful even when facing death, I will give you the crown of life.
계 2:11 "Anyone with ears to hear must listen to the Spirit and understand what he is saying to the churches. Whoever is victorious will not be harmed by the second death.
계 2:12 "Write this letter to the angel of the church in Pergamum. This is the message from the one with the sharp two-edged sword.
계 2:13 "I know that you live in the city where Satan has his throne, yet you have remained loyal to me. You refused to deny me even when Antipas, my faithful witness, was martyred among you there in Satan's city.
계 2:14 "But I have a few complaints against you. You tolerate some among you whose teaching is like that of Balaam, who showed Balak how to trip up the people of Israel. He taught them to sin by eating food offered to idols and by committing sexual sin.
계 2:15 In a similar way, you have some Nicolaitans among you who follow the same teaching.
계 2:16 Repent of your sin, or I will come to you suddenly and fight against them with the sword of my mouth.
계 2:17 "Anyone with ears to hear must listen to the Spirit and understand what he is saying to the churches. To everyone who is victorious I will give some of the manna that has been hidden away in heaven. And I will give to each one a white stone, and on the stone will be engraved a new name that no one understands except the one who receives it.
계 2:18 "Write this letter to the angel of the church in Thyatira. This is the message from the Son of God, whose eyes are like flames of fire, whose feet are like polished bronze.
계 2:19 "I know all the things you do. I have seen your love, your faith, your service, and your patient endurance. And I can see your constant improvement in all these things.
계 2:20 "But I have this complaint against you. You are permitting that woman - that Jezebel who calls herself a prophet - to lead my servants astray. She teaches them to commit sexual sin and to eat food offered to idols.
계 2:21 I gave her time to repent, but she does not want to turn away from her immorality.
계 2:22 "Therefore, I will throw her on a bed of suffering①, and those who commit adultery with her will suffer greatly unless they repent and turn away from her evil deeds. / ①Greek a bed
계 2:23 I will strike her children dead. Then all the churches will know that I am the one who searches out the thoughts and intentions of every person. And I will give to each of you whatever you deserve.
계 2:24 "But I also have a message for the rest of you in Thyatira who have not followed this false teaching ('deeper truths,' as they call them - depths of Satan, actually). I will ask nothing more of you
계 2:25 except that you hold tightly to what you have until I come.
계 2:26 To all who are victorious, who obey me to the very end, To them I will give authority over all the nations. 
계 2:27 They will rule the nations with an iron rod and smash them like clay pots①. / ①Ps 2.8-9 (Greek Version)
계 2:28 They will have the same authority I received from my Father, and I will also give them the morning star!
계 2:29 "Anyone with ears to hear must listen to the Spirit and understand what he is saying to the churches.
계 3:1 "Write this letter to the angel① of the church in Sardis. This is the message from the one who has the sevenfold Spirit② of God and the seven stars： "I know all the things you do, and that you have a reputation for being alive - but you are dead. / ①Or the messenger; also in 3.7, 14 ②Greek the seven spirits
계 3:2 Wake up! Strengthen what little remains, for even what is left is almost dead. I find that your actions do not meet the requirements of my God.
계 3:3 Go back to what you heard and believed at first; hold to it firmly. Repent and turn to me again. If you don't wake up, I will come to you suddenly, as unexpected as a thief.
계 3:4 "Yet there are some in the church in Sardis who have not soiled their clothes with evil. They will walk with me in white, for they are worthy.
계 3:5 All who are victorious will be clothed in white. I will never erase their names from the Book of Life, but I will announce before my Father and his angels that they are mine.
계 3:6 "Anyone with ears to hear must listen to the Spirit and understand what he is saying to the churches.
계 3:7 "Write this letter to the angel of the church in Philadelphia. This is the message from the one who is holy and true, the one who has the key of David. What he opens, no one can close; and what he closes, no one can open.① / ①Isa 22.22
계 3:8 "I know all the things you do, and I have opened a door for you that no one can close. You have little strength, yet you obeyed my word and did not deny me.
계 3:9 Look, I will force those who belong to Satan's synagogue - those liars who say they are Jews but are not - to come and bow down at your feet. They will acknowledge that you are the ones I love.
계 3:10 "Because you have obeyed my command to persevere, I will protect you from the great time of testing that will come upon the whole world to test those who belong to this world.
계 3:11 I am coming soon①. Hold on to what you have, so that no one will take away your crown. / ①Or suddenly, or quickly
계 3:12 All who are victorious will become pillars in the Temple of my God, and they will never have to leave it. And I will write on them the name of my God, and they will be citizens in the city of my God - the new Jerusalem that comes down from heaven from my God. And I will also write on them my new name.
계 3:13 "Anyone with ears to hear must listen to the Spirit and understand what he is saying to the churches.
계 3:14 "Write this letter to the angel of the church in Laodicea. This is the message from the one who is the Amen - the faithful and true witness, the beginning① of God's new creation. / ①Or the ruler, or the source
계 3:15 "I know all the things you do, that you are neither hot nor cold. I wish that you were one or the other!
계 3:16 But since you are like lukewarm water, neither hot nor cold, I will spit you out of my mouth!
계 3:17 You say, 'I am rich. I have everything I want. I don't need a thing!' And you don't realize that you are wretched and miserable and poor and blind and naked.
계 3:18 So I advise you to buy gold from me - gold that has been purified by fire. Then you will be rich. Also buy white garments from me so you will not be shamed by your nakedness, and ointment for your eyes so you will be able to see.
계 3:19 I correct and discipline everyone I love. So be diligent and turn from your indifference.
계 3:20 "Look! I stand at the door and knock. If you hear my voice and open the door, I will come in, and we will share a meal together as friends.
계 3:21 Those who are victorious will sit with me on my throne, just as I was victorious and sat with my Father on his throne.
계 3:22 "Anyone with ears to hear must listen to the Spirit and understand what he is saying to the churches."
계 4:1 Then as I looked, I saw a door standing open in heaven, and the same voice I had heard before spoke to me like a trumpet blast. The voice said, "Come up here, and I will show you what must happen after this."
계 4:2 And instantly I was in the Spirit①, and I saw a throne in heaven and someone sitting on it. / ①Or in spirit
계 4:3 The one sitting on the throne was as brilliant as gemstones - like jasper and carnelian. And the glow of an emerald circled his throne like a rainbow.
계 4:4 Twenty-four thrones surrounded him, and twenty-four elders sat on them. They were all clothed in white and had gold crowns on their heads.
계 4:5 From the throne came flashes of lightning and the rumble of thunder. And in front of the throne were seven torches with burning flames. This is the sevenfold Spirit① of God. / ①Greek They are the seven spirits
계 4:6 In front of the throne was a shiny sea of glass, sparkling like crystal. In the center and around the throne were four living beings, each covered with eyes, front and back.
계 4:7 The first of these living beings was like a lion; the second was like an ox; the third had a human face; and the fourth was like an eagle in flight.
계 4:8 Each of these living beings had six wings, and their wings were covered all over with eyes, inside and out. Day after day and night after night they keep on saying, "Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God, the Almighty - the one who always was, who is, and who is still to come."
계 4:9 Whenever the living beings give glory and honor and thanks to the one sitting on the throne (the one who lives forever and ever),
계 4:10 the twenty-four elders fall down and worship the one sitting on the throne (the one who lives forever and ever). And they lay their crowns before the throne and say,
계 4:11 "You are worthy, O Lord our God, to receive glory and honor and power. For you created all things, and they exist because you created what you pleased."
계 5:1 Then I saw a scroll① in the right hand of the one who was sitting on the throne. There was writing on the inside and the outside of the scroll, and it was sealed with seven seals. / ①Or book; also in 5.2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9
계 5:2 And I saw a strong angel, who shouted with a loud voice： "Who is worthy to break the seals on this scroll and open it?"
계 5:3 But no one in heaven or on earth or under the earth was able to open the scroll and read it.
계 5:4 Then I began to weep bitterly because no one was found worthy to open the scroll and read it.
계 5:5 But one of the twenty-four elders said to me, "Stop weeping! Look, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the heir to David's throne①, has won the victory. He is worthy to open the scroll and its seven seals." / ①Greek the root of David. See Isa 11.10
계 5:6 Then I saw a Lamb that looked as if it had been slaughtered, but it was now standing between the throne and the four living beings and among the twenty-four elders. He had seven horns and seven eyes, which represent the sevenfold Spirit① of God that is sent out into every part of the earth. / ①Greek which are the seven spirits
계 5:7 He stepped forward and took the scroll from the right hand of the one sitting on the throne.
계 5:8 And when he took the scroll, the four living beings and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb. Each one had a harp, and they held gold bowls filled with incense, which are the prayers of God's people.
계 5:9 And they sang a new song with these words： "You are worthy to take the scroll and break its seals and open it. For you were slaughtered, and your blood has ransomed people for God from every tribe and language and people and nation.
계 5:10 And you have caused them to become a Kingdom of priests for our God. And they will reign① on the earth." / ①Some manuscripts read they are reigning
계 5:11 Then I looked again, and I heard the voices of thousands and millions of angels around the throne and of the living beings and the elders.
계 5:12 And they sang in a mighty chorus： "Worthy is the Lamb who was slaughtered - to receive power and riches and wisdom and strength and honor and glory and blessing."
계 5:13 And then I heard every creature in heaven and on earth and under the earth and in the sea. They sang： "Blessing and honor and glory and power belong to the one sitting on the throne and to the Lamb forever and ever."
계 5:14 And the four living beings said, "Amen!" And the twenty-four elders fell down and worshiped the Lamb.
계 6:1 As I watched, the Lamb broke the first of the seven seals on the scroll①. Then I heard one of the four living beings say with a voice like thunder, "Come!" / ①Or book
계 6:2 I looked up and saw a white horse standing there. Its rider carried a bow, and a crown was placed on his head. He rode out to win many battles and gain the victory.
계 6:3 When the Lamb broke the second seal, I heard the second living being say, "Come!"
계 6:4 Then another horse appeared, a red one. Its rider was given a mighty sword and the authority to take peace from the earth. And there was war and slaughter everywhere.
계 6:5 When the Lamb broke the third seal, I heard the third living being say, "Come!" I looked up and saw a black horse, and its rider was holding a pair of scales in his hand.
계 6:6 And I heard a voice from among the four living beings say, "A loaf of wheat bread or three loaves of barley will cost a day's pay①. And don't waste② the olive oil and wine." / ①Greek A choinix [1 quart or 1 liter] of wheat for a denarius, and 3 choinix of barley for a denarius. A denarius was equivalent to a laborer's full day's wage ②Or harm
계 6:7 When the Lamb broke the fourth seal, I heard the fourth living being say, "Come!"
계 6:8 I looked up and saw a horse whose color was pale green. Its rider was named Death, and his companion was the Grave①. These two were given authority over one-fourth of the earth, to kill with the sword and famine and disease② and wild animals. / ①Greek was Hades ②Greek death
계 6:9 When the Lamb broke the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of all who had been martyred for the word of God and for being faithful in their testimony.
계 6:10 They shouted to the Lord and said, "O Sovereign Lord, holy and true, how long before you judge the people who belong to this world and avenge our blood for what they have done to us?"
계 6:11 Then a white robe was given to each of them. And they were told to rest a little longer until the full number of their brothers and sisters① - their fellow servants of Jesus who were to be martyred - had joined them. / ①Greek their brothers
계 6:12 I watched as the Lamb broke the sixth seal, and there was a great earthquake. The sun became as dark as black cloth, and the moon became as red as blood.
계 6:13 Then the stars of the sky fell to the earth like green figs falling from a tree shaken by a strong wind.
계 6:14 The sky was rolled up like a scroll, and all of the mountains and islands were moved from their places.
계 6:15 Then everyone - the kings of the earth, the rulers, the generals, the wealthy, the powerful, and every slave and free person - all hid themselves in the caves and among the rocks of the mountains.
계 6:16 And they cried to the mountains and the rocks, "Fall on us and hide us from the face of the one who sits on the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb.
계 6:17 For the great day of their wrath has come, and who is able to survive?"
계 7:1 Then I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding back the four winds so they did not blow on the earth or the sea, or even on any tree.
계 7:2 And I saw another angel coming up from the east, carrying the seal of the living God. And he shouted to those four angels, who had been given power to harm land and sea,
계 7:3 "Wait! Don't harm the land or the sea or the trees until we have placed the seal of God on the foreheads of his servants."
계 7:4 And I heard how many were marked with the seal of God - 144,000 were sealed from all the tribes of Israel.
계 7:5 from Judah 12,000 from Reuben 12,000 from Gad 12,000 
계 7:6 from Asher 12,000 from Naphtali 12,000 from Manasseh 12,000 
계 7:7 from Simeon 12,000 from Levi 12,000 from Issachar 12,000 
계 7:8 from Zebulun 12,000 from Joseph 12,000 from Benjamin 12,000 
계 7:9 After this I saw a vast crowd, too great to count, from every nation and tribe and people and language, standing in front of the throne and before the Lamb. They were clothed in white robes and held palm branches in their hands.
계 7:10 And they were shouting with a great roar, "Salvation comes from our God who sits on the throne and from the Lamb!"
계 7:11 And all the angels were standing around the throne and around the elders and the four living beings. And they fell before the throne with their faces to the ground and worshiped God.
계 7:12 They sang, "Amen! Blessing and glory and wisdom and thanksgiving and honor and power and strength belong to our God forever and ever! Amen."
계 7:13 Then one of the twenty-four elders asked me, "Who are these who are clothed in white? Where did they come from?"
계 7:14 And I said to him, "Sir, you are the one who knows." Then he said to me, "These are the ones who died in① the great tribulation②. They have washed their robes in the blood of the Lamb and made them white. / ①Greek who came out of ②Or the great suffering
계 7:15 "That is why they stand in front of God's throne and serve him day and night in his Temple. And he who sits on the throne will give them shelter.
계 7:16 They will never again be hungry or thirsty; they will never be scorched by the heat of the sun.
계 7:17 For the Lamb on the throne① will be their Shepherd. He will lead them to springs of life-giving water. And God will wipe every tear from their eyes." / ①Greek on the center of the throne
계 8:1 When the Lamb broke the seventh seal on the scroll①, there was silence throughout heaven for about half an hour. / ①Or book
계 8:2 I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and they were given seven trumpets.
계 8:3 Then another angel with a gold incense burner came and stood at the altar. And a great amount of incense was given to him to mix with the prayers of God's people as an offering on the gold altar before the throne.
계 8:4 The smoke of the incense, mixed with the prayers of God's holy people, ascended up to God from the altar where the angel had poured them out.
계 8:5 Then the angel filled the incense burner with fire from the altar and threw it down upon the earth; and thunder crashed, lightning flashed, and there was a terrible earthquake.
계 8:6 Then the seven angels with the seven trumpets prepared to blow their mighty blasts.
계 8:7 The first angel blew his trumpet, and hail and fire mixed with blood were thrown down on the earth. One-third of the earth was set on fire, one-third of the trees were burned, and all the green grass was burned.
계 8:8 Then the second angel blew his trumpet, and a great mountain of fire was thrown into the sea. One-third of the water in the sea became blood,
계 8:9 one-third of all things living in the sea died, and one-third of all the ships on the sea were destroyed.
계 8:10 Then the third angel blew his trumpet, and a great star fell from the sky, burning like a torch. It fell on one-third of the rivers and on the springs of water.
계 8:11 The name of the star was Bitterness①. It made one-third of the water bitter, and many people died from drinking the bitter water. / ①Greek Wormwood
계 8:12 Then the fourth angel blew his trumpet, and one-third of the sun was struck, and one-third of the moon, and one-third of the stars, and they became dark. And one-third of the day was dark, and also one-third of the night.
계 8:13 Then I looked, and I heard a single eagle crying loudly as it flew through the air, "Terror, terror, terror to all who belong to this world because of what will happen when the last three angels blow their trumpets."
계 9:1 Then the fifth angel blew his trumpet, and I saw a star that had fallen to earth from the sky, and he was given the key to the shaft of the bottomless pit①. / ①Or the abyss, or the underworld; also in 9.11
계 9:2 When he opened it, smoke poured out as though from a huge furnace, and the sunlight and air turned dark from the smoke.
계 9:3 Then locusts came from the smoke and descended on the earth, and they were given power to sting like scorpions.
계 9:4 They were told not to harm the grass or plants or trees, but only the people who did not have the seal of God on their foreheads.
계 9:5 They were told not to kill them but to torture them for five months with pain like the pain of a scorpion sting.
계 9:6 In those days people will seek death but will not find it. They will long to die, but death will flee from them!
계 9:7 The locusts looked like horses prepared for battle. They had what looked like gold crowns on their heads, and their faces looked like human faces.
계 9:8 They had hair like women's hair and teeth like the teeth of a lion.
계 9:9 They wore armor made of iron, and their wings roared like an army of chariots rushing into battle.
계 9:10 They had tails that stung like scorpions, and for five months they had the power to torment people.
계 9:11 Their king is the angel from the bottomless pit; his name in Hebrew is Abaddon, and in Greek, Apollyon - the Destroyer.
계 9:12 The first terror is past, but look, two more terrors are coming!
계 9:13 Then the sixth angel blew his trumpet, and I heard a voice speaking from the four horns of the gold altar that stands in the presence of God.
계 9:14 And the voice said to the sixth angel who held the trumpet, "Release the four angels who are bound at the great Euphrates River."
계 9:15 Then the four angels who had been prepared for this hour and day and month and year were turned loose to kill one-third of all the people on earth.
계 9:16 I heard the size of their army, which was 200 million mounted troops.
계 9:17 And in my vision, I saw the horses and the riders sitting on them. The riders wore armor that was fiery red and dark blue and yellow. The horses had heads like lions, and fire and smoke and burning sulfur billowed from their mouths.
계 9:18 One-third of all the people on earth were killed by these three plagues - by the fire and smoke and burning sulfur that came from the mouths of the horses.
계 9:19 Their power was in their mouths and in their tails. For their tails had heads like snakes, with the power to injure people.
계 9:20 But the people who did not die in these plagues still refused to repent of their evil deeds and turn to God. They continued to worship demons and idols made of gold, silver, bronze, stone, and wood - idols that can neither see nor hear nor walk!

계 9:21 And they did not repent of their murders or their witchcraft or their sexual immorality or their thefts.
계 10:1 Then I saw another mighty angel coming down from heaven, surrounded by a cloud, with a rainbow over his head. His face shone like the sun, and his feet were like pillars of fire.
계 10:2 And in his hand was a small scroll① that had been opened. He stood with his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land. / ①Or book; also in 10.8, 9, 10
계 10:3 And he gave a great shout like the roar of a lion. And when he shouted, the seven thunders answered.
계 10:4 When the seven thunders spoke, I was about to write. But I heard a voice from heaven saying, "Keep secret① what the seven thunders said, and do not write it down." / ①Greek Seal up
계 10:5 Then the angel I saw standing on the sea and on the land raised his right hand toward heaven.
계 10:6 He swore an oath in the name of the one who lives forever and ever, who created the heavens and everything in them, the earth and everything in it, and the sea and everything in it. He said, "There will be no more delay.
계 10:7 When the seventh angel blows his trumpet, God's mysterious plan will be fulfilled. It will happen just as he announced it to his servants the prophets."
계 10:8 Then the voice from heaven spoke to me again： "Go and take the open scroll from the hand of the angel who is standing on the sea and on the land."
계 10:9 So I went to the angel and told him to give me the small scroll. "Yes, take it and eat it," he said. "It will be sweet as honey in your mouth, but it will turn sour in your stomach!"
계 10:10 So I took the small scroll from the hand of the angel, and I ate it! It was sweet in my mouth, but when I swallowed it, it turned sour in my stomach.
계 10:11 Then I was told, "You must prophesy again about many peoples, nations, languages, and kings."
계 11:1 Then I was given a measuring stick, and I was told, "Go and measure the Temple of God and the altar, and count the number of worshipers.
계 11:2 But do not measure the outer courtyard, for it has been turned over to the nations. They will trample the holy city for 42 months.
계 11:3 And I will give power to my two witnesses, and they will be clothed in burlap and will prophesy during those 1,260 days."
계 11:4 These two prophets are the two olive trees and the two lampstands that stand before the Lord of all the earth.
계 11:5 If anyone tries to harm them, fire flashes from their mouths and consumes their enemies. This is how anyone who tries to harm them must die.
계 11:6 They have power to shut the sky so that no rain will fall for as long as they prophesy. And they have the power to turn the rivers and oceans into blood, and to strike the earth with every kind of plague as often as they wish.
계 11:7 When they complete their testimony, the beast that comes up out of the bottomless pit① will declare war against them, and he will conquer them and kill them. / ①Or the abyss, or the underworld
계 11:8 And their bodies will lie in the main street of Jerusalem①, the city that is figuratively called "Sodom" and "Egypt," the city where their Lord was crucified. / ①Greek the great city
계 11:9 And for three and a half days, all peoples, tribes, languages, and nations will stare at their bodies. No one will be allowed to bury them.
계 11:10 All the people who belong to this world will gloat over them and give presents to each other to celebrate the death of the two prophets who had tormented them.
계 11:11 But after three and a half days, God breathed life into them, and they stood up! Terror struck all who were staring at them.
계 11:12 Then a loud voice from heaven called to the two prophets, "Come up here!" And they rose to heaven in a cloud as their enemies watched.
계 11:13 At the same time there was a terrible earthquake that destroyed a tenth of the city. Seven thousand people died in that earthquake, and everyone else was terrified and gave glory to the God of heaven.
계 11:14 The second terror is past, but look, the third terror is coming quickly.
계 11:15 Then the seventh angel blew his trumpet, and there were loud voices shouting in heaven： "The world has now become the Kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ①, and he will reign forever and ever." / ①Or his Messiah
계 11:16 The twenty-four elders sitting on their thrones before God fell with their faces to the ground and worshiped him.
계 11:17 And they said, "We give thanks to you, Lord God, the Almighty, the one who is and who always was, for now you have assumed your great power and have begun to reign.
계 11:18 The nations were filled with wrath, but now the time of your wrath has come. It is time to judge the dead and reward your servants the prophets, as well as your holy people, and all who fear your name, from the least to the greatest. It is time to destroy all who have caused destruction on the earth."
계 11:19 Then, in heaven, the Temple of God was opened and the Ark of his covenant could be seen inside the Temple. Lightning flashed, thunder crashed and roared, and there was an earthquake and a terrible hailstorm.
계 12:1 Then I witnessed in heaven an event of great significance. I saw a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon beneath her feet, and a crown of twelve stars on her head.
계 12:2 She was pregnant, and she cried out because of her labor pains and the agony of giving birth.
계 12:3 Then I witnessed in heaven another significant event. I saw a large red dragon with seven heads and ten horns, with seven crowns on his heads.
계 12:4 His tail swept away one-third of the stars in the sky, and he threw them to the earth. He stood in front of the woman as she was about to give birth, ready to devour her baby as soon as it was born.
계 12:5 She gave birth to a son who was to rule all nations with an iron rod. And her child was snatched away from the dragon and was caught up to God and to his throne.
계 12:6 And the woman fled into the wilderness, where God had prepared a place to care for her for 1,260 days.
계 12:7 Then there was war in heaven. Michael and his angels fought against the dragon and his angels.
계 12:8 And the dragon lost the battle, and he and his angels were forced out of heaven.
계 12:9 This great dragon - the ancient serpent called the devil, or Satan, the one deceiving the whole world - was thrown down to the earth with all his angels.
계 12:10 Then I heard a loud voice shouting across the heavens, "It has come at last - salvation and power and the Kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Christ①. For the accuser of our brothers and sisters② has been thrown down to earth - the one who accuses them before our God day and night. / ①Or his Messiah ②Greek brothers
계 12:11 And they have defeated him by the blood of the Lamb and by their testimony. And they did not love their lives so much that they were afraid to die.
계 12:12 Therefore, rejoice, O heavens! And you who live in the heavens, rejoice! But terror will come on the earth and the sea, for the devil has come down to you in great anger, knowing that he has little time."
계 12:13 When the dragon realized that he had been thrown down to the earth, he pursued the woman who had given birth to the male child.
계 12:14 But she was given two wings like those of a great eagle so she could fly to the place prepared for her in the wilderness. There she would be cared for and protected from the dragon① for a time, times, and half a time. / ①Greek the serpent; also in 12.15. See 12.9
계 12:15 Then the dragon tried to drown the woman with a flood of water that flowed from his mouth.
계 12:16 But the earth helped her by opening its mouth and swallowing the river that gushed out from the mouth of the dragon.
계 12:17 And the dragon was angry at the woman and declared war against the rest of her children - all who keep God's commandments and maintain their testimony for Jesus.
계 12:18 Then the dragon took his stand① on the shore beside the sea. / ①Greek Then he took his stand; some manuscripts read Then I took my stand. Some translations put this entire sentence into 13.1
계 13:1 Then I saw a beast rising up out of the sea. It had seven heads and ten horns, with ten crowns on its horns. And written on each head were names that blasphemed God.
계 13:2 This beast looked like a leopard, but it had the feet of a bear and the mouth of a lion! And the dragon gave the beast his own power and throne and great authority.
계 13:3 I saw that one of the heads of the beast seemed wounded beyond recovery - but the fatal wound was healed! The whole world marveled at this miracle and gave allegiance to the beast.
계 13:4 They worshiped the dragon for giving the beast such power, and they also worshiped the beast. "Who is as great as the beast?" they exclaimed. "Who is able to fight against him?"
계 13:5 Then the beast was allowed to speak great blasphemies against God. And he was given authority to do whatever he wanted for forty-two months.
계 13:6 And he spoke terrible words of blasphemy against God, slandering his name and his dwelling - that is, those who dwell in heaven①. / ①Some manuscripts read and his dwelling and all who dwell in heaven
계 13:7 And the beast was allowed to wage war against God's holy people and to conquer them. And he was given authority to rule over every tribe and people and language and nation.
계 13:8 And all the people who belong to this world worshiped the beast. They are the ones whose names were not written in the Book of Life before the world was made - the Book that belongs to the Lamb who was slaughtered①. / ①Or not written in the Book of Life that belongs to the Lamb who was slaughtered before the world was made
계 13:9 Anyone with ears to hear should listen and understand.
계 13:10 Anyone who is destined for prison will be taken to prison. Anyone destined to die by the sword will die by the sword. This means that God's holy people must endure persecution patiently and remain faithful.
계 13:11 Then I saw another beast come up out of the earth. He had two horns like those of a lamb, but he spoke with the voice of a dragon.
계 13:12 He exercised all the authority of the first beast. And he required all the earth and its people to worship the first beast, whose fatal wound had been healed.
계 13:13 He did astounding miracles, even making fire flash down to earth from the sky while everyone was watching.
계 13:14 And with all the miracles he was allowed to perform on behalf of the first beast, he deceived all the people who belong to this world. He ordered the people to make a great statue of the first beast, who was fatally wounded and then came back to life.
계 13:15 He was then permitted to give life to this statue so that it could speak. Then the statue of the beast commanded that anyone refusing to worship it must die.
계 13:16 He required everyone - small and great, rich and poor, free and slave - to be given a mark on the right hand or on the forehead.
계 13:17 And no one could buy or sell anything without that mark, which was either the name of the beast or the number representing his name.
계 13:18 Wisdom is needed here. Let the one with understanding solve the meaning of the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man①. His number is 666②. / ①Or of humanity ②Some manuscripts read 616
계 14:1 Then I saw the Lamb standing on Mount Zion, and with him were 144,000 who had his name and his Father's name written on their foreheads.
계 14:2 And I heard a sound from heaven like the roar of mighty ocean waves or the rolling of loud thunder. It was like the sound of many harpists playing together.
계 14:3 This great choir sang a wonderful new song in front of the throne of God and before the four living beings and the twenty-four elders. No one could learn this song except the 144,000 who had been redeemed from the earth.
계 14:4 They have kept themselves as pure as virgins①, following the Lamb wherever he goes. They have been purchased from among the people on the earth as a special offering② to God and to the Lamb. / ①Greek They are virgins who have not defiled themselves with women ②Greek as firstfruits
계 14:5 They have told no lies; they are without blame.
계 14:6 And I saw another angel flying through the sky, carrying the eternal Good News to proclaim to the people who belong to this world - to every nation, tribe, language, and people.
계 14:7 "Fear God," he shouted. "Give glory to him. For the time has come when he will sit as judge. Worship him who made the heavens, the earth, the sea, and all the springs of water."
계 14:8 Then another angel followed him through the sky, shouting, "Babylon is fallen - that great city is fallen - because she made all the nations of the world drink the wine of her passionate immorality."
계 14:9 Then a third angel followed them, shouting, "Anyone who worships the beast and his statue or who accepts his mark on the forehead or on the hand
계 14:10 must drink the wine of God's anger. It has been poured full strength into God's cup of wrath. And they will be tormented with fire and burning sulfur in the presence of the holy angels and the Lamb.
계 14:11 The smoke of their torment will rise forever and ever, and they will have no relief day or night, for they have worshiped the beast and his statue and have accepted the mark of his name."
계 14:12 This means that God's holy people must endure persecution patiently, obeying his commands and maintaining their faith in Jesus.
계 14:13 And I heard a voice from heaven saying, "Write this down： Blessed are those who die in the Lord from now on. Yes, says the Spirit, they are blessed indeed, for they will rest from their hard work; for their good deeds follow them!"
계 14:14 Then I saw a white cloud, and seated on the cloud was someone like the Son of Man①. He had a gold crown on his head and a sharp sickle in his hand. / ①Or like a son of man. See Dan 7.13. "Son of Man" is a title Jesus used for himself
계 14:15 Then another angel came from the Temple and shouted to the one sitting on the cloud, "Swing the sickle, for the time of harvest has come; the crop on earth is ripe."
계 14:16 So the one sitting on the cloud swung his sickle over the earth, and the whole earth was harvested.
계 14:17 After that, another angel came from the Temple in heaven, and he also had a sharp sickle.
계 14:18 Then another angel, who had power to destroy with fire, came from the altar. He shouted to the angel with the sharp sickle, "Swing your sickle now to gather the clusters of grapes from the vines of the earth, for they are ripe for judgment."
계 14:19 So the angel swung his sickle over the earth and loaded the grapes into the great winepress of God's wrath.
